column1: What are the goals of this project?

The project is a pilot to create an ecologically sound, sustainable business model. In summary, consider how our forests are being destroyed and farming is being infused with harmful chemicals. This project is raising money to buy 90 hectares of land as a pilot project in Benin, West Africa. This land will be used to grow and harvest EPO (Ecological Palm Oil) to create jobs to make soap and oils for exporting around the world. The business processing activities will start in Africa where many graduate people are jobless, and thus contribute not only to the creation of a healthy environment, but a healthy local economy.
Why the choice of “Ecological Palm Oil (EPO) tree best to assist in the rescue of the environment and produce safe, quality products?

The EPO tree is different from hybrid varieties in that it doesn’t require the use of chemicals that could have a negative impact on environment. Its kernel shell is to be used as charcoal. No forest destruction and 30% of our investment in trees plantations. And more, wastes processing for sanitation and to feed ecollogically EPO's seedlings. Wildlife is safe.
Its empty bunch is used to make 100% natural soap and its mesocarp oil so fluider.

column2: >How will your raised funds be used?

column1: Funds will be used to buy 90 Hectares of land in Benin republic in Zou, Africa as the basis for a pilot program to grow, harvest and manufacture Ecological Palm Oil (EPO). We will buy 13,500 seedlings, 13,500 protective wires for seedlings, hire 4 agronomists, 1 accountant, purchase transportation, fund composting and pay our workforce. (See details in the tables and graphs below).

20% of funds will be saved for processing activities and trade in  Bank account. The dividends associated with 20% of funds in Bank account will be used for contingency expenses and casual labor related to processing activities. If this projection isn’t sufficient (Market’s fluctuation), another campaign could be launched to raise additional money or consider a bank loan.

column2: >What will be done if the needed funding isn’t raised or exceeds?

column1: The number of hectares of land will be reviewed in down or high .
What about ecology and environment protection?

Our forests are being destroyed and our farming land is more and more infected with use of some harmful chemicals. This impedes the development of organic agriculture our future generations! EPO doesn't need any use of chemicals.
For sustainable development and ecological balance, 30% of our profits each year will be reinvested into plantations.
EPO trees won't take chemical fertilizer but Compost to thrive well. It will help more for environment sanitation. Wildlife isn't affected.

column1: Our pilot program has a built-in infrastructure to invest in replacing forests as part of the manufacturing process.
ADVANTAGES OF NATURAL SOAP

column2: >It doesn’t involve use of any chemicals or manufactured products that could affect skin, protects against undesirable effects and is for skin's smoothing. It is a 100% natural soap. The processing activities consist of burning bunches of palm oil after removing nuts. The ash (raw material) is cooked for soap liquid extraction that is mixed to mesocarp oil. This cooking removes all residue and dirtiness water that are the remaining liquid when soap liquid extraction is over.

column1: The palm oil created through this project will be 100% natural soap with no chemicals, and is much safer for your skin.

Below is a short detailed project in french language
<div>
« Savon de santé naturel » et « Huiles fluides » avec la
plantation du Palmier à Huile Ecologique ou naturel (PHE).
Avec le palmier à huile de type écologique, nous pourrons stopper les désastres environnementaux.
Pourquoi
le choix du « Palmier à Huile Ecologique » pour sauver l'environnement et pour la fabrication du savon de santé 100% naturel et la production d’huiles fluides ?
PHE est le type de palmier naturel en constante diminution. Il est respectueux de l’environnement. Cet arbre ne demande pas l’usage de l’engrais
chimique qui pourrait impacter négativement l’environnement. Nous pensons que le Monde est confronté à beaucoup de défis. L’un des
gros défis est l’évitement de certains engrais chimiques souvent utilisés qui

détruisent l’environnement. Par exemple, on peut citer l’usage de certains engrais chimiques très décrié dans certains pays du monde dont l'Indonésie, la Malaysie, le Libéria, le Cameroun, l'Ouganda car nocif à l’environnement. Dans les deux
grands pays producteurs mondiaux de palmiers à huile de variété sélectionnée

que sont l’Indonésie et la Malaisie comme dans certains pays africains, la préoccupation d'alerte court les rues. Il faut aussi en remplaçant les terres par les palmiers à huile, compenser. Donc, 30% de notre investissement, chaque année, sera dans les plantations d'arbres.
avantages avec le palmier écologique :
·
pour limiter la déforestation, la coque
de la noix de palmiste peut remplacer le charbon de bois au foyer pour les
préparations du repas
·
Son régime extrait des noix est utilisé pour
la fabrication du savon <b>100%
naturel
·
Il vit pendant plus longtemps (Plus de
50 ans) que les palmiers sélectionnés de cycle végétatif ou de durée de 25 ans
·
Ses huiles sont plus fluides
·
Protection de l’environnement en
excluant l’usage de tout engrais chimique :
·
Protection de l’environnement par la
collecte des déchets pour la fabrication du compost destiné à son usage
·
Son utilisation quant improductif, pour
l’obtention du vin de palme
·
Son savon est sans quelconque produit
chimique et très mousseux
·
Grande quantité d’huile de palmiste.
Les
limites du palmier à huile écologique :
·
une quantité pas très grande d’huile
rouge
·
utilisation de la terre pendant longtemps si
non abattu
·
naturel si sauveur pour la peau et comment l’obtenir?
Il
ne requiert aucun usage de produits chimiques et est 100% naturel. Son
obtention consiste à brûler le reste du régime de noix après l’extraction des
noix. La cendre obtenue est préparée pour le prélèvement du liquide savonneux.
Ce procédé naturel permet de maintenir les saletés dans l’eau à jeter.  Le savon est obtenu suite à la transformation
du liquide mousseux dans l’huile de palme.
Quelques
bénéfices que procure l’huile de palme pour la santé ?
Huile de palme (Carotene)
augmente l’immunité
contre la cécité et possède des qualités anti-cancer. Ces huiles sont des
composantes naturelles pour la nourriture
pharmaceutique et agissent dans la réduction des effets nuisibles radicaux.
L’huile de palme détient une bonne quantité de vitamines A, D et E.
Quels
sont les objectifs du projet ?
Sur le plan économique
Il compte partager avec
le monde des produits de qualité avec strict respect et protection environnementale par la fabrication du savon 100%  naturel ainsi que la production d’huiles
fluides.
Sur
le plan écologique
Les réserves
forestières ne cessent d’être détruites et la terre subit une dégradation
avancée par l’usage de certains engrais nuisibles entravant toute production
biologique. PHE exclut l’usage d’engrais chimiques et la coque de son noix de
palmiste pourra valablement remplacer le charbon au foyer de préparation. Ce qui
limitera la déforestation.
La politique d’usage du
compost va également servir de tremplin pour l’assainissement par la collecte
des déchets à composter.
Sur le plan d’emploi
Ce projet
permettra  de recruter des jeunes non
seulement à l’étape de la plantation mais surtout lors des activités de
transformation au Bénin dans un contexte de chômage de plus en plus grandissant. Il permettra également dans les pays occidentaux... de recruter des jeunes pour
les activités de vente des produits manufacturés.
Où
ce projet sera installé ?
Ce projet expérimental couvrira 90
hectares et sera installé au Bénin.
les fonds collectés vont être utilisés ?
Ils serviront à acheter
90 hectares de terres à titre expérimental, 13500 pieds de palmier à planter, 13500 grillages de
protection des pieds. Ils permettront également de payer 4 agronomes, 1
comptable, le transport et les imprévues (Les détails sont dans le tableau
ci-dessus). Ces fonds permettront également de faire le compostage pour
nourrir les palmiers. 20% des fonds collectés seront prévus pour les activités
de transformations. Les dividendes y associées sur la période seront destinées
à couvrir les imprévues liées à la transformation.
se passera-t-il si le montant total du fonds n’est pas réuni ou excède ?

column1: Thanks for visiting and supporting Ecological Palm Oil!

","This pilot Ecological business is supported by international network of palm oil players for sustainable palm oil www.rspo.org. Our pilot program is aware of and responsive to climate and deforestation issues.
What does Ecological Palm Oil EPO mean?

It is an endangered natural and environmental  species of tree that produces fruits that can be processed to get fluider oils and 100% natural Soap with 0% of chemicals use. It is so sustainable and environmental as it doesn't use any chemicals but compost. Its kernel shell (Picture Below) is so resistant and inflammable to replace wood charcoal so that we limit deforestation in Africa and world...
Sustainable palm oil is imperative to rescue environment in disasters and EPO can do!
So many other benefits of EPO are given below!
A seedling of Ecological Palm Oil
Some seedlings of Ecological Palm Oil
Here are some trees (Despite its enormous environment and health benefits, Ecological Palm Oil is threatened by extinction over the coming years).
Here is a tree with some bunches.
Some EPO's bunches of ripe nuts.
To support this environment and health project,click on words""Back it"" in red above Perks on your right.
What are the goals of this project?

The project is a pilot to create an ecologically sound, sustainable business model. In summary, consider how our forests are being destroyed and farming is being infused with harmful chemicals. This project is raising money to buy 90 hectares of land as a pilot project in Benin, West Africa. This land will be used to grow and harvest EPO (Ecological Palm Oil) to create jobs to make soap and oils for exporting around the world. The business processing activities will start in Africa where many graduate people are jobless, and thus contribute not only to the creation of a healthy environment, but a healthy local economy.
Why the choice of “Ecological Palm Oil (EPO) tree best to assist in the rescue of the environment and produce safe, quality products?

The EPO tree is different from hybrid varieties in that it doesn’t require the use of chemicals that could have a negative impact on environment. Its kernel shell is to be used as charcoal. No forest destruction and 30% of our investment in trees plantations. And more, wastes processing for sanitation and to feed ecollogically EPO's seedlings. Wildlife is safe.
Its empty bunch is used to make 100% natural soap and its mesocarp oil so fluider.
How will your raised funds be used?

Funds will be used to buy 90 Hectares of land in Benin republic in Zou, Africa as the basis for a pilot program to grow, harvest and manufacture Ecological Palm Oil (EPO). We will buy 13,500 seedlings, 13,500 protective wires for seedlings, hire 4 agronomists, 1 accountant, purchase transportation, fund composting and pay our workforce. (See details in the tables and graphs below).

20% of funds will be saved for processing activities and trade in  Bank account. The dividends associated with 20% of funds in Bank account will be used for contingency expenses and casual labor related to processing activities. If this projection isn’t sufficient (Market’s fluctuation), another campaign could be launched to raise additional money or consider a bank loan.
What will be done if the needed funding isn’t raised or exceeds?
The number of hectares of land will be reviewed in down or high .
What about ecology and environment protection?

Our forests are being destroyed and our farming land is more and more infected with use of some harmful chemicals. This impedes the development of organic agriculture our future generations! EPO doesn't need any use of chemicals.
For sustainable development and ecological balance, 30% of our profits each year will be reinvested into plantations.
EPO trees won't take chemical fertilizer but Compost to thrive well. It will help more for environment sanitation. Wildlife isn't affected.
Our team
For any questions about perks or project, thank you for emailing or writing us: melmedisco@gmail.com
Table 1: Estimates for projecton 90 Hectares of land
Our website: www.ecologicalpalmoil.netai.net
Find our project page on twitter: https://twitter.com/AfricaPalm
Find our project page on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AfricaPalm
Thanks for visiting and supporting Ecological Palm Oil!
Our pilot program has a built-in infrastructure to invest in replacing forests as part of the manufacturing process.
ADVANTAGES OF NATURAL SOAP

It doesn’t involve use of any chemicals or manufactured products that could affect skin, protects against undesirable effects and is for skin's smoothing. It is a 100% natural soap. The processing activities consist of burning bunches of palm oil after removing nuts. The ash (raw material) is cooked for soap liquid extraction that is mixed to mesocarp oil. This cooking removes all residue and dirtiness water that are the remaining liquid when soap liquid extraction is over.
The palm oil created through this project will be 100% natural soap with no chemicals, and is much safer for your skin.
Oil after specific treatments full of natural compounds for food, vitamins A
Economy
We plan to share with the
World, quality products by making “Natural soap” and manufacturing ""fluider oils"" with strict respect of environment for sustainable development by avoiding disasters on natural ressources.
What about ecology and environment protection?
Our forests are
being destroyed and our farming land is more and more infected with use of some
harmful chemicals. What impedes any organic agriculture and future generations
life!
EPO doesn't need any use of chemicals.
The shell
of its kernel will replace Wood charcoal for cooking. So deforestation will be
limited.
Practice of composting to feed EPO's seedlings or trees in compost, will contribute to environmental sanitation.
30% of our investment will be,each year, into forests (emphasis on endangered species).
And
employment?
This project will contribute
to hire lots of people for plantation job, and especially when the processing
activities will start in Africa where many graduate people are jobless.
In Western countries..., trading activities of soap and
oils will be opportunity to hire workers.
Where
will the project be implemented?
This project will
be on 90 Hectares of land as a trial and will be implemented in Benin (West Africa).
Our website: www.ecologicalpalmoil.netai.net
Find our project page on twitter: https://twitter.com/AfricaPalm
Find our project page on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AfricaPalm
Thanks for visiting and supporting Ecological Palm Oil!
Below is a short detailed project in french language
« Savon de santé naturel » et « Huiles fluides » avec la
plantation du Palmier à Huile Ecologique ou naturel (PHE).
Avec le palmier à huile de type écologique, nous pourrons stopper les désastres environnementaux.
Pourquoi
le choix du « Palmier à Huile Ecologique » pour sauver l'environnement et pour la fabrication du savon de santé 100% naturel et la production d’huiles fluides ?
PHE est le type de palmier naturel en constante diminution. Il est respectueux de l’environnement. Cet arbre ne demande pas l’usage de l’engrais
chimique qui pourrait impacter négativement l’environnement. Nous pensons que le Monde est confronté à beaucoup de défis. L’un des
gros défis est l’évitement de certains engrais chimiques souvent utilisés qui

détruisent l’environnement. Par exemple, on peut citer l’usage de certains engrais chimiques très décrié dans certains pays du monde dont l'Indonésie, la Malaysie, le Libéria, le Cameroun, l'Ouganda car nocif à l’environnement. Dans les deux
grands pays producteurs mondiaux de palmiers à huile de variété sélectionnée

que sont l’Indonésie et la Malaisie comme dans certains pays africains, la préoccupation d'alerte court les rues. Il faut aussi en remplaçant les terres par les palmiers à huile, compenser. Donc, 30% de notre investissement, chaque année, sera dans les plantations d'arbres.
Quelques d’autres
avantages avec le palmier écologique :
pour limiter la déforestation, la coque
de la noix de palmiste peut remplacer le charbon de bois au foyer pour les
préparations du repas
Son régime extrait des noix est utilisé pour
la fabrication du savon 100%
naturel
Il vit pendant plus longtemps (Plus de
50 ans) que les palmiers sélectionnés de cycle végétatif ou de durée de 25 ans
Ses huiles sont plus fluides
Protection de l’environnement en
excluant l’usage de tout engrais chimique :
Protection de l’environnement par la
collecte des déchets pour la fabrication du compost destiné à son usage
Son utilisation quant improductif, pour
l’obtention du vin de palme
Son savon est sans quelconque produit
chimique et très mousseux
Grande quantité d’huile de palmiste.
Les
limites du palmier à huile écologique :
une quantité pas très grande d’huile
rouge
utilisation de la terre pendant longtemps si
non abattu
· Pourquoi le Savon
naturel si sauveur pour la peau et comment l’obtenir?
Il
ne requiert aucun usage de produits chimiques et est 100% naturel. Son
obtention consiste à brûler le reste du régime de noix après l’extraction des
noix. La cendre obtenue est préparée pour le prélèvement du liquide savonneux.
Ce procédé naturel permet de maintenir les saletés dans l’eau à jeter.  Le savon est obtenu suite à la transformation
du liquide mousseux dans l’huile de palme.
Quelques
bénéfices que procure l’huile de palme pour la santé ?
Huile de palme (Carotene)
augmente l’immunité
contre la cécité et possède des qualités anti-cancer. Ces huiles sont des
composantes naturelles pour la nourriture
pharmaceutique et agissent dans la réduction des effets nuisibles radicaux.
L’huile de palme détient une bonne quantité de vitamines A, D et E.
Quels
sont les objectifs du projet ?
Sur le plan économique
Il compte partager avec
le monde des produits de qualité avec strict respect et protection environnementale par la fabrication du savon 100%  naturel ainsi que la production d’huiles
fluides.
Sur
le plan écologique
Les réserves
forestières ne cessent d’être détruites et la terre subit une dégradation
avancée par l’usage de certains engrais nuisibles entravant toute production
biologique. PHE exclut l’usage d’engrais chimiques et la coque de son noix de
palmiste pourra valablement remplacer le charbon au foyer de préparation. Ce qui
limitera la déforestation.
La politique d’usage du
compost va également servir de tremplin pour l’assainissement par la collecte
des déchets à composter.
Sur le plan d’emploi
Ce projet
permettra  de recruter des jeunes non
seulement à l’étape de la plantation mais surtout lors des activités de
transformation au Bénin dans un contexte de chômage de plus en plus grandissant. Il permettra également dans les pays occidentaux... de recruter des jeunes pour
les activités de vente des produits manufacturés.
Où
ce projet sera installé ?
Ce projet expérimental couvrira 90
hectares et sera installé au Bénin.
Comment
les fonds collectés vont être utilisés ?
Ils serviront à acheter
90 hectares de terres à titre expérimental, 13500 pieds de palmier à planter, 13500 grillages de
protection des pieds. Ils permettront également de payer 4 agronomes, 1
comptable, le transport et les imprévues (Les détails sont dans le tableau
ci-dessus). Ces fonds permettront également de faire le compostage pour
nourrir les palmiers. 20% des fonds collectés seront prévus pour les activités
de transformations. Les dividendes y associées sur la période seront destinées
à couvrir les imprévues liées à la transformation.
Que
se passera-t-il si le montant total du fonds n’est pas réuni ou excède ?
Les estimations en hectares initialement prévues vont être revues à la baisse ou en hausse.

With the money raised from this campaign I would like to expand my small bee business and educated as many new beekeepers as I can on how to manage a hive. Did you buy a flow hive? Not sure where to get the bees to put in it? Or maybe you have just always wanted to have your own hive. Whatever the case may be I'm here to help. I can provide anyone in the lower 48 states with the bees needed to start a flow hive or standard hive. I can provide a 3 lb package of bees and new marked Italian or carniolan queen. With these bees and my expert advice your flow hive will be flowing and stay flowing for many years to come.

Everyone
needs to go away sometimes, to the place where they can feel safe,
welcome and with ease with themselves. We used to say - to recharge
batteries, but isn't better to say something more natural? Let's say
- a place where you can find your soul and be yourself again.
<i>Każdy
z nas czasem potrzebuje czasu dla siebie, miejsca gdzie może poczuć
się bezpiecznie i spokojnie na tyle, by odnaleźć swoją duszę i
znowu stać się sobą.
been searching for myself long. I've been to many places, learned
about life, art, cultures, worked in England, Poland, Gibraltar and
Spain. I searched until I found eco art - something that connected
art and environment in my heart. After few years of teaching eco art
in Gibraltar and Spain, I felt I was ready for another challenge.
That's when I found a place I fell in love with – my LAND and my
HOME, and I called Eco Spirit.
<i>Długo
szukałam miejsca na świecie, które mogłabym nazwać SWOIM. Po
kilku latach pomieszkiwania w różnych krajach, w końcu znalazłam
swój wymarzony skrawek świata – Tarifę w hiszpańskiej
Andaluzji.
<i>Przez
kilka lat uczyłam Eco Artu na Gibraltarze i w Hiszpanii. Wybrałam tę dziedzinę,
bo wspaniale łączy w moim sercu, najważniejsze dla mnie rzeczy –
ekologię i sztukę. Rok temu dołączył do nich trzeci element –
natura. Tak powstało Eco Spirit – mój fragment wszechświata, w
którym chcę dzielić się z innymi tym, co dla mnie naistotniejsze,
miłością do ekologii, sztuki i natury.
<b>The
idea of the Eco Spirit Project/ Idea projektu Eco Spirit
My
idea is to create a safe place for children, where they can play and
explore the nature, learning how to understand and take care of the
environment, all in a funny relaxed atmosphere during different
workshops.
I
hope to make Eco Spirit place to remember, where children are treated
with respect and understood, where they can come closer to the nature

and to themselves.

Providing kids with the opportunity to
explore the world of art and nature, Eco Spirit is trying to open
their young minds to the greatest of gifts ... CREATIVITY!
<i>W
przepięknie usytuowanej na stoku góry, La Pena, położonej tylko
kilka kilometrów od centrum Tarify, rok temu powstało Eco Spirit –
miejsce, w którym dzieci w trakcie zabawy, mają możliwość
kontaktu z naturą i sztuką, nauczenia się jak dbać o środowisko
naturalne, wszystko we wspaniałej atmosferze i na świeżym
powietrzu. Idealne warunki do rozwijania ich największego daru –
kreatywności.
of the activities at Eco Spirit/ Wybrane aktywności
<b>Eco
Art - workshops aimed help children discover and create new
ways of combining their ideas with green art – introducing them
into the world of drawing, painting, sculpture, all in the best
way... by contact with the nature.
Young
crafters learn about separating paper from plastic, tin or glass, and
about how to recognise the international recycling symbols printed on
packaging. At their turn they ‘spread the word’ with family and
friends, little by little channelling the community at large in the
right frame of mind towards reusing and recycling.
They
also learn that when they give to nature, they receive much more in
exchange: they are encouraged getting in touch with nature by
collecting pebbles, shells, twigs and leaves, which make excellent
base materials for their artwork.
During
the workshops we use recycled materials (disposable items) and teach
children how to change them into useful products again.
<i><b>Eco
Art - zajęcia plastyczne, które mają na celu pomóc dzieciom w
odkrywaniu nowych dróg w trakcie
artystycznych poszukiwań, z wykorzystaniem green artu. W trakcie
zajęć dzieci uczą się jak tworzyć nowe rzeczy z surowców
wtórnych i materiałów naturalnych. Dowiadują się, że
dobra zabawa nie musi wiązać się z nowymi produktami - wystarczą plastikowe butelki, papiery, kartony i to, co nas otacza - kamienie,
patyki, liście, cała otaczająca nas
natura.
<i>Przy
okazji zajęć dzieci uczą się też
jak najlepiej sortować śmieci i ponownie wykorzystywać
niektóre materiały, aby oszczędzać i
chronić naturę.
riding –
activities when children get to know horses behaviour, build real
bonds of friendship and trust. Spending time with horses helps them
to calm down an chill. The energy is really magical, building
self-confidence, strengthening personality and solving some of health
problems. During these activities children learn how to concentrate,
take responsibility and treat animals with love.
<i><b>Jazda
konna – zajęcia, w trakcie których dzieci uczą
się nie tylko jazdy konnej, ale również jak dbać o zwierzęta,
nawiązać z nimi kontakt i zaprzyjaźnić się. Kontakt ze
zwierzętami pomaga w nauce koncentracji, uczy odpowiedzialności i
okazywania miłości

zwierzętom.

Other
workshops and educational programs –
gardening&amp
cooking and baking, nature exploring walks, yoga, environment
lectures, recycling, dance classes, reading. The list constantly
grows.
The
future plans comprises of introducing workshops for adults i.e. yoga,
meditation, and implementing Eco programs into local schools, as well
as Clean Up The World event in Tarifa.
Pozostałe
warsztaty i programy edukacyjne dla dzieci – ogrodnictwo,
gotowanie, pieczenie, odkrywanie natury, joga, odczyty o ochronie
środowiska, recycling, lekcje tańca, wspólne czytanie. Lista zajęć
jest uzupełniana cały czas.
W
przyszłości planowane jest organizowanie zajęć dla dorosłych
(medytacja, joga) oraz wprowadzenie programów o świadomości

ekologicznej do szkół, razem w imprezą Clean Up The World.

Eco
Spirit as an Educational Program/ Eco Spirit jako
program edukacyjny
For
me Eco Spirit is not only a beautiful place, where you can come back
to find a balance of body mind and soul. I have it mind because we
all need time to reflect, breath consciously again, calm and find
peace in ourselves, but...
I
always thought of Eco Spirit as about more educational project, where
we and our children can find answers, how to live respecting the
nature, other cultures and ourselves, as we are the part of it. Open
ourselves to the whole world, meaningful ways of life, with its
natural forces, conditions and rhythms.
Despite
different priorities in life, we all would like to take care of our
children and the world around them, just to make it the best place to
live. Wouldn't it be great to be able to come to the place where we
can share our concerns, thoughts, hopes and find the solutions?
Eco
Spirit Tarifa to nie tylko wspaniałe schronienie dla duszy i ciała,
to także miejsce, gdzie dzieci mogą nauczyć się jak szanować
naturę i inne kultury. Otworzyć się na cały świat wokół,
wybrać najbardziej wartościowe ścieżki, nauczyć jak żyć
zgodnie z naturalnym rytmem ziemi.
Niezależnie
od różnych priorytetów w życiu, wszyscy mamy jedną rzecz wspólną
– chcemy tego co najlepsze dla naszych dzieci i pragniemy by
wzrastały w pięknym świecie.
Dlatego
staram się stworzyć miejsce atrakcyjne nie tylko dla dzieci, ale
również dla dorosłych, tak aby mieli gdzie się udać, gdy chcą
odpocząć i poznać podobnie myślących ludzi.
am I here?/
postanowiłam skorzystać z platformy IndieGoGo?
I
put a lot of effort into making Eco Spirit my home. With the help of
my friends, I gathered bushes, made a space for horses and ponies,
built special construction where my workshops can take place and
where I can live with my animal friends.
It
all happened in less than a year!

Rok temu, przy pomocy przyjaciół i rodziny, często samodzielnie, zmieniłam gąszcz krzaków i karczowisko w dom. Kosztowało mnie to dużo wysiłku, przekopane zostały dziesiątki metrów, zbudowane pierwsze zabudowania, rozpoczęłam pierwsze zajęcia. To był bardzo trudny, ale też wspaniały czas. Jak zwykle gdy czujesz, że budujesz coś nowego i całkowicie zgodnego z tym o czym zawsze marzyłeś.


All these important things I mentioned before, like learning about nature and art, pony riding, workshops and other attractions for children and adults, has been already happening at Eco Spirit, and loads of more was planned... until two weeks ago.

Two weeks ago I was informed that my rent-to buy contract has to be changed and I needs to pay for the land at once. Otherwise I will need to leave it to somebody else, because the owner needs to sell it ASAP.

It's one of this hard, life-changing decisions all of us need to make sometimes - to go or fight. I decided to stay, but I need to ask you for help. It's hard to collect 90 000 Euros in 4 weeks, even if you work very hard. I've already managed to save 20 000 Euros, but I still need 70 000 Euros...

It would be so wonderful if all of you could support me, please, and bit by bit, day by day, we would manage to collect the whole amount of money. Something like a community of Eco Spirit supporters :)

Do you think you could join me, please? Thank you from all my heart for all your help, time and donations x

My favourite sentence, I have always in my head is 'Children create a future. If we can help them create a better future, I think that is one of the ideas.' Please help me make this dream come true, Ania.
column5:
>Niestety kilka tygodni temu okazało się, że umowa typu rent-to-buy, dzięki której czułam się bezpiecznie (czynsz, który płaciłam szedł akonto kupna działki), musi zostać zerwana, bo właścicielka w trybie pilnym potrzebuje pieniędzy. Niestety nie mogę wziąć kredytu hipotecznego, ponieważ brakuje jednego dokumentu i nie ma możliwośći, żeby go szybko wystawić. Procedura potrwa rok, a ja tego czasu nie mam.

Liczyłam, że zdołam się porozumieć z właścicielką. Niestety – jeśli nie zbiorę wymaganej kwoty, za 4 tygodnie czeka nas, moje zwierzęta i mnie, eksmisja.

Zdołałam już zorganizować część wymaganej kwoty, ale nadal potrzebuję 70 tysięcy Euro. Olbrzymia suma, ale mam nadzieję, żę wspólnie uda nam się zebrać chociaż jej część.

Dziękuję za wszelką pomoc, rady jak wybrnąć z tej sytuacjii oraz datki pieniężne.

Mam ulubioną myśl, którą często sobie powtarzam – Dzieci tworzą przyszłość. Naszym zadaniem jest im pomóc, tak aby ich przyszłość była jak najlepsza. To moje wielkie marzenie. Proszę pomóżcie mi je zrealizować. Dziękuję, Ania.

idea of the Eco Spirit Project/ Idea projektu Eco Spirit
My
idea is to create a safe place for children, where they can play and
explore the nature, learning how to understand and take care of the
environment, all in a funny relaxed atmosphere during different
workshops.
I
hope to make Eco Spirit place to remember, where children are treated
with respect and understood, where they can come closer to the nature
and to themselves.Providing kids with the opportunity to
explore the world of art and nature, Eco Spirit is trying to open
their young minds to the greatest of gifts ... CREATIVITY!
W
przepięknie usytuowanej na stoku góry, La Pena, położonej tylko
kilka kilometrów od centrum Tarify, rok temu powstało Eco Spirit –
miejsce, w którym dzieci w trakcie zabawy, mają możliwość
kontaktu z naturą i sztuką, nauczenia się jak dbać o środowisko
naturalne, wszystko we wspaniałej atmosferze i na świeżym
powietrzu. Idealne warunki do rozwijania ich największego daru –
kreatywności.
Some
of the activities at Eco Spirit/ Wybrane aktywności
Eco
Art - workshops aimed help children discover and create new
ways of combining their ideas with green art – introducing them
into the world of drawing, painting, sculpture, all in the best
way... by contact with the nature.
Young
crafters learn about separating paper from plastic, tin or glass, and
about how to recognise the international recycling symbols printed on
packaging. At their turn they ‘spread the word’ with family and
friends, little by little channelling the community at large in the
right frame of mind towards reusing and recycling.
They
also learn that when they give to nature, they receive much more in
exchange: they are encouraged getting in touch with nature by
collecting pebbles, shells, twigs and leaves, which make excellent
base materials for their artwork.
During
the workshops we use recycled materials (disposable items) and teach
children how to change them into useful products again.
Eco
Art - zajęcia plastyczne, które mają na celu pomóc dzieciom w
odkrywaniu nowych dróg w trakcie
artystycznych poszukiwań, z wykorzystaniem green artu. W trakcie
zajęć dzieci uczą się jak tworzyć nowe rzeczy z surowców
wtórnych i materiałów naturalnych. Dowiadują się, że
dobra zabawa nie musi wiązać się z nowymi produktami - wystarczą plastikowe butelki, papiery, kartony i to, co nas otacza - kamienie,
patyki, liście, cała otaczająca nas
natura.
Przy
okazji zajęć dzieci uczą się też
jak najlepiej sortować śmieci i ponownie wykorzystywać
niektóre materiały, aby oszczędzać i
chronić naturę.
Horse
riding –
activities when children get to know horses behaviour, build real
bonds of friendship and trust. Spending time with horses helps them
to calm down an chill. The energy is really magical, building
self-confidence, strengthening personality and solving some of health
problems. During these activities children learn how to concentrate,
take responsibility and treat animals with love.
Jazda
konna – zajęcia, w trakcie których dzieci uczą
się nie tylko jazdy konnej, ale również jak dbać o zwierzęta,
nawiązać z nimi kontakt i zaprzyjaźnić się. Kontakt ze
zwierzętami pomaga w nauce koncentracji, uczy odpowiedzialności i
okazywania miłości
zwierzętom.Other
workshops and educational programs –
gardening&planting,
cooking and baking, nature exploring walks, yoga, environment
lectures, recycling, dance classes, reading. The list constantly
grows.
The
future plans comprises of introducing workshops for adults i.e. yoga,
meditation, and implementing Eco programs into local schools, as well
as Clean Up The World event in Tarifa.
Pozostałe
warsztaty i programy edukacyjne dla dzieci – ogrodnictwo,
gotowanie, pieczenie, odkrywanie natury, joga, odczyty o ochronie
środowiska, recycling, lekcje tańca, wspólne czytanie. Lista zajęć
jest uzupełniana cały czas.
W
przyszłości planowane jest organizowanie zajęć dla dorosłych
(medytacja, joga) oraz wprowadzenie programów o świadomości
ekologicznej do szkół, razem w imprezą Clean Up The World.Eco
Spirit as an Educational Program/ Eco Spirit jako
program edukacyjny
For
me Eco Spirit is not only a beautiful place, where you can come back
to find a balance of body mind and soul. I have it mind because we
all need time to reflect, breath consciously again, calm and find
peace in ourselves, but...
I
always thought of Eco Spirit as about more educational project, where
we and our children can find answers, how to live respecting the
nature, other cultures and ourselves, as we are the part of it. Open
ourselves to the whole world, meaningful ways of life, with its
natural forces, conditions and rhythms.
Despite
different priorities in life, we all would like to take care of our
children and the world around them, just to make it the best place to
live. Wouldn't it be great to be able to come to the place where we
can share our concerns, thoughts, hopes and find the solutions?
Eco
Spirit Tarifa to nie tylko wspaniałe schronienie dla duszy i ciała,
to także miejsce, gdzie dzieci mogą nauczyć się jak szanować
naturę i inne kultury. Otworzyć się na cały świat wokół,
wybrać najbardziej wartościowe ścieżki, nauczyć jak żyć
zgodnie z naturalnym rytmem ziemi.
Niezależnie
od różnych priorytetów w życiu, wszyscy mamy jedną rzecz wspólną
– chcemy tego co najlepsze dla naszych dzieci i pragniemy by
wzrastały w pięknym świecie.
Dlatego
staram się stworzyć miejsce atrakcyjne nie tylko dla dzieci, ale
również dla dorosłych, tak aby mieli gdzie się udać, gdy chcą
odpocząć i poznać podobnie myślących ludzi.Why
am I here?/ Dlaczego
postanowiłam skorzystać z platformy IndieGoGo?
I
put a lot of effort into making Eco Spirit my home. With the help of
my friends, I gathered bushes, made a space for horses and ponies,
built special construction where my workshops can take place and
where I can live with my animal friends.
It
all happened in less than a year!

Rok temu, przy pomocy przyjaciół i rodziny, często samodzielnie, zmieniłam gąszcz krzaków i karczowisko w dom. Kosztowało mnie to dużo wysiłku, przekopane zostały dziesiątki metrów, zbudowane pierwsze zabudowania, rozpoczęłam pierwsze zajęcia. To był bardzo trudny, ale też wspaniały czas. Jak zwykle gdy czujesz, że budujesz coś nowego i całkowicie zgodnego z tym o czym zawsze marzyłeś.All these important things I mentioned before, like learning about nature and art, pony riding, workshops and other attractions for children and adults, has been already happening at Eco Spirit, and loads of more was planned... until two weeks ago.Two weeks ago I was informed that my rent-to buy contract has to be changed and I needs to pay for the land at once. Otherwise I will need to leave it to somebody else, because the owner needs to sell it ASAP.It's one of this hard, life-changing decisions all of us need to make sometimes - to go or fight. I decided to stay, but I need to ask you for help. It's hard to collect 90 000 Euros in 4 weeks, even if you work very hard. I've already managed to save 20 000 Euros, but I still need 70 000 Euros...It would be so wonderful if all of you could support me, please, and bit by bit, day by day, we would manage to collect the whole amount of money. Something like a community of Eco Spirit supporters :)Do you think you could join me, please? Thank you from all my heart for all your help, time and donations xMy favourite sentence, I have always in my head is 'Children create a future. If we can help them create a better future, I think that is one of the ideas.' Please help me make this dream come true, Ania.Niestety kilka tygodni temu okazało się, że umowa typu rent-to-buy, dzięki której czułam się bezpiecznie (czynsz, który płaciłam szedł akonto kupna działki), musi zostać zerwana, bo właścicielka w trybie pilnym potrzebuje pieniędzy. Niestety nie mogę wziąć kredytu hipotecznego, ponieważ brakuje jednego dokumentu i nie ma możliwośći, żeby go szybko wystawić. Procedura potrwa rok, a ja tego czasu nie mam.Liczyłam, że zdołam się porozumieć z właścicielką. Niestety – jeśli nie zbiorę wymaganej kwoty, za 4 tygodnie czeka nas, moje zwierzęta i mnie, eksmisja.Zdołałam już zorganizować część wymaganej kwoty, ale nadal potrzebuję 70 tysięcy Euro. Olbrzymia suma, ale mam nadzieję, żę wspólnie uda nam się zebrać chociaż jej część.Dziękuję za wszelką pomoc, rady jak wybrnąć z tej sytuacjii oraz datki pieniężne.Mam ulubioną myśl, którą często sobie powtarzam – Dzieci tworzą przyszłość. Naszym zadaniem jest im pomóc, tak aby ich przyszłość była jak najlepsza. To moje wielkie marzenie. Proszę pomóżcie mi je zrealizować. Dziękuję, Ania.",8.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Tarifa, Spain",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/please-help-me-save-eco-spirit-tarifa/pica

Jaspreet Singh Walia, a.k.a Jazz, has always loved to travel. New Delhi, the capital of India, and the city he hails from, has seen a huge rise in air pollution in the last decade and has been at an alarming rate for the last two years. Smoke and fog have blinded the city and people have to wear masks everyday.
From his early years as a kid, sleeping underneath the stars and looking at how vast and blue the sky was, the current age has seen a contrast that isn't so easy to accept.
After looking at the city's air quality index hit the maximum number, he decided he wants to do something about it. This, is how The Comma Project, came to life.
A Comma, used to give a slight pause, is what the city needs. We need to give it a break and let it breathe.

Research of a year and a half helped him develop a product, that would not only vacuum all the pollution and the dirt, but use it as fertilizers - so we take pollution, use it to grow more plants - which will further purify the air.

This is how the product came to life and now is at a stage where it needs your support to raise funds. We need these funds to finish our research and development and take this product out in the city. We are hoping we find some investors who agree to come on board and help us make not only the city of Delhi, but every other pollution struck city in a world, a cleaner place to breathe in.
Breathe and let breathe.

Short Summary

Can you believe that people living on a gigantic island have lost almost all access to water? Why should we step up and take matters into our own hands? In the past 10 years the Urban Growth Boundary of Charleston City has caused our population to grow tremendously and Johns Island has taken on 81% of the city's new growth.  But so far neither County or City municipalities or park systems have provided public access to water, except for under the Limehouse Bridge. Rampant developer interests have won out here between developing Charleston, SC and Kiawah Island, but we are working with everyone we can to bring water back to the people of Johns Island. As people who live here, we know how important this precious resource is to our community. We are stepping up to secure it for our whole community, before it is all gone.
One centralized property can provide so many solutions to our area, and that's exactly what we intend to do.
<ul>
• Restore access to water for the people of Johns Island and surrounding areas == 14 acres of fresh spring fed ponds to bring the family and meet your neighbors.

• Provide common ground through common interest and meeting community needs == A community is stronger, happier, less wasteful, and more united when everyone feels welcome and knows they have a real community space to interact through common interest.

• Nature programming for children both young and old == We all need less time looking at squares and living in squares, and more time in organic open space with movement that is not an hour or so away.

• Multi-Cultural Community Center and circular economy commerce space == True solutions are holistic, include meeting several needs at once, and grassroots means supporting the local economy and sharing resources. That's what we're all about.
It takes a village to be a village. Outreach to meet whole community needs is paramount as we preserve land and culture, diversify land and culture and sustain land and culture.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We have spent 10 years listening to the multi-cultural needs of our community as it is being rapidly developed, and 14 months in due diligence and business planning for this unique water access property. Local Pulse LLC was formed in response to research and meetings on both non and for profit avenues of business and how to best meet the needs of the community while also acting quickly to secure land in a competitive market. What we need now is grassroots support for a down payment to secure the property while we continue our other funding efforts. We are actively working within almost every avenue of fund seeking possible, including applications to correctly suited grants, co-hosting events that aid society and grassroots entrepreneurs, seeking investors and sponsors, land preservation avenues, and so on. The seller is willing to work with us, as we have a legally binding contract that states 2 important things: 1) He will not be gentrified, he may stay and live out his days in the home he built until his death. 2) The property will be used to provide Public Access to Water and a Multi-Cultural Community &
<ul>
<li>What We Need = Fund drive goal here is $111,000 which would allow the down payment + taxes &amp

<li>What You Will Get = 1) The satisfaction of looking back on your life and knowing you made a huge and tangible impact for WATER and PEOPLE and CULTURE and SOCIETY and NATURE and SOLUTIONS.... 2) We have some awesome POND PARTIES &amp
column2: CONCERT PERKS that are sure to bring a huge smile to your face and help you meet some new friends.

column1: Long term plans will include all the financial work mentioned above as well as support from our wonderful team. You can see many of their logos on our sponsor page of the website at www.localpulseji.com/sponsors/  This team includes: accountant, developer, lawyers, natural builder, architects, landscapers, growers, etc. Once we secure funding for the property, we look to take a loan on the land to build out the facilities, at apx. 1.6M. The Community Education &
column2: Event Center will be built to accommodate community needs, growth and opportunities. Until then, we will keep up events to fund the liability insurance so that people can come together to be on the pond and enjoy access to water.

column1: The Impact

Place Based Impact is extremely important in a rapidly growing community that is being further isolated and loosing it's resources.  We live in a country where separation and bias are the norm. We are taught to isolate ourselves, and put in boxes and categories that do not create the true joy connection and strength through our differences.  Even though, on most accounts, we are very much the same. We are a country that greatly needs to heal from past atrocities and have space that is steeped in multi-cultural togetherness and opportunity for growth.  A country so consumed by consumerism that our children are literally missing out on much of what we hold dear. Our very neurons need the simplicity of light and sky and reflection. This dirt was scraped away and re-nourished by fresh aquifer water. The seeds for addressing today's most pressing concerns will be watered and cared for here.
<ul>
• Our communities are much more resilient to disasters, storms, etc. when we have a concrete place to develop relationships outside of our boxes and resources like fresh water to rely on.
• Bias, whether racial or environmental or misinformed, is most effectively cured by exposure. Space for togetherness in nature is the right kind of exposure.
• Where country meets the city can be a difficult transition, but also a beautiful compromise if we make space for both.

• Nature Programming is so simple and powerful. Having spent the past 15 years providing for kids to play in the woods, we are thrilled to bring this to the larger community. This space will invite people participate in archery, kayaking, fort building, mud making, gardening, cooking and address social issues with group council, support and eye to eye conversation. Cross Cultural Bridge Club anyone? Local Skills Workshops from the Masters anyone?  Bridging community in support and mutual benefit with every step.
<h3>Risks &amp

If we don't find enough funding, well, that means not being able to make this property a space for true community in nature. It is not something we are releasing easily. Every stone will be turned to secure funding for this solution center for Johns Island. If we do not get enough to secure the property, we will be 100% transparent on where the money goes with regards to next best decisions for our community.
<ul>
• Since Public Access to Water is the anchor of this campaign, if we are unable to fund this property, we will seek the next best place to influence access to water on Johns Island.

• The funds raised here, therefore, will go toward creating Public Access to Water for Johns Islanders either through creek, river, or fresh water access. We would seek other available spots to meet this mission, and take feedback and keep you informed along the way.
• Another option would be to be part of a Land Trust conservancy effort, preferably one that would still involve public access to water.

• If we end up with funds waiting on us to find the next best effort at water access, we will put the money from this campaign into a high interest savings accounts (through American Express for example) that offer over 1% interest at no charge.
Other Ways You Can Help
We would love for you to join our team in adding your gifts and talents to the cause.
<ul>
• Spreading the word about what we are working on through your neighborhood, groups, communities, friends and families is very helpful.
• If you have specific talents and info to share, we would be grateful to collaborate.

Thank you so much for your time and consideration to this mission, our people and planet.

Welcome!


I’M INTRIGUED, BUT HAVEN’T SEEN THE FILM

If you’ve arrived at our Indiegogo page and have yet to see the film, fear not! What Lies Upstream will be widely available starting on January 16th, 2018. If you help fund our outreach campaign at $20 or more, you’ll receive a DVD upon release!

I’VE SEEN THE FILM AND WANT TO HELP

We are super grateful that the film resonated with you and now you want to see change. That’s why this page exists. Real systemic change doesn’t happen overnight, that’s why we have an actionable plan that happens in steps. The first step is awareness. We want more people to think like you do.

 

STEP 1 - Nationwide Screenings (Earth Day)

Every $500 we raise enables us to host a community screening. These screenings will occur simultaneously on Earth Day, 2018 in movie theaters, college campuses, and hosted venues. We have a few amazing partners like Roco Films and The Film Collaborative helping us make these screenings a reality.

What makes these screenings truly special is the discussions that will follow. Working with organizations like the Sierra Club, we’ll be discussing water problems that are relevant to each community using the latest independent research conducted by ewg.org.

At every screening, we’ll be building momentum and finding more people like you who want to see politics separated from science. As our collective voice grows, we will move on to step 2.

 

STEP 2 - State by State Regulatory Change (Beyond Earth Day)

If we hit our first goal, after Earth Day we can move into Step 2: getting our regulators to do their jobs right. This means rethinking the foundation of how regulatory agencies operate. If it sounds like a big idea, you’re right. Real change isn’t simple, and the fix isn’t either.

That’s why we need to hire experts to draft a new framework for scientific agencies and get it pushed through at the state level. This is where engaged people like yourself become vital to the fight. We’ll need to be calling and emailing state representatives like crazy.

 

We have three major requirements for this change:

1) Increased Accountability for Scientific Agencies

Right now, regulators are not incentivized to find bad things, so they don’t enforce the regulations that already exist. By adding independent 3rd party audits, we can improve the quality of enforcement and the safety of public health. For every dollar spent on Government Accountability, it yields a whopping $78 in financial benefits!

Government Audit Institutions:Meeting the Challenges of the 21st Century

 

2) An End to Political Appointments of Scientific Agencies

As it stands, heads of scientific agencies are currently beholden to the politicians that appoint them--typically the governor. As shown in the film, these politicians are bound by their ties to special interests who undermine science for profit. We suggest letting scientists decide how their agencies are run instead of special interests.

 

3) Guaranteed Financial Support

When a crisis happens, regulatory agencies are often threatened with funding cuts. The result is that agencies are afraid of revealing problems, upholding transparency, and communicating with the public. By securing scientific agency funding, we separate their responsibility to find bad things from the unpredictability of public perception.

Once we raise funds, we’ll be targeting change in states where we have the greatest likelihood of success. Once a state has adopted a policy, it becomes much easier to get other states to adopt that same policy. This is how we get real change… one state at a time.

 

","Welcome!I’M INTRIGUED, BUT HAVEN’T SEEN THE FILMIf you’ve arrived at our Indiegogo page and have yet to see the film, fear not! What Lies Upstream will be widely available starting on January 16th, 2018. If you help fund our outreach campaign at $20 or more, you’ll receive a DVD upon release!I’VE SEEN THE FILM AND WANT TO HELPWe are super grateful that the film resonated with you and now you want to see change. That’s why this page exists. Real systemic change doesn’t happen overnight, that’s why we have an actionable plan that happens in steps. The first step is awareness. We want more people to think like you do. STEP 1 - Nationwide Screenings (Earth Day)Every $500 we raise enables us to host a community screening. These screenings will occur simultaneously on Earth Day, 2018 in movie theaters, college campuses, and hosted venues. We have a few amazing partners like Roco Films and The Film Collaborative helping us make these screenings a reality.What makes these screenings truly special is the discussions that will follow. Working with organizations like the Sierra Club, we’ll be discussing water problems that are relevant to each community using the latest independent research conducted by ewg.org.At every screening, we’ll be building momentum and finding more people like you who want to see politics separated from science. As our collective voice grows, we will move on to step 2. STEP 2 - State by State Regulatory Change (Beyond Earth Day)If we hit our first goal, after Earth Day we can move into Step 2: getting our regulators to do their jobs right. This means rethinking the foundation of how regulatory agencies operate. If it sounds like a big idea, you’re right. Real change isn’t simple, and the fix isn’t either.That’s why we need to hire experts to draft a new framework for scientific agencies and get it pushed through at the state level. This is where engaged people like yourself become vital to the fight. We’ll need to be calling and emailing state representatives like crazy. We have three major requirements for this change:1) Increased Accountability for Scientific AgenciesRight now, regulators are not incentivized to find bad things, so they don’t enforce the regulations that already exist. By adding independent 3rd party audits, we can improve the quality of enforcement and the safety of public health. For every dollar spent on Government Accountability, it yields a whopping $78 in financial benefits!Government Audit Institutions:Meeting the Challenges of the 21st Century 2) An End to Political Appointments of Scientific AgenciesAs it stands, heads of scientific agencies are currently beholden to the politicians that appoint them--typically the governor. As shown in the film, these politicians are bound by their ties to special interests who undermine science for profit. We suggest letting scientists decide how their agencies are run instead of special interests. 3) Guaranteed Financial SupportWhen a crisis happens, regulatory agencies are often threatened with funding cuts. The result is that agencies are afraid of revealing problems, upholding transparency, and communicating with the public. By securing scientific agency funding, we separate their responsibility to find bad things from the unpredictability of public perception.Once we raise funds, we’ll be targeting change in states where we have the greatest likelihood of success. Once a state has adopted a policy, it becomes much easier to get other states to adopt that same policy. This is how we get real change… one state at a time.",4.0,1,"1 Campaign

BULK App : a useful tool for the Zero Waste community around the world
Tired of
fiddling with packaging? Want to help the environment? Shopping the
package-free aisles can also save you time and money, but only if you know
where to find them!
Hi my name is

Bea Johnson. I am the author of the book and the blog <a href=""https://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/save-the-bulk-app/Not%20so%20long%20ago,%20Zero%20Waste%20living%20was%20considered%20an%20utopia,%20today%20thousands%20of%20people%20have%20adopted%20the%20zero%20waste%20lifestyle,%20and%20prove%20that%20it%20is%20now%20a%20reality.%20%20Help%20us%20save%20the%20Bulk%20app%20today,%20and%20you%20will%20continue%20to%20make%20waste-free%20shopping%20easy%20and%20available%20to%20thousands%20more
My family has adopted a Zero Waste lifestyle since 2008 -the trash we generate
each year fits in a jar.

column4:
/>

I speak about my lifestyle all over the world, and people’s first reaction is: ""Oh I can’t do that, I don’t have bulk near me"". But had I heard about a zero waste family 9 years ago, I would have said the same thing. Yet, I found that package-free goods are everywhere, you just need to know where to find them!

That's why I created a free app, Bulk: It points to bulk food bins and liquid refills worldwide and lets you share the locations that you find with the zero waste community. But now, we need your help to save it!
column9:
/>

How does it works ?

The app is available in the iTunes App Store and Android Market and its features include:

• Search, add and rate bulk locations worldwide, identifying the selection available and whether or not reusable containers are permitted

• Locate the bulk businesses closest to you or near a specific address

• Narrow your search by bulk type (are you looking to refill on body care, dog food, wine?)
column14:
/>

Today, more than 10,000 users have entered over 3000 locations, in more than 30 countries.
column19:
/>

Thanks to those who've shared and rated locations, BULK has globally become the zero waste community's most useful tool, making package free locations easy to find and waste free living possible even when we travel. But now the app's life is in peril and it needs your help!

What we need now

I created the app using the US$ 25.000 grant that I received from winning the Green Awards in 2011. What I did not foresee by launching it, is that we would have to keep up with the constant changes to Google and Apple's operating systems, and keep funding costly updates.

My family has invested an additional amount of $5000 out of pocket on the app to make it international (the first release was targeted at just the US &
column20: Canada), cover the various annual hosting &amp
column21:
licensing fees, and save the Apple version, before technology advancement make it completely unusable.

Although we want to keep the app going, my hubby has reached a point where our family can no longer absorb the costs related to running it.
column23:
/>

So time has come for the community to save its app!

With the money raised, we’ll be able to save the Android app, but also improve the international mapping system, and add features such as comments and pictures, and even make a website so that if you’re planning a trip, you can prepare an itinerary based on bulk locations.

Staying true to the spirit of the zero waste lifestyle is important to us, which is why:

• We'd like to keep the App free AND add-free as long as we can.

• We're not offering the usual unnecessary material perks (stickers, T-shirts, mugs, etc…) for this crowdfunding campaign.
column28:
/>

How you can help

If BULK lives, thousands more will be able to eliminate packaging from their daily lives!

But your contribution would mean even more, because buying is voting. Every penny that we as consumers spend has the power to support a practice that is sustainable or one that is destructive. When we buy packaging, it’s a way for us to say that we love packaging and dream of a world filled with packaging for the future. But when we’re able to buy in bulk, our money is directly invested in a sustainable waste-free future (the more we buy in bulk, the more bulk will be available).
column33:
/>

Not so long ago, Zero Waste living was considered an utopia, today thousands of people have adopted the zero waste lifestyle worldwide, and prove that it is now a reality.

Save the Bulk app today! You will make waste-free shopping easy to thousands more, you will stop countless amounts of resources from going to the landfill, and more importantly you'll take part in building a waste-free world for future generations!

---

(FR)

Pourquoi notre appli BULK a t'elle besoin d'être sauvée? 

 Ceux qui ont telechargé la version Android l'auront déjà remarqué: elle ne marche plus sur cette plateforme. Mais de plus, nous ne pouvons plus financièrement assumer les mises à jour et, nous voudrions y ajouter davantage de fonctions.
column38:
/>

 A ce jour, plus de 10 000 utilisateurs ont enregistré plus de 3000 magasins dans plus de 30 pays : plus de 1500 aux USA, 400 en France, 300 au Canada, 145 en Australie.

 Grâce à ceux qui ont partagé ces emplacements, BULK est devenu un outil essentiel au sein de la communauté Zéro Déchet internationale, car elle permet de facilement localiser les magasins qui proposent du vrac et facilite le mode de vie zéro déchet -même en voyage.

 Mais aujourd’hui, la survie de cette application est en danger et nécessite l'aide de la communauté.

 Si vous vous en souvenez, j'ai pu créer cette application grâce a au prix de 25.000$ que j'ai gagné aux Green Awards. Mais ce que je n'ai pas réalisé en la lançant, c'est que j'aurais à financer les mises a jour extrêmement couteuses qu'impliquent les changements constants des opérateurs Google et Apple.

Ma famille a investi 5 000 $ de sa poche pour rendre l'appli internationale (elle était construite a l'origine pour les Etats­Unis &
column39: le Canada), payer les divers frais annuels (hébergement et licenses), ainsi que sauver la version Apple avant que les dernières avancées technologiques la rendent totalement inutilisable. Mon petit mari est arrivé a bout: il ne peut plus tirer de telles sommes de notre budget
column45:
/>

Nous avons donc besoin de la communauté pour garder cette appli en vie.

Avec l'argent récolté, nous pourrons non seulement sauver la version Android de l'appli mais également améliorer la cartographie internationale, ajouter des fonctions (commentaires et photos), la traduire en francais, et monter un site internet (cela nous permettrait de planifier un itineraire en fonction des emplacements de vrac.
column47:
/>

Si BULK survit, des milliers de personnes dans le monde pourront éliminer les emballages de leur quotidien. Mais votre contribution ira bien au-delà... car ""acheter, c'est voter"". Chaque centime que nous, consommateurs, dépensons a le pouvoir d'encourager une pratique durable ou destructrice. Acheter des emballages, perpétue leurs production. Alors que lorsque l'on achète en vrac, notre argent est directement investi dans un futur durable sans déchet : plus nous achetons en vrac, plus nous trouverons du vrac. En soutenant cette appli, vous évitez que des tonnes de matières ne finissent a la décharge, et prenez part à la construction d'un monde sans déchet pour les générations futures.

Je laisse donc le futur de BULK entre vos mains: La sauverez-vous?

","Short Summary
Welcome to “Tadwir”, The Palestine Recycling Initiative!
We are a team of local and international volunteers, and we are partnering with local artists and entrepreneurs from the Bethlehem area.
Our goal is to create a self-sustaining business in Bethlehem and eventually throughout the West Bank.
Your donation goes towards building the necessary machines for glass processing and the functioning costs until we can become self-sustainable.
All money donated stays within Palestine, and helps the local economy.
What We Need
We are hoping to raise $12,000 through this indiegogo campaign.
50% of our budget will go towards building the machines.
The rest is divided amongst running costs, tools, materials, & further hands-on research into upgrading the machines and developing recycled glass products.
This is the breakdown of the requested budget:
The Machines

We are not just crushing glass and making ""stuff"" with it. For this project to be sustainable for the long-term, we decided that it is best to build machines that would help us reach our goals with efficiency, while maintaining professional and premium quality of our products. These machines would also serve as prototypes for our sustainable R&D in order to develop better equipment and processes.
The Impact

This is the first attempt to try a large scale recycling project in Palestine. We hope to stimulate the local economy and provide means of living for several while also creating an atmosphere of self-sustainability
column2: something that is difficult when living under occupation.

column1: Our team consists of experts in several different fields including machine building, business accounting, biology, non-violent resistance, & peace studies.
We hope regardless of any held political views, you can still see the humanitarian benefits of such an initiative.
We'd like to expand this to other areas in the world with limited resources and excess waste.
Risks & Challenges
The occupation makes securing locations difficult, but we've secured a location already, and have a fair amount of confidence we can make this work if we meet our goal.
Should we fall short of our goal, it will take us a significantly longer amount of time to become entirely self-sustainable.
We plan on remaining flexible in the short-term, so we can deal with issues as they arise, while still striving towards our main goal of sustainability.
The Team
Other Ways You Can Help
Donating is the best way to help, however if you do not have the means:
Please share this campaign, it would mean a lot to us
[^ Use the Indiegogo share tools! They're pretty rad.]
Like our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/palrecycling
If you have other ways you'd like to contribute to us, or if you have questions or concerns, please contact us at palrecycling@gmail.com
Thank you so much for your care!-P.R.I. Team",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

Short Summary
When you take a bunch of individuals from the tech/Startup industry who also happen to love animals and give them a way to  thier put skills to  good use an app idea such as PetMeHome is born.
Their are thousands if not millions of pets without who have been neglected or even born on the streets, some abused and forgotten who simply need a warm home and someone to care for them.

There are families who have to give up thier pet for various reasons and end up placing them in shelters, this is the reality we all know of. But there's also a flip side,  people who desperately want a pet. While there are pounds and where these animals can be found we want to eliminate the need for these pets to ever see the inside of one.
How?

PetMeHome will enable anyone with a pet they want to give for adoption to create a profile, upload images and possibly videos of the pet, categorize the pet for easy search. The app will be location based enabling people looking to adopt a pet easily find the type of pet they want in thier own neighbourhood
What We Need
Even with us donating our time and effort, building and app and maintaining it is not a cheap endeavor. Costs include:

The first large-scale AC electric generating plant in history,
based on the inventions and patents of Nikola Tesla, was housed in this
120-year-old stone building still standing at Niagara Falls, NY. We plan to acquire the structure and property and turn it into a museum honoring the life
and work of Nikola Tesla, educating the eight million tourists who visit
Niagara Falls every year about his great vision and extraordinary contributions

to the human race, and we are asking for your help.

The building pictured above, the future home of the Nikola Tesla Museum, is formally named the Adams Transformer House, after one of Tesla's investors. Tesla himself supervised the design and construction of the facility. On November 16, 1896, a switch was thrown from this location that started the delivery of hydropower to an industrial center. For the first time in history, AC electricity was sent over a long distance (over 32 Km, or 20 miles) to power factories and an electric trolley at Buffalo, NY.

Today, nearly all of the electricity in the world is generated, transmitted and turned back into mechanical power by means of inventions, systems and innovations created by internationally-renowned genius and inventor Nikola Tesla. You can read about his life and contributions on Wikipedia and our official website, www.TeslaNiagara.org.

On January 12, 2015, Tesla at Niagara Museum received its formal charter from the State of New York, USA. Tesla at Niagara Museum has already been the recipient of two seed grants, from the local ReNu Community Group and the Niagara Falls National Heritage board. We are a duly-registered 501(c)(3) charity, therefore your donation is tax-deductible.

You can also read about our organization in the news media, including the Buffalo News and the Niagara Gazette, and at our official Facebook page,
column2:
ref=br_tf"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Tesla at Niagara Museum.

We are setting a goal of $500,000 for this campaign for the purpose of acquiring the building, however, as a valued supporter, you should know that any monies above this amount will be allocated wisely. For example, the 11,000 sq. foot (960 sq. meters) structure needs a new roof, a substantial investment. In addition, in order to qualify for foundation grants, we will need to perform both a structural assessment ($35,000), a feasibility study ($250,000) and a site plan.

I invite you to join our efforts to honor the great inventor and visionary Nikola Tesla with a museum showcasing artifacts and exhibits highlighting his tremendous contributions to mankind. You are always welcome here at Niagara Falls, and we look forward to your visit someday. Thank you so very much.

Sincerely,

Joan Elizabeth Johnson

President, Tesla at Niagara Museum

Here's what the perks look like:

Bumper sticker

","The first large-scale AC electric generating plant in history,
based on the inventions and patents of Nikola Tesla, was housed in this
120-year-old stone building still standing at Niagara Falls, NY. We plan to acquire the structure and property and turn it into a museum honoring the life
and work of Nikola Tesla, educating the eight million tourists who visit
Niagara Falls every year about his great vision and extraordinary contributions

to the human race, and we are asking for your help.The building pictured above, the future home of the Nikola Tesla Museum, is formally named the Adams Transformer House, after one of Tesla's investors. Tesla himself supervised the design and construction of the facility. On November 16, 1896, a switch was thrown from this location that started the delivery of hydropower to an industrial center. For the first time in history, AC electricity was sent over a long distance (over 32 Km, or 20 miles) to power factories and an electric trolley at Buffalo, NY.Today, nearly all of the electricity in the world is generated, transmitted and turned back into mechanical power by means of inventions, systems and innovations created by internationally-renowned genius and inventor Nikola Tesla. You can read about his life and contributions on Wikipedia and our official website, www.TeslaNiagara.org.On January 12, 2015, Tesla at Niagara Museum received its formal charter from the State of New York, USA. Tesla at Niagara Museum has already been the recipient of two seed grants, from the local ReNu Community Group and the Niagara Falls National Heritage board. We are a duly-registered 501(c)(3) charity, therefore your donation is tax-deductible.You can also read about our organization in the news media, including the Buffalo News and the Niagara Gazette, and at our official Facebook page, Tesla at Niagara Museum.We are setting a goal of $500,000 for this campaign for the purpose of acquiring the building, however, as a valued supporter, you should know that any monies above this amount will be allocated wisely. For example, the 11,000 sq. foot (960 sq. meters) structure needs a new roof, a substantial investment. In addition, in order to qualify for foundation grants, we will need to perform both a structural assessment ($35,000), a feasibility study ($250,000) and a site plan.I invite you to join our efforts to honor the great inventor and visionary Nikola Tesla with a museum showcasing artifacts and exhibits highlighting his tremendous contributions to mankind. You are always welcome here at Niagara Falls, and we look forward to your visit someday. Thank you so very much.Sincerely,Joan Elizabeth JohnsonPresident, Tesla at Niagara MuseumHere's what the perks look like:Bumper sticker ****************************************************************************

I am Delphine Robbe, french living in Gili
Trawangan, Indonesia, for the last 12 years. I am the project manager and
coordinator of a local NGO: Yayasan Ekosistem Gili Indah or Gili Eco Trust. I
work with all my heart and passion for this little island! Many projects are
successful such as Biorock reef restoration, mooring buoys, cat and horse
clinics, renewable energy development, education and socialisation of the local
community about the importance of caring for their environment for a
sustainable future.
Our
priority for the last few years is RUBBISH...
We (Gili
Eco Trust, Head of village, APGT Asosiasi Pengusaha Gili Trawangan, Bank Sampah
Bintang Sejahtera, Front Masyarakat Peduli Lingkungan) are now starting a new
system of waste management and in paralele an education campaign towards ZERO
WASTE, which will ensure jobs and money for locals and a clean island free of
plastic and rubbish as an example of ecotourism.
Gili Trawangan is drowning under rubbish as
no proper waste management plan in place. We have started a new system of
collection and socialization to get everyone to separate their rubbish so we
can set up an organic garden from organic (wet) rubbish, and we want to set up
a ""rubbish Bank"" for the local community to bring us their rubbish
and get money in return. We need funds to set up facilities that we will allow us to bring most of the rubbish to Lombok for recycling and use a rich compost for planting on Gili.
We have received funds to set up the
facilities but now we are running out of money to keep on building, employing more staff and get more horses. As we have spent so much money to start the new system (boxes,
education, press machine), please help, so we can run everything smoothly and
successfully.
Roof, floor, compartments for ""rubbish
Machines: Press*4, Plastic shredding*2,
Organic rubbish cutter*2, scales *4: US$ 30,000
Electricity+water installation: US$ 2,500,
Composting facilities+organic garden: 15,000,
Boat to transport rubbish to main land:
Educational events+prizes+socialization:
Methanization tanks*2: 24,000,
Office and rooms to rent 1 year: 12,000,
Staff salaries 1 year: 32,000,
Organic rubbish boxes and rubbish bins:
We need to get the Rubbish Bank facilities
running as soon as possible so we can get some income and support local
community by offering them a way to make money by cleaning their island. Boat
and machinery are the most important goal for now to get some money in as well
as cleaning the island. We have the boat, but no staff yet and we need to install the machinery in the new building which is not finished to be built.
We also need funding to set the organic
garden from composting the organic rubbish (felita system: anaerobic
fermentation of the organic rubbish) that the local community and businesses
separate, and that we collect. We need to be able to spread the campaign to the
whole island: distributing rubbish bins for inorganic rubbish and boxes for
organic rubbish, training everyone about wet and dry rubbish, controlling,
giving prizes and awards to the best eco-warriors every month. We also need to
have more horse karts or some solar power golf karts to organize a daily
efficient rubbish collection.
With YOUR HELP, we will be able to set up the
facilities and to run them straight away at a full potential rather than being
half of our time trying to find money and the other half of the time trying to
run the waste management plan.
We cant wait anymore and so we need your help to build the
facilities to run our plan to its full potential to ensure an popular tourist
destination island free of smell and free of rubbish!
We have been working so many years on that
project, and it is NOW that we can see that with your help we can success. We
have a plan, job description and budget for a sustainable future of this little
island.
The only risks are if people give up and stop
working for us! but every meetings, we keep on saying ""tidak boleh
gagal"" which means NOT ALLOWED OF GIVING UP.
We are about 25 people working now, and we
want to expand to 40 to 50 people. These people are taking their job seriously
and do not want to fail as this is the only way to save the island from
becoming another tourist destination spoiled by rubbish.
If you cannot give us money, please contact
us to come and help! there is always a way to help! on site or from home!

Thanks for your support

We are a team based in Iquitos city at the heart of the Amazon in Peru we got in touch with various indigenous people of many indigenous villages around Iquitos.Living in these jungle villages we got inspired with the idea to introduce Solar Energy and Ecological Cleaning Products to the people of these villages.The main idea was created when we realized that all the indigenous villages they use electric generators based in gazoline and that all the families are using extremely chemical cleaning products for the clothes , the cooking items and the body.The final target is to fund the team so it can work at the following main projects :

Short Summary
<div>

column4:
>Who we are

Lebanon Eco movement (LEM) is a

column1: non-profit Lebanese organization that was established in 2012, by a number of
environmental Lebanese civil society organization to:
1. Preserve the natural and cultural heritages
2. Coordinate between associations and
bodies
3. Participate in national
environment policy-making
4. Spread environmental awareness
5. Adopt all legal means to achieve the
desired goals.
Currently, LEM has 65 civil society organization members
located all over the Lebanese territory. It belongs to a number of
Mediterranean and regional networks that are interested in matters related to
environment, climate change and sustainable development.

Our project: The LEM Observatory

Since

its establishment, LEM has developed tools to empower citizens in their quest for a better environment, like the Lebanon Eco Movement Observatory, 2014-2015.
The observatory pinpoints environmental infringements, develops scientific studies and advocates for sustainable solutions. It has been successful in case of illegal waste dumping/burning, illegal bird hunting, illegal tree cutting, etc.   

LEM is calling on all the advocates of Lebanon and its beautiful nature to financially support the Observatory project in 2016.
Like, comment and share on Facebook: /LebanonEcoMovement
