","Mitigating drought in Sap Tai community
PATT Foundation is planting trees in Thailand’s biggest and
oldest national park Khao Yai already for 10 years. But this year is special -
it is the first time that the local Sap Tai community is experiencing water
scarcity. There is not enough water even to sufficiently water the
essential food crops.
This shows that
climate is changing in Khao Yai, but we won’t just watch it happen. We would
like to help the local community and plant 100 native trees with
them on the Zero Emissions Day to raise awareness for climate change and
ensure sufficient water supply for the next year. We will also hire local Thai
staff to provide 2-3 years of aftercare for the planted trees to ensure their
successful growth.
The planted trees in
Sap Tai will:
Provide home for the
wild elephants living in the area
Protect Sap Tai
watershed and prevent water scarcity
Present an extra
income for the Sap Tai community
Absorb carbon dioxide
and mitigate climate change
Prevent soil erosion
Local Sap Tai
community doesn’t have enough resources to finance their watershed protection project
that is why we ask for your help. Help us protect the water sources of
the Sap Tai community with this sustainable forest restoration, and at the same
time you’ll also offset your carbon footprint.
Why trees?
Trees are mitigating drought
Not only are trees an
effective means for absorbing and storing the carbon you emit, trees also help
us to adapt to a changing climate and combat drought by:
Influencing
rainfall patterns - trees humidify air
and maintain rain cycle, their leaves act as interceptors, catching falling
rain, which then evaporates causing rain precipitation - a process known as
evapo-transpiration. Trees can evapo-transpirate twice as much as agricultural
crops and about twice as much as water body surfaces.
Regulating
river flows both during dry
seasons and high rainfall events, thereby minimizing risks related to water
scarcity and floods.
Reducing
water evaporation by cooling the air and
shading the ground.
Increasing
water saturation into groundwater thus reducing water runoff. Tree roots and leaf litter create
soil conditions that promote the infiltration of rainwater into the soil. This
helps to replenish the groundwater supply and maintain streamflow during dry
periods.
Increasing
underground water reserves
- strategic planting of trees can increase level of groundwater as numerous
studies have already shown.
Furthermore, only native tree species will be used in Sap Tai community as
they have low rate of transpiration and high rate of groundwater recharge in this environment.
“As the climate
changes, severe droughts are likely to become more common, and we shouldn’t
miss the opportunities to influence the hydrologic cycle in a beneficial way
using trees” says David Ellison   from the Institute for World Economics.
100 trees for Zero
Emissions Day – what is ZeDay?
ZeDay takes place
every year on the 21st September and it is a global 24 hour moratorium
on the use of fossil fuels. ZeDay guidelines are simple:
Don’t use or burn oil,
gas or coal.
Minimize (or
eliminate) your use of electricity generated by fossil fuels.
Don’t put anyone in
harm’s way: All essential and emergency services operate normally.
Do your best, have
fun, enjoy the day – make a small green change in someone’s life!
The majority of
greenhouse gases come from burning fossil fuels to produce energy. This means
that the use of fossil fuels is the prime driver of climate change. So let’s
stop their use for a day as reducing our emissions is a vital part of
combating climate change!
But we still want or
need to use at least some modern commodities in our lives - these emissions we can
simply offset with TREES!
Trees are green
machines that act as natural
filters of our air. Through the process of photosynthesis they absorb carbon
dioxide (a key contributor to global warming) from the atmosphere and store it
in their trunk, branches, leaves, roots, soil and foliage, while releasing
oxygen back out.
As each tree can store
around 800 kilograms of carbon dioxide over 40 years of its life, a person
needs to plant on average only 10 trees per year to offset his or her carbon
footprint. Why not plant your 10
trees with this project and at the same time also help Sap Tai community fight
their drought?
What will we do with the funding?
Sap Tai
Sap Tai community lays
on the very edge of the Khao Yai National park, which is Thailand’s oldest
(since 1962) and largest national park (2,168 km2). The park is a
UNESCO world heritage site and is an important tropical forest ecosystem. It
provides home for over 3000 species of plants, 250 birds and 67 mammals – some
of them critically endangered. But the mountainous Khao Yai also has a dark
side – it has a history of poaching, land encroachment, illegal logging and
unsustainable agricultural practices. All this had a detrimental effect on primary
forest, which also led to soil erosion, landslides, flooding and droughts.
There is an urgent need for forest restoration, conservation and education to reverse
the current trend of habitat degradation.
Local people in Sap
Tai community are experiencing the effects of this degradation (especially
drought), and therefore decided to make a change and protect the existing
forests while also create new ones. This will not only provide them with
sustainable livelihoods, but will also present a healthy habitat for the wild
elephants and other wildlife living in this area. But in order to achieve this,
they need your help.
Tree planting
methodology
PATT Foundation will
help the Sap Tai community to create a healthy forest ecosystem. We will restore
the forest, not just reforest! This means that we will re-establish the
entire forest ecosystems as similar as possible to the original forest
ecosystem which was present before the deforestation occurred.
PATT
Foundation works closely with the Forestry Research & Restoration Unit
FORRU, which has undertaken ground-breaking research on the best methods to
restore native forests in Thailand. As such we follow their framework species
method of forest restoration - this involves the planting of 20-30 indigenous
tree species specially selected for their ability to rapidly shade out weeds
and attract seed-dispersing wildlife. Birds and mammals, attracted to the
plots, bring with them the seeds of many other forest trees and thus help to
re-establish a species-rich forest tree community similar to that of the
original forest.
PATT
will provide tree seedlings from our own tree nursery in Khao Yai, which serves
as an environmental education facility and also provides employment to Sap Tai people - it hires 3 full
time and up to 20 casual local Thai staff to undertake various aspects of our
reforestation work. Beside tree planting and nursery activities they will also do
the aftercare of the newly planted trees in this project for another 2-3 years
to assure their successful growth.
Rewards
Meeting our goal and
planting 100 trees will ensure sufficient water supply for the Sap Tai
community in the years to come! We need £5 to plant one tree and to provide 2-3
years of aftercare. So in order to plant a forest of 100 trees that will impact
groundwater levels, we need your help to reach a goal of £500.
In return for your
generous support we prepared a really nice green rewards on the right:
For each planted tree
you’ll receive an electronic certificate and a photo of your tree with your name
card next to it.

For 10 planted trees you will receive, in addition to the above perks, a digital download of the Climb for Climate Action documentary as a thank you for your efforts to tackle climate change and offset your carbon footprint this year.
But 30 planted trees will
take the local Sap Tai school on a one day environmental educational workshop
to ensure green future for the community. As a thank you for your generous
support you’ll receive all the photos from that environmental day, with many
including your name card.
Why PATT Foundation?
PATT Foundation is a UK registered
charity and a Thailand Foundation operating throughout the Southeast Asia
region already since 2005. We initiate, develop and manage large-scale reforestation projects
countering deforestation and climate change. We strive to save the planet by
planting trees, educating communities on sustainable forestry and children on
the environment.
We are hoping to
reach our goal of planting 1 million trees by our 10-year anniversary in
November 2015. Our current total stands at 893,995!
Risks & Challenges
If
we don’t hit the £500 target by September 21, we will still plant as many trees
as our campaign will raise donations. Even just one planted tree in Sap Tai
community will help protect water sources, although this might not prevent the
drought next year.
PATT Foundation has already 10 years of experience in forest restoration projects
around Thailand, so we feel confident enough to successfully help Sap Tai
community. We aim to restore forests, not just reforest them, which results in
high success rate of our projects. We pick only native tree species already
present in the area and grow them in our own nursery in Khao Yai which gives
employment to the local community. As we also provide aftercare for the planted
trees our trees really grow unlike in many other projects, where baby trees die
in the field due to neglect and poor conditions within months after planting. Collaboration with the local community also ensures that the trees will be valued
for many more years to come.
Other Ways You Can Help
Can you help us get the word out about the 100 TREES FOR 0
EMISSIONS DAY campaign? Visit www.pattfoundation.org to find out more
about the projects that we are running. Please also follow us on Twitter and
like us on Facebook. We will greatly appreciate it if you can donate a tweet
or share on your Twitter or Facebook, and also share the campaign with your family,
friends and colleagues.",9.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Bangkok, Thailand",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/100-trees-for-0-emissions-day/pica

Cooking Shouldn't Kill

Whether it's a weekend barbecue or roasting marshmallows on a camping trip, cooking over an open fire is a novelty that many Americans enjoy.
But for nearly half the world's population, building and maintaining a fire is a daily -- and often deadly -- chore.

In remote villages and city slums, women tend to fires for hours on end, breathing in smoke that is the equivalent of smoking two packs of cigarettes a day, according to the World Health Organization. Many of these women have their children close by or strapped to their chest or back, and the dangerous pollutants from the smoke can result in severe damage to their lungs as well.
""Give a man a
fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a
lifetime.""
My name is Yusuf Tura and I am a social entrepreneur
originally from  Africa who is trying to turn this vision into a reality. I
was forced to leave my homeland as a child because of war conflict and when I
finally got the opportunity to come back I was saddened by how open-fire cooking is destroying lives and the environment.
I found that deforestation and air pollution have reached
alarming rates which put everyone's health in danger but especially dangerous
for the small children.

At The Obama Stove Company (formerly known as Green Energy Without Borders), we are seeking to change the future, one eco-friendly stove at a time. Every year I travels to Africa to help villages create sustainable lifestyles for themselves by building and selling stoves that are fueled by locally-sourced waste material. The stoves themselves are made of a particular Ethiopian clay and scrap metal. Here's what the stoves look like mid-manufacturing:

My mission is to enable men and women to work for themselves
column2:
I don't just give away stoves. I teaches people to make the stoves, and then encourages others to sell the stoves door-to-door for less than $10. In doing so, I have watched single moms start their own businesses with these stoves to continue to earn money to support their families, such as the woman who started her own coffee shop in the image below.

On my trip to Africa this year, I have realized how many families have but a few dollars to their names, and is hoping to use the Indiegogo community to help provide financial support to hardworking Ethiopian men and women. 

What We Need &
column3:
What You Get

Unfortunately, not everyone has $10 to buy one of these stoves. Villagers will sometimes trade crafts for stoves, but ultimately more money needs to come in from somewhere. 

We're here to ask for any amount of money you can provide. It's been said many times before, but the saying rings especially true here: every dollar truly counts. The money you donate here will go directly toward supporting children, women and men living in an Ethiopian village. 

Plus, for various donation benchmarks, we're offering beautiful handmade art and crafts, straight from the village that your dollars are going to!

column1: 1. Handmade cards with a Ethiopian proverb written inside
2. Thank you message from local families/kids in the form of
youtube video
3. Photo of a family holding a 'thank you' sign which you can share on social media
4. Ethiopian recipe (s) from a family you helped
5. My signed book
6. One video session with me as a motivational speaker/ life
coach
7. Eco stove with your name on it
8. A poster with images of a local village
9. A session with me talking about the project and the
importance of sustainable lifestyle
10. Success stories of the families you helped in a form of
PDF document with photos

The Impact

I have dedicated my  life to work toward making The Obama Stove Company thrive. In addition to running this organization I am motivational speaker and  driver in the Seattle area . The design of the stoves are local invention, and have proven themselves to be far less environmentally harmful compared to open fires (the alternative heat and cooking source in these villages). 

The money you donate will help kicks tart the people that I am  working with directly: it will enable them to purchase a stove, to cook for their children, to boil and purify water, and to start businesses. It really doesn't take much to change a life.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you taking the time to read through The Obama Stove Company's mission. We also realize that financial contributions can be difficult at times - we get it! If you're unable to donate today but would still like to help out, please share this campaign with your friends and family! 

Additionally, you can learn more about The Obama Stove Company here. 

Finally, make sure to swing by our Facebook Page!

>

Biochar Local is a movement supported by Exeterra, LLC, a young venture developing and selling equipment for the local production of biochar, a fine-grained granular charcoal renowned for its ability to enhance soil fertility and contribute to climate change mitigation by sequestering carbon from the atmosphere.

Our equipment, which is designed for use by farmers, forest entrepreneurs, compost and nursery businesses, and other innovators, promotes the conversion of biological waste into biochar.

Our Mission

We believe in optimizing the value of biochar in all its potential applications. As a result, our mission is to connect with innovators across the small-scale farm and forest communities and provide them with the technology and support they need to develop a biochar production system. We will do this through the sale of our Exeter retorts, similar farm-scale systems, and our new brand, Deep 6 Biochar.

By localizing biochar production we focus on

Our Carbon Footprint:

We want to ensure our biochar products are not just the best for end users such as gardeners, but also the best for the planet. To maximize biochar's impact on sequestering carbon from the atmosphere, we connect biochar users with localized producers and distributors. Our vision is to initiate production within 90 miles or less of every customer.

Our Economic Impact

While some companies are working to industrialize biochar production, our approach is to work at a smaller scale,  allowing us to leverage a distributed network of producers to keep the economic impact of biochar close to home.

Waste Management and Land Improvement

Our support of a distributed network of biochar production creates economic opportunities for other entrepreneurs to turn farm and forest waste into value. Currently, many forms of biomass are tagged as waste or turned into low-value products, generating little incentive for waste stream management or forest improvement projects. By creating a channel for converting “waste” into value-added materials, we strive to enhance forest and farm waste management practices.

Quality

Deep 6 Biochar will rely on the use of Exeter Retorts and other technologies to streamline the deployment of local production while maintaining the highest degree of quality for end-users. We believe a quality retort is the secret sauce to creating and sustaining a localized network of producers.

We thank you for your time and support.

For more information on biochar please visit

http://www.biochar-international.org/ or 

https://www.biochar-journal.org/en

For more information on Exeterra or the Exeter Biochar Retort, visit:

 http://exeterrallc.com/

For information on Deep 6 Biochar, visit:

  http://deep6biochar.com

With your support we truly believe we can shape the trajectory of the biochar industry to one that localizes economic opportunity and maximizes biochar's role as a tool for solving the climate crisis.

What Is The Rickshaw Run?

In August, 2015, we will make a valiant effort to complete the Rickshaw Run. We will fly from the USA to the city of Shillong, we will embark on a 2200 mile drive down India’s west coast in a 3-wheeled motorized rickshaw running at a whopping 7 horsepower. This rally is fully unguided and unsupported. We create the route, and we will get lost. We aren't mechanically inclined, but we will break down. Repeatedly. But it is all for a good cause and a sense of adventure.

WHAT? You crazy! Yes a bit!
<b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

We are two random strangers who met by ways of a facebook group. Decided to take a chance and go on this trip together. We may kill each other or be killed on this trip. 
Jenny: 
Jenny is a native New Yorker by ways of Queens. Her nickname is Jenny from the Block. She is an IT consultant. One reason she is doing the trip is she hopes to lose enough weight on to fit into her braidsmaid dress in December. 
Stephen: 

Pronounced Stef-fen (like Stephen Curry) is also a native New Yorker by ways of Brooklyn. He has plenty of rally/travel experience including driving an ambulance from NYC to Peru then donating it to charity. 


The Charity: Cool Earth

Cool Earth is the charity that works alongside indigenous villages to halt rainforest destruction.

We know that saving the rainforest isn’t a new idea. Managing to do it is.

Over the last 40 years, half the world’s rainforests have been destroyed. That’s why Cool Earth decided to go about things differently.

Cool Earth doesn't create reserves or put up fences. They don’t buy land. Instead, they put indigenous people back in control of the world’s most endangered rainforest.

These people have lived in the forest for countless generations. Their homes are now on the  frontline of deforestation. They have the most to lose from deforestation.

By building better incomes, better schools and better clinics, Cool Earth gives their partner villages the resources they need to keep their forest intact.

Cool Earth is now working alongside 65 rainforest villages throughout the world.

These partner villages are protecting over 350,000 acres of forest that lie directly in the path of chainsaws and bulldozers.

The clever part is that this forest is forming a shield to make the neighbouring forest inaccessible  to loggers – saving millions of acres of further forest.

At least 90% of each donation to Cool Earth goes directly to their projects. With this support, Cool Earth can put in place the simple steps that change the fate of at-risk rainforest and the lives of their indigenous partners.

Dira Foundation:

I am excited to announce the Dira Foundation as Team Holi Cows official charity partner! In addition to raising money for Cool Earth, 50% of our charity proceeds will go to the Dira Foundation. Founded in part by our good friend Gregory Bernstein in 2012, The Dira Foundation awards scholarships to rising Tanzanian High School students. May of the recipients are impoverished or disable students who show academic excellence. The foundations goal is to raise awareness concerning the state of education, poverty and discrimination in Tanzania. The foundation works closely with academic principles and advisors to insure that the scholarships get in to the right hands and that academic standards are met. More information about foundation can be found on the Dira Foundations Facebook page or at there website
column4:
s=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">dirafoundation.org.


What We Need

We need your support in these two amazing charities!

How Else You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Here are some other ways we would love for you to lend a hand:

column1: • Share! There are links on this campaign page to our various social media pages. All the exposure we can get helps, and we're sure you know somebody who would be interested in supporting and/or following along as we progress to and through India.
• If you think you have any gear or supplies to donate, by all means, let us know. We will be traveling very light, but a camera or a tarp or anything else you think of may come in extremely handy

Tell your friends. Tell your family. And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for reading, especially if you made it all the way down here. See you in India!

Tell your friends. Tell your family. And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for reading, especially if you made it all the way down here. See you in India!",2.0,0,"1 Campaign

The
Project in Brief
Based in the United Kingdom our
small team of experienced traders has found that there is a huge potential for
selling bird’s food, especially for wild birds. Attracting wild birds to your
garden or back yard gives you peaceful environment and takes you
closer to the nature in the heart of the busy cities. Just imagine hearing the
calming birds’ songs at your home or the wondering of your children when they
find gaily-coloured birds on the trees around you.
Providing rich proteins and quality
food is very important for wild birds. They grow healthy and much more
beautiful. Even their songs sound better.
It is important for them to have
quality food even in the winter season. Protein supply is essential for every
single bird to survive in the cold winter also it is for the breeding period.
This is in a few words our idea
which we would like to make popular. Creating nature friendly environment will
be the most valuable benefit for the many local communities in the UK.
How
We Can Do This
Being experienced with trading
different goods and commodities we have good and reliable connections with
farmers around the Europe. Dealing directly with them will give us the
advantage of lower commodity price
column2: together with the short distance for

column1: delivery we would be competitive on the market. The project idea is to import
different seeds and grains which wild birds love to eat, selling them directly
to households or suppling zoo-stores.
Stage 1 Establish contacts with farmers of oil seeds and grains –
We have already done this and we have made very attractive prices with farmers
– in return they have guaranteed market for their production. The first focus
will be sunflower seeds and corn which are some of the favorite wild birds’ food.
Stage 2 Provide a storage space - warehouse. We will need to rent a
warehouse to stock the seeds and to be able to import bigger quantity in order
to keep the price lower.
Stage 3 Ensure the local deliveries. Buying our own van for local
deliveries is essential to keep low operational costs and to avoid courier
services.
Stage 4 Web-site. Presenting our business on the World Wild Web is
one of the most important jobs to do. This is how we are going to boost on-line
sales and will advertise our enterprise.
What Do We Need
The total investment we need to
realize this idea is: 55 000 £ or approximately 75 000 €. All the contributions
made will go for covering the following expenses:
• Professional web-site
• Buying a van
• Renting a warehouse
• Buying seeds – to be able to make the idea massive enough will have to import at least 3-4 containers (approximately 24 000kg each) of seeds to place ourselves on the market.
If we receive more contributions
than needed – we will increase the trading volume.
If we do not receive the
contributions needed – we will have to reduce the trading volume.
The
Benefits
Locally: That will establish nice and peaceful environment. It will
cultivate more nature friendly personality. And will be a great experience for
everybody especially for the kids giving them memorable moments.
Apart of these personal benefits we
are going to employee 3-5 people in the area – van driver, warehouse workers
and web-site administrator.
As a part of our business we plan to
get a Council permission to place wild bird feeders in parks. And we will
provide seeds on weekly basis. That will attract more birds in the parks.
Globally: Because we believe that goodness must pass from hand to
hand we are going to establish a fund for supporting different causes and
ideas. Every six months we are going to allocate between 0.3
and 0.5 percent from our turnover (which will be approximately 5% of the gross
profit) for supporting people with dreams and valuable ideas, also we will
be more than happy to support different causes.
We have found in our experience that
funding your bright ideas is not that easy as it is written in the books.
Financial organizations will ask you to secure the investments and personal
investors will ask for huge share of your idea. These circumstances will put
you on the ground and in most of the cases you won’t be able to develop your
idea to the levels you would like to…
This is why we will be really happy
if we could provide support for resourceful persons to realize their workable
ideas. We will be happy to support them not only with funding but with ideas
and solutions in making their dreams come true.
Based on our believes and understandings of helping others the
effort is not only to establish a prosperous organization but to build a
profitable structure with ability to allocate funds on regular bases to support
many people and causes for a bright future.
“Making one donation
helps just once, but carry out a profitable plan will rise contributions for
the future.""
<div>
Other
Ways You Can Help
In case that you like the Project
but you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:
<li>Just get the word out and make some noise about our
campaign.
• Simply use the Indiegogo share tools!
FUTURE
PLANS
Completing
this project is not the end of our plans. After 12 months of trading activity
we would be able to rent agricultural land and to produce the bird food we need
by ourselves. The benefits – lower price, more people employed more money rised for
the support fund – higher value for
your contributions.
We will be happy to answer all the questions you may
have.

faced with critical issues which we cannot take lightly. One of the largest
issues at the forefront of our world is the handling of our planet and our
oceans. Oceans represent the lifeblood of our planet and without healthy
oceans, life as we know it will cease to exist. Problems such as ocean
acidification, rising sea levels, and pollution are just a few examples of the
neglect aimed at seventy-percent of our planet’s existence. We are not trying
to mold every individual into an activist who refuses to use any product which
produces a carbon footprint. We are, however, trying to raise awareness about
the importance of conserving our planet and its irreplaceable beauty. Tortuga
Tide encourages conservation, eco-friendliness, and healthy lifestyles but will
not be limited to a sole group of individuals
in our business. We will select at least two small projects, relating to marine
conservation, during the year in which to donate to and to help. Our first
planned project to donate to is the Bimini Shark Lab in the Bahamas, which is
one of the largest shark labs in the world that conducts critical research on
animals which help support ocean ecosystems.
The
first step to making our startup dream a reality is obtaining needed capital.
As individuals, one may seem cautious at first of giving money to a startup,
let alone one run by college students. However, every company must start
somewhere, and we are not your typical college students. Personally, I have
taken on many large tasks with outcomes of success, and my team and I are
committed to immersing ourselves in our cause. Many of us do not know how to
fail
column2: we make mistakes but learn from them in order to prosper and thrive. We

column1: plan to add this same component to our business. With your help, our vision
will be taken from a dining room table to something of much bigger magnitude.

Hello folks!

I'm a stay at home mum for my two kids, Arwen (4y) and Caitlyn (2y). Together with my partner we made the decision that I would quit my job to become a stay at home mum because the daycare expenses went through the roof. We basically worked to be able to pay daycare, which we have to pay because we go to work. That just seemed silly so we decided to try it another way. Sad part is that in Belgium, being a stay at home mum isn't considered a job. People say you're lazy and do nothing all day. This couldn't be more further from the truth!! At my previous job I had a lot of spare time, now I don't have enough time. So don't go telling me that being a fulltime mum isn't a fulltime job!
I started this campaign because I saw others do it, people with enough money asking for even more money. Rich people asking for money to make a television program or a movie. Acquintances even had the audicity to raise money to be able to build a house. Normally I would never resort to something like this. But why not? Why can't the less fortunate have the same options than others? Why are we compelled to hiding our problems and pretend everything is alright, when it's clearly not. Every month bills stay unpaid because we prefer to spend our money on food and clothing for the girls. I want to give my kids the same chances other kids have. I want to go swimming with them (yes, this hasn't happened, go figure), I want to go out to eat, I want to go to amusement parks, I want to be able to give them options. I want to be able to still pay for diapers at the end of the month. I want to stop counting every penny and start living!
We want to give our children a house with proper windows and a front door that closes as it should. I don't want to be affraid someone will break in and harm my kids, as they are closest to the front door. I want to give them a yard to play in, instead of having them run in the streets. All I want is to be an ordinary family as you would see them in the commercials. I want to be able to buy decent shoes that aren't worn down after two months. Everything others take for granted, I want. 
If you were to donate even 1€, it would mean the world to us. I would take away some of the worries we have every month. The hardest part is asking for money, choosing how much money to raise. To be honest, I would rather leave it blank and leave it up to you. I have no goal to reach, every donation would be a blessing. Don't feel bad if you yourself can't contribute, sharing this campaign with others could result in a miracle.
I hereby solemny swear (shoutout to Harry Potter fans) that every cent will go to making my kids' life better, giving them a reason to smile. Because even though love is enough, if you don't pay your bills, you'll end up having no kids. And that is not the future I want. 
To be clear, I have a partner who works his ass of trying to make as much money as possible. But with our monthly costs being sky-high (that happens when you're house is more of a dump than a house) it is very, very hard to make it to the end of the month. So donate, share and always, always pay it forward. Karma will reward you.
Thank you for taking the time to read it all.

About the farm

Hackney City Farm has been a community environmental hub for over 30 years. We welcome 75,000 visitors each year, the busiest city farm in London. People from all over London come to get up close to farm yard animals
column2: see, smell and plant vegetables and learn new skills, or simply to have a nice meal in our café.  If even half of our visitors gave £1 then we would reach our target, however we know that many of our visitors can not afford to.  Our farm is in the London Borough of Hackney, ranked as the most deprived Local Authority in London, with 40% child poverty (according to Trust for London) and this is why it is vital that we remain free to visit and open six days a week. (Don't worry even if we don't reach our target we aren't going to start charging).

column1: This is why we are asking our supporters for a contribution to the up keep of the animals and help fund our livestock worker who cares for them on a daily basis.

So if you have visited, or planned to visit us, or simply because you want to support our project please give a little to help with basic costs such as feed for the animals, hand wash facilities and toilet roll...all the stuff we can't ask for from main stream funders.  

Why we need your help

Hackney
City Farm has been committed to improving London's Environment since it was set
up in 1984 by local volunteers, who turned the site from a derelict

haulage yard into an urban green oasis and having just celebrated our 30th anniversary volunteer involvement is still at the heart of what we do today.

Hackney City Farm continues to receive a core grant from the local authority (London Borough of Hackney) but over the last few years we have seen our running costs increase. We are also coming to the end of a 9 year programme of funding from the Big Lottery.  In response the farm is concentrating on securing a sustainable future by developing areas of social enterprise, such as renting space to local people and selling our produce in our farm shop. The result is a successful mix of commercial and community activities enhancing the farm’s sustainability whilst investing in the local community.
We are also looking at new and creative ways of funding the project. Whist we still rely on generous funders for many of our staff positions we have to raise the money each year to pay for the feed for the animals and for the little things which we need to have to stay open to the public, from  soap and paper towels to public liability insurance.
What we do
We run volunteer sessions in growing food and animal care, for people of all abilities
column2: and courses in bee keeping, pottery and yoga.

column1: We are now Ofsted registered as an Independent school within Hackney
column2: providing alternative education to young people from Hackney who have been excluded from mainstream education whilst also providing work experience placements to other schools.

column1: We run yoga and language classes for refugees &
column2: migrants and we provide tailored workshops for schools and community groups on environmentally themed topics.

column1: We also promote arts and crafts with regular pottery and mosaic classes for adults and children, as well as music classes for babies and art workshops for older children.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't afford to donate yourself please help us spread the word and reach our target by sharing with your friends, family and on social media.
You could also join our volunteers and help with the day to day running of the farm.  We particularly need people to help in the farm shop.
If you are interested please email our Volunteer team on: volunteer@hackneycityfarm.co.uk

Short Summary
We believe in the power of photography
column2: the power to inspire, the power to connect, and the power to change people’s lives. For two weeks in July, we’ll be running a photography workshop with Zambian youths, as part of Greenpop’s eco-education program.

column1: We’ll be working with ten Zambians between the ages of 19 and 24 who, for various socio-economic issues, have not been able to study at tertiary institutions or find jobs. With a specific focus on the environment, we will teach our participants photography and story-telling skills. We will encourage them to explore the environmental issues facing their region through their lenses, and communicate this story in a powerful way. We’ll also focus on critical thinking,  problem-solving skills, team collaboration, and the contribution they can have to changing communities and environments.

After running a successful pilot last year, this workshop will be the start of an on-going photography program in Livingstone. Through a continuation of our workshops, we eventually aim to equip young Zambians with skills, connections and resources to study photography or filmmaking, or to gain employment in the creative industry. You can find a full overview of the project here.

“This project set me on a path I had for so long discarded, which now, I realize, is my true passion. I am saving up because I will be studying film production in London, so with that said, Ilizwi does more for young people than you realize. It will change the lives of many in ways you can not imagine, which is the beauty of it all.”
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

This project is a collaboration between Greenpop (an environmental NGO), Ilizwi (a youth development initiative that encourages creative self-expression through photography), and the Penda Trust (an NGO that uses photography to generate positive change in developing countries). The workshop will happen as part of Greenpop Zambia, a Livingstone-based project that works to contribute to a solution to the deforestation and consequent ecological and socio-economic impacts the area is facing. Greenpop is doing this by starting a reforestation process, developing a culture of planting trees within communities, encouraging alternative energy sources, and promoting sustainable forest management.

What We Need

The funds raised will go towards:
<ul>
• Cameras for the participants
• Transport during the workshop
• Travel costs for the workshop facilitators, who are part of an Ilizwi team from Khayalitsha, Cape Town, and went through the workshop process themselves
• Workshop material and stationary

What You Get

In return for your support, we're exciting to offer you some fun perks! You can choose a print of one of the images that will be taken during the workshop, some traditional Zambian fabric sent to you from Livingstone, or a stunning book on nature photography. You can find the details on the right-hand side.
You can also choose a SIGNED print of this stunning image by Jeremy Loops!
And we're excited to have just added this gorgeous illustration, designed specifically for this campaign by the wonderful
column3: ref=br_tf"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Paper Tales. For a contribution of $20, we can offer you a limited edition A4 print of it!

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >You can help us out by spreading the word! You could share posts about the campaign from our

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >If you have a camera (either point and shoot or SLR) that you're not using anymore and would like to donate it, let us know! We always need extra cameras.

column1: ","Short Summary
We believe in the power of photography
column2: the power to inspire, the power to connect, and the power to change people’s lives. For two weeks in July, we’ll be running a photography workshop with Zambian youths, as part of Greenpop’s eco-education program.

column1: We’ll be working with ten Zambians between the ages of 19 and 24 who, for various socio-economic issues, have not been able to study at tertiary institutions or find jobs. With a specific focus on the environment, we will teach our participants photography and story-telling skills. We will encourage them to explore the environmental issues facing their region through their lenses, and communicate this story in a powerful way. We’ll also focus on critical thinking,  problem-solving skills, team collaboration, and the contribution they can have to changing communities and environments.
The Impact

After running a successful pilot last year, this workshop will be the start of an on-going photography program in Livingstone. Through a continuation of our workshops, we eventually aim to equip young Zambians with skills, connections and resources to study photography or filmmaking, or to gain employment in the creative industry. You can find a full overview of the project here.

“This project set me on a path I had for so long discarded, which now, I realize, is my true passion. I am saving up because I will be studying film production in London, so with that said, Ilizwi does more for young people than you realize. It will change the lives of many in ways you can not imagine, which is the beauty of it all.” - Emmanuél Wayne, workshop participant, Zambia
The Collaboration

This project is a collaboration between Greenpop (an environmental NGO), Ilizwi (a youth development initiative that encourages creative self-expression through photography), and the Penda Trust (an NGO that uses photography to generate positive change in developing countries). The workshop will happen as part of Greenpop Zambia, a Livingstone-based project that works to contribute to a solution to the deforestation and consequent ecological and socio-economic impacts the area is facing. Greenpop is doing this by starting a reforestation process, developing a culture of planting trees within communities, encouraging alternative energy sources, and promoting sustainable forest management.
What We Need The funds raised will go towards:
Cameras for the participants
Transport during the workshop
Travel costs for the workshop facilitators, who are part of an Ilizwi team from Khayalitsha, Cape Town, and went through the workshop process themselves
Workshop material and stationary

What You GetIn return for your support, we're exciting to offer you some fun perks! You can choose a print of one of the images that will be taken during the workshop, some traditional Zambian fabric sent to you from Livingstone, or a stunning book on nature photography. You can find the details on the right-hand side.You can also choose a SIGNED print of this stunning image by Jeremy Loops!

And we're excited to have just added this gorgeous illustration, designed specifically for this campaign by the wonderful Paper Tales. For a contribution of $20, we can offer you a limited edition A4 print of it!
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help us out by spreading the word! You could share posts about the campaign from our Facebook page or other social media.
If you have a camera (either point and shoot or SLR) that you're not using anymore and would like to donate it, let us know! We always need extra cameras.",5.0,0,"4 Campaigns

On World's Earth Day, we provide an unique chance to send your feelings about Earth into the space. On this special eve, everyone can also watch space in 360 degree view.
Come on friends, let us join our hands to collaborate on this mission and share our messages &

So, whatever be the message or feelings, which you feel like to convey can be shared, while millions of people watching our space journey. You can even convey your company's resolution or product launch for 2016.

We will help you in designing the message or you can share your design, which is best convenient for you.

How We Do?

We are using weather balloon to travel up to 25 miles from the earth. We are integrating 360 degree camera along with tracking equipment, weather condition report and display screen to show our messages.

THE PICTURE BOOK

“I AM THE HUGGER!” is one of the picture books I wrote and illustrated for Granny Green’s Green Machine, a non-profit, environmental education program for kids.

Granny Green’s Green Machine is an upbeat, amusing and musical look at how children and their grownups can make the world greener, right in their own backyards. With original songs, original picture books, audience participation, and colorful props and puppets made from recycled materials, Granny Green helps children understand how they are connected to the natural world and how they affect it. At the same time, they learn how some of the Earth's cycles and systems work together — just like the parts of a machine!

Along with original songs, I wrote, illustrated and hand-made several picture books for Granny Green’s Green Machine  performances as a way to help me describe Earth systems and sustainable living practices. Other picture books I use in the show include ""The Supercyclers Save Pittsville"", which is about recycling
column2: ""Little Drip Takes a Trip"", which is about the water cycle
column3: and ""Willy The Worm"", which is about composting. Because the response to the books has been so positive, I now need your help to get them published, starting with ""I AM THE HUGGER!"".

column1: Mascot Books, one of the fastest growing independent book publishers in the country, wants to design, print, publish and distribute ""I AM THE HUGGER!"". I need to raise money to cover the costs of publication and promotion of the book.

A published book will also help promote Granny Green's Green Machine . I'm working with the non-profit, Kids For Earth.org to reach as many schools and events as possible. The Kids For Earth board and I believe that a published book will be a great way to spark the interest of more PTOs, PTAs and school boards.

When children understand a concept, they embrace it wholeheartedly. They inevitably ask, “How can I help?”- And if they are entertained along the way, so much the better. The future belongs to them, so it's our job to educate and prepare them for change. You can help with your donation, and by spreading the word about this Indiegogo campaign. It's time for everyone to start hugging more trees!
THE CAMPAIGN GOAL

My goal for publishing 'I AM THE HUGGER!' is $7,000. $3,750.00 of this amount will go to Mascot Books for the design, printing, publishing and limited distribution of the book. I will receive 1000 copies as part of the agreement. The remaining $3,750, will be used for social media promotion of the book and travel expenses for visits to schools, libraries, bookstores and other interested organizations.

With a donation in any amount you will automatically receive a mention on the Granny Green's Green Machine website, a downloadable coloring page, and a downloadable illustration from ""I AM THE HUGGER!"" The larger your contribution, the more perks offered. Perks for larger donations will include mp3s and CDs of songs from Granny Green's Green Machine, copies of ""I AM THE HUGGER!"", and copies of Granny Green's Illustrated Ukulele Chord Book. Perks are laid out in the Perks section of this webpage, but here are some examples:
<div>

If I don't make my goal, the book will still get published, and I'll have to hold back on some of my promotion plans. Success depends so much on promotion, but having a published book to take into schools and libraries will open doors.
From Merriam-Webster’s Dictionary -
tree hugger
noun
: someone who is regarded as foolish or annoying because of being too concerned about protecting trees, animals, and other parts of the natural world from pollution and other threats

Because so many adults still use the word 'treehugger' as an insult, it allows them to dismiss the fact that environmental problems are not only real, they're very serious and very immediate. Children hear the word used pejoratively and repeat a negative message. ""I AM THE HUGGER!"" can help change attitudes.

""I AM THE HUGGER!"" embraces the word with humor and irrefutable facts about the importance of trees. The book's Tree Hugger character is wildly infatuated with trees, and children find that amusing. They're also reminded that trees are essential to life on planet Earth.

I am a professional actor with many New York and regional credits, including The Yale Repertory Theater, The Ridiculous Theatrical Company, Denver Center Theater Company, Goodspeed Opera House and The Papermill Playhouse. I have been performing for children for decades. I performed and developed shows with The Paper Bag Players, and have presented several storytelling and music programs for children in Bergen County, NJ where I live. I am a certified NJ Learns sustainability educator, I've written environmental articles for North Jersey Media's The Suburbanite, and I write an ongoing blog for my Granny Green website. The books I present in Granny Green's Green Machine have gotten a very positive response, and it's now time to publish and promote them, starting with ""I AM THE HUGGER!”
In September of 2014, I self-published another picture book - ""The Dance of the Seahorses"" as an Amazon e-book, and plan to publish a print version soon.
Please have a look:
https://www.amazon.com/Dance-Seahorses-Brenda-Cummings-ebook/dp/B00NX3R0KE#nav-subnav
Educators and parents have more respect for published authors and will be more willing to invite me into schools with a book in hand.

Mascot books combines the best elements of both traditional publishing and pure self-publishing, working with authors through every phase of book production, book marketing, and book distribution. Their titles are professionally produced
column2: and with the backing of Mascot, I'll have access to important distribution channels. Even established authors are now responsible for a large portion of their own book promotions, and this campaign is one way to promote “I AM THE HUGGER!”

column1: You can help me to publish “I AM THE HUGGER!” by contributing to this campaign, or by helping to SPREAD THE WORD!
This Indiegogo website has built-in sharing tools to make that easier.
THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPPORT,
Brenda Cummings (Granny Green)
grannygreensgreenmachine.com

<div style="""">
world’s greatest achievements often start with a seemingly crazy idea. A dream
so big it challenges people to reconsider what is possible. During great
advancements such as the first powered flight or landing on the moon, the
average person was merely a bystander. This amazing project allows you to
be directly involved in achieving the world’s next great scientific
milestone -- solving world hunger.
truly amazing place. We can answer calls from our wrist watch, track calories
and have cars that park themselves, yet we still don’t have a viable solution
to solve world hunger and famine.  The
Kingdom of North Sudan, the world’s newest nation, hopes to solve this problem
with your assistance and fiscal sponsorship. In creating a new country, we have
the opportunity to make it something truly extraordinary: a nation fully
dedicated to researching and developing solutions for our current global food
shortages and impending food crisis.

""Rather than handouts, Africa needs capital investment, entrepreneurial innovation and free trade. Mr. Heaton understands this. The journey that started with a little girl’s dream is still that, but dreams can be seedbeds of massive change. ""
— Lawrence J. McQuillan  The Independent Institute
In supporting the North Sudan Scientific Fund, you
will be contributing to the world’s largest scientific effort for finding a
better way to grow and distribute food.

With your help we’ll be able to put a team together that will help us develop the structure and technology needed to revolutionize the agricultural industry. By having a clean slate, 800 square miles of land, we will work with top notch scientists to build a sustainable and efficient farming system. We’ve developed a 5-year plan so that we can accomplish this goal. Below you will find more details of what it all entails.
How did this idea start?
Like most things in life,
this project originated from the most unlikely of places: a six-year old little
girl’s request to her father.  You see, my little girl Emily asked if she
would ever be a real princess one day. Like any father would do, I told her she
could be anything she wanted. Her eyes lit up with joy
as she thought about that unexpected possibility.
Now most people would have stopped there, but natural curiosity made me
wonder if it might really be possible to make Emily an actual princess. That is when the search to make my little girl’s dream <span>a
reality began. The first step would have to be to find unclaimed,
ungoverned, unpopulated land, and in East Africa I was able to do just that.
<div>
The next step would be to make a flag for this new
country, which we did.
<div style=""text-align: justify
The last step would be to take that flag and plant it
in this new country, which I did on June 16, 2014, little Emily’s 7<sup>th</sup>
birthday.
With this small act of love, the Kingdom of North
Sudan was created and the news quickly traveled around the world<span>, bringing unexpected “fame” to my average and humble family.  But this, we would
soon discover, was just the beginning.
<h2><b>The
“Elon Musk Approach” to Agri-Science
Having created the world’s
newest nation in the heart of the east African desert, the question became<span>, “What do we do with it?”  Emily, having learned
about hungry children in Africa from her elementary school teacher, stated very
clearly, “Grow a garden as big as our country to
feed people!""

column2: >Her simple idea about growing food for people transformed itself into the project you see here today. The revenue generated by this campaign will be used to advance the next great

column1: agricultural revolution. Using the scientific funding methodology pioneered by
Elon Musk (SpaceX and Tesla Motors), we intend
to fully fund the world’s best scientists in a pursuit to identify new, better
ways to grow food using considerably less water, within
a nation whose very existence, laws and regulations will be designed to make it
easier to accomplish such endeavors. All technological advancements will
be provided directly to any other nation, university or corporation, free of charge.
Such important innovations warrant an open
source mentality, nothing less.
Given that the Kingdom of North Sudan is 800 sq. miles in size, it is a blank slate
ready to be developed into a cutting-edge research center for agricultural technology
and energy efficiency.

column5: >Why should you contribute to this campaign?

column1: Human activity over the last few centuries has not
been very kind to our Earth. The repercussions for our past actions are upon
us
column2: we must now improve our relationship with agriculture and water usage.

column1: Conditions are becoming less than ideal in our breadbasket areas across the
globe as crop production suffers due to an increasing lack of water. Much of
the water, approximately 70%, used in agriculture is wasted
via runoff or evaporation. This is a considerable amount of waste when one
factors in the fact that agriculture consumes
approximately 70% of the world’s accessible fresh water supply.
*http://wwf.panda.org/what_we_do/footprint/agriculture/impacts/water_use/
<div style=""text-align: justify
We believe that by dedicating an entire nation to
achieving agricultural improvements and building a nation that is 100%
sustainable, we will gain the necessary knowledge and technological advancement
to improve our future here on Earth.
it a lot to take on? Yes. Is it a huge project? Yes.
it is the nature of these challenges that motivates us, as it did when we
decided to fly, went to the Moon, sent rovers to Mars and explored the depths
of the ocean.  The world does not lack
the intellectual capacity to better itself.
What we do seem to lack is a concerted effort within a “user friendly”
environment whereby the best and brightest can come together.  With the
funds from this campaign, we will be able to start collaborating with
top scientists and find new ways of growing food more efficiently, using less water, in a cost-effective manner. To achieve greatness, you have to dream big, and
that is what we are doing. We need your help in making this dream a
reality.
<ul>
<li><b><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >If you are frustrated with the lack of substantial progress being made to

column1: counteract the impact of climate change on Earth, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
<li><b><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
you are a farmer hoping to find a better way to grow food that doesn’t require genetic modification, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
<li><b><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >If you want to leave this world a better place for your children,

column1: grandchildren and great grandchildren, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
proving people wrong who say something can’t be done, THIS PROJECT IS MOST CERTAINLY FOR YOU!
<div>
<h2><b>What are
the next steps and how will the funds be used:
The North Sudan Scientific
Fund will be used for the development of the Agricultural Research Center
affectionately called the ARC. The ARC is a modern scientific lifeboat designed
to save lives by unlocking new advances in agriculture: preventing starvation,
hunger and climate related interruptions in the food supply system.  The North Sudan Scientific Fund ARC will
allow the world’s best scientists to conduct meaningful research and
collaborate in a fully-funded laboratory.
Building a country from the
ground up is a huge task, and we are aware that there may be unexpected
obstacles, but we have spent time detailing a plan to define what the first
steps are to achieve this.
and Diplomacy
The
Kingdom of North Sudan has identified the need for advancement in
agricultural  science that combats the
effects of global warming on crop production.
The Kingdom of North Sudan seeks to develop an Agricultural Research
Center (ARC) designed to house scientists, all necessary complementary personnel, and their families in an environment that is 100% clean energy-powered and
highly sustainable.  North Sudan will
continuously work to cultivate key Diplomatic and Trade relationships with its
neighbors (Egypt and Sudan) to facilitate the needs of the ARC throughout the
entire Project and into the future post-completion.
Phase 1 – Concept
Development – 1 Year – ($500,000)
The
Kingdom of North Sudan seeks this funding to explore the following dynamics of
the North Sudan Scientific Fund Program: Feasibility Study, Risk Management
Plan and Cost Benefit Analysis.  This
will allow for defining the boundaries of concepts to be explored, and develop
an understanding of the initial natural and human resources needed to support
the project.
Phase 2 – Planning,
Staffing and Requirement Analysis – 2 Years – ($3,000,000)
During
this phase the Kingdom of North Sudan will develop a Project Management Plan
for the execution of the desired goals and objectives outlined in Phase 1.  This phase will determine the intellectual
human capital needed to achieve the goals of the North Sudan Scientific Fund.  This phase will identify and solicit the
world’s best agricultural scientists, renewable energy experts, water
purification specialists, plant nutritionists, social scientists, geologists,
climatologist, urban planners, regional experts and other consultants needed to
create the North Sudan Scientific Fund Committee.
Once
established, the NSSF Committee will formalize the needs and requirements for
the Agricultural Research Center (ARC).
This phase will establish two interconnected aspects of the ARC:
1.  Agricultural
R&amp
between current agricultural science technology and the requirements associated
with exploration of untested theory and practice will be identified.  This will identify gaps between modern
processes and desired outcomes for subjects such as crop efficiency, plant health,
growing environments, LPLD (Local Production / Local Distribution), Production
FWL (Food Waste and Loss), improvements for small farm stakeholders,
aquaponic/hydroponic nutritional requirements and more.  This process will determine a starting core
selection of crops and processes that are well suited for exploration in the
context of growth in a protected environment, as well as to specify efficient
space allocation and resource utilization.
2.  Social
Requirements:  Key necessities will be
determined to ensure the needs of the family unit are met within the ARC, as
the ARC will in effect be a self-sustaining city center, and must address
family life outside the work environment.
This stage will include requirements for facilities for education, recreation,
medical services, transportation and more.
Phase 3 – Design – 2
The
North Sudan Scientific Fund will work to transform the detailed requirements
into a complete, detailed system design.  The design and construct of the ARC will focus
on the best, most sustainable and efficient methods to deliver the required
functionality needed by scientists to explore advanced methods for crop
production, as well as the necessities for a family living in the ARC.  The design phase will be marketed globally
and will allow design firms to pitch designs that will capture the social and technical
specifications of the ARC.
Phase 4 – Implementation of Preliminary Infrastructure – 3 Years ($50,000,000)
This
phase sets the foundation for the construction of the ARC. This phase will establish key elements such
as efficient transport systems from locations in Egypt and Sudan to North
Sudan, the development of water resources within the country, power facilities,
etc.
Phase 5 – ARC
Construction – 3 Years – ($150,000,000)
This
is the final Phase of the project, overlapping with the final year of Phase 4: The construction of the ARC.  Construction will represent approximately 30%
of the long-term design plans for the ARC facility.  Approximately 50% of future construction will
be allocated for expansion of R&amp
column2: D facilities and assets, with the remaining

column1: 20% for additional infrastructure such as housing, parks, social venues, etc.
The overall project goal for
5 years is $505.5 million<span>.  This is equal to 10% of the United States
population contributing $15 or only 5% of the population of Europe giving $16
Euros.

project and attract larger donors with shared goals.

","The
world’s greatest achievements often start with a seemingly crazy idea. A dream
so big it challenges people to reconsider what is possible. During great
advancements such as the first powered flight or landing on the moon, the
average person was merely a bystander. This amazing project allows you to
be directly involved in achieving the world’s next great scientific
milestone -- solving world hunger.
Our modern world is a
truly amazing place. We can answer calls from our wrist watch, track calories
and have cars that park themselves, yet we still don’t have a viable solution
to solve world hunger and famine.  The
Kingdom of North Sudan, the world’s newest nation, hopes to solve this problem
with your assistance and fiscal sponsorship. In creating a new country, we have
the opportunity to make it something truly extraordinary: a nation fully
dedicated to researching and developing solutions for our current global food
shortages and impending food crisis.

Rather than handouts, Africa needs capital investment, entrepreneurial innovation and free trade. Mr. Heaton understands this. The journey that started with a little girl’s dream is still that, but dreams can be seedbeds of massive change. ""— Lawrence J. McQuillan  The Independent Institute
In supporting the North Sudan Scientific Fund, you
will be contributing to the world’s largest scientific effort for finding a
better way to grow and distribute food.

With your help we’ll be able to put a team together that will help us develop the structure and technology needed to revolutionize the agricultural industry. By having a clean slate, 800 square miles of land, we will work with top notch scientists to build a sustainable and efficient farming system. We’ve developed a 5-year plan so that we can accomplish this goal. Below you will find more details of what it all entails.
How did this idea start?
Like most things in life,
this project originated from the most unlikely of places: a six-year old little
girl’s request to her father.  You see, my little girl Emily asked if she
would ever be a real princess one day. Like any father would do, I told her she
could be anything she wanted. Her eyes lit up with joy
as she thought about that unexpected possibility.
Now most people would have stopped there, but natural curiosity made me
wonder if it might really be possible to make Emily an actual princess. That is when the search to make my little girl’s dream a
reality began. The first step would have to be to find unclaimed,
ungoverned, unpopulated land, and in East Africa I was able to do just that.
The next step would be to make a flag for this new
country, which we did.
The last step would be to take that flag and plant it
in this new country, which I did on June 16, 2014, little Emily’s 7th
birthday.
With this small act of love, the Kingdom of North
Sudan was created and the news quickly traveled around the world, bringing unexpected “fame” to my average and humble family.  But this, we would
soon discover, was just the beginning.
The
“Elon Musk Approach” to Agri-Science
Having created the world’s
newest nation in the heart of the east African desert, the question became, “What do we do with it?”  Emily, having learned
about hungry children in Africa from her elementary school teacher, stated very
clearly, “Grow a garden as big as our country to
feed people!""
Her simple idea about growing food for people transformed itself into the project you see here today. The revenue generated by this campaign will be used to advance the next great
agricultural revolution. Using the scientific funding methodology pioneered by
Elon Musk (SpaceX and Tesla Motors), we intend
to fully fund the world’s best scientists in a pursuit to identify new, better
ways to grow food using considerably less water, within
a nation whose very existence, laws and regulations will be designed to make it
easier to accomplish such endeavors. All technological advancements will
be provided directly to any other nation, university or corporation, free of charge.
Such important innovations warrant an open
source mentality, nothing less.
Given that the Kingdom of North Sudan is 800 sq. miles in size, it is a blank slate
ready to be developed into a cutting-edge research center for agricultural technology
and energy efficiency.
Why should you contribute to this campaign?
Human activity over the last few centuries has not
been very kind to our Earth. The repercussions for our past actions are upon
us
column2: we must now improve our relationship with agriculture and water usage.

column1: Conditions are becoming less than ideal in our breadbasket areas across the
globe as crop production suffers due to an increasing lack of water. Much of
the water, approximately 70%, used in agriculture is wasted
via runoff or evaporation. This is a considerable amount of waste when one
factors in the fact that agriculture consumes
approximately 70% of the world’s accessible fresh water supply.
*http://wwf.panda.org/what_we_do/footprint/agriculture/impacts/water_use/
We believe that by dedicating an entire nation to
achieving agricultural improvements and building a nation that is 100%
sustainable, we will gain the necessary knowledge and technological advancement
to improve our future here on Earth.
Is
it a lot to take on? Yes. Is it a huge project? Yes. But
it is the nature of these challenges that motivates us, as it did when we
decided to fly, went to the Moon, sent rovers to Mars and explored the depths
of the ocean.  The world does not lack
the intellectual capacity to better itself.
What we do seem to lack is a concerted effort within a “user friendly”
environment whereby the best and brightest can come together.  With the
funds from this campaign, we will be able to start collaborating with
top scientists and find new ways of growing food more efficiently, using less water, in a cost-effective manner. To achieve greatness, you have to dream big, and
that is what we are doing. We need your help in making this dream a
reality.
If you are frustrated with the lack of substantial progress being made to
counteract the impact of climate change on Earth, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
If
you are a farmer hoping to find a better way to grow food that doesn’t require genetic modification, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
If you want to leave this world a better place for your children,
grandchildren and great grandchildren, THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOU!
If you love
proving people wrong who say something can’t be done, THIS PROJECT IS MOST CERTAINLY FOR YOU!
What are
the next steps and how will the funds be used:
The North Sudan Scientific
Fund will be used for the development of the Agricultural Research Center
affectionately called the ARC. The ARC is a modern scientific lifeboat designed
to save lives by unlocking new advances in agriculture: preventing starvation,
hunger and climate related interruptions in the food supply system.  The North Sudan Scientific Fund ARC will
allow the world’s best scientists to conduct meaningful research and
collaborate in a fully-funded laboratory.
Building a country from the
ground up is a huge task, and we are aware that there may be unexpected
obstacles, but we have spent time detailing a plan to define what the first
steps are to achieve this.
Phase 0 – Project Initiation
and Diplomacy
The
Kingdom of North Sudan has identified the need for advancement in
agricultural  science that combats the
effects of global warming on crop production.
The Kingdom of North Sudan seeks to develop an Agricultural Research
Center (ARC) designed to house scientists, all necessary complementary personnel, and their families in an environment that is 100% clean energy-powered and
highly sustainable.  North Sudan will
continuously work to cultivate key Diplomatic and Trade relationships with its
neighbors (Egypt and Sudan) to facilitate the needs of the ARC throughout the
entire Project and into the future post-completion.
Phase 1 – Concept
Development – 1 Year – ($500,000)
The
Kingdom of North Sudan seeks this funding to explore the following dynamics of
the North Sudan Scientific Fund Program: Feasibility Study, Risk Management
Plan and Cost Benefit Analysis.  This
will allow for defining the boundaries of concepts to be explored, and develop
an understanding of the initial natural and human resources needed to support
the project.
Phase 2 – Planning,
Staffing and Requirement Analysis – 2 Years – ($3,000,000)
During
this phase the Kingdom of North Sudan will develop a Project Management Plan
for the execution of the desired goals and objectives outlined in Phase 1.  This phase will determine the intellectual
human capital needed to achieve the goals of the North Sudan Scientific Fund.  This phase will identify and solicit the
world’s best agricultural scientists, renewable energy experts, water
purification specialists, plant nutritionists, social scientists, geologists,
climatologist, urban planners, regional experts and other consultants needed to
create the North Sudan Scientific Fund Committee.
Once
established, the NSSF Committee will formalize the needs and requirements for
the Agricultural Research Center (ARC).
This phase will establish two interconnected aspects of the ARC:
1.  Agricultural
R&D Requirements:  The parameters
between current agricultural science technology and the requirements associated
with exploration of untested theory and practice will be identified.  This will identify gaps between modern
processes and desired outcomes for subjects such as crop efficiency, plant health,
growing environments, LPLD (Local Production / Local Distribution), Production
FWL (Food Waste and Loss), improvements for small farm stakeholders,
aquaponic/hydroponic nutritional requirements and more.  This process will determine a starting core
selection of crops and processes that are well suited for exploration in the
context of growth in a protected environment, as well as to specify efficient
space allocation and resource utilization.
2.  Social
Requirements:  Key necessities will be
determined to ensure the needs of the family unit are met within the ARC, as
the ARC will in effect be a self-sustaining city center, and must address
family life outside the work environment.
This stage will include requirements for facilities for education, recreation,
medical services, transportation and more.
Phase 3 – Design – 2
The
North Sudan Scientific Fund will work to transform the detailed requirements
into a complete, detailed system design.  The design and construct of the ARC will focus
on the best, most sustainable and efficient methods to deliver the required
functionality needed by scientists to explore advanced methods for crop
production, as well as the necessities for a family living in the ARC.  The design phase will be marketed globally
and will allow design firms to pitch designs that will capture the social and technical
specifications of the ARC.
Phase 4 – Implementation of Preliminary Infrastructure – 3 Years ($50,000,000)
This
phase sets the foundation for the construction of the ARC. This phase will establish key elements such
as efficient transport systems from locations in Egypt and Sudan to North
Sudan, the development of water resources within the country, power facilities,
etc.
Phase 5 – ARC
Construction – 3 Years – ($150,000,000)
This
is the final Phase of the project, overlapping with the final year of Phase 4: The construction of the ARC.  Construction will represent approximately 30%
of the long-term design plans for the ARC facility.  Approximately 50% of future construction will
be allocated for expansion of R&D facilities and assets, with the remaining
20% for additional infrastructure such as housing, parks, social venues, etc.
The overall project goal for
5 years is $505.5 million.  This is equal to 10% of the United States
population contributing $15 or only 5% of the population of Europe giving $16
Euros.
