","OBRIST C-TransformerNeed further details? Check out our OCT webpage with further information, explanations and videos from supporters, scientists and up to 100 answered questions:www.obrist-c-transformer.comWhat happens when a tree-hugger, a technical mathematician, an expert in emission avoidance and some scientists from the US and Austria are working together? Something good for Mother Nature and humankind.The world's most burning problem today is climate change. How we deal with it will determine if we have a future or if we will join the dinosaurs. We've noticed that everyone is telling us what we shouldn't do, but nobody is telling us what we can do. We want to change that.Throwing all our knowledge together in one pot and observing nature gave us the idea for the OBRIST C-Transformer. A machine that will combine many different technologies and navigate through our forests. A machine inspired by nature and created for nature to overcome what our planet cannot manage by itself anymore, and ultimately, what caused climate change: CO2 produced by humans. We have the concept and scientific proof.Now we need you to help us make it a reality and to transform our planet together. Why this is importantThrough various forms of transportation and industries we have caused an extremely high amount of CO2 emissions. We have destroyed the natural balance and nature cannot cope anymore.The OBRIST C-Transformer will use natural resources to possibly not only stop climate change, but also to create a chance to turn it around. It will utilize the natural process of the trees to pull CO2 from the air. The technologies needed will be optimized for the OBRIST C-Transformer to ensure the ability to act as quickly as possible. Why it worksCarbon dioxide in the atmosphere is necessary for plants and trees to grow. Forests play a specific and important role in the global carbon cycle by absorbing carbon dioxide during photosynthesis, storing carbon above and below the ground, and producing oxygen as a by-product of photosynthesis (US Department of Agriculture Forest Service)However, without the OBRIST C-Transformer our forests are close to CO2 neutral. This means they bind and release almost similar amouts of carbon during their life span. With the help of the OBRIST C-Transformer, our forests will be revitalized and able to reduce CO2 from the atmosphere for the long term.

How? Before a tree dies and releases its carbon, which has been stored in its wood during its life span back into the atmosphere, the OBRIST C-Transformer will turn its trunk into biochar and introduce it into the forest's ground. In this manner, the carbon improves soil fertility and the release of carbon back into our atmosphere is prevented.

Even more, the OBRIST C-Transformer will not only address the problem of too much CO2 in our atmosphere, but simultaneously it will help revitalize our forests by planting new trees and seedlings, leading to a greater biodiversity and creating healthy, self-sustaining and thriving ecosystems. In this manner, it could be optimally used to transform areas of monoculture into lively permaculture.
Results

The OBRIST C-Transformer will be a long-term solution for our environment. After having reached the point of worldwide carbon neutrality, the OBRIST C-Transformer can continue to actually reverse climate change and keep converting our forest areas into forests full of healthy biodiversity. This will make them self-sustaining, just like forests used to be before we humans destroyed the balance.

Another key factor is the economic stimulation of areas which are usually economically low by providing an opportunity to generate revenue from these forests without destroying the natural biodiversity. The OBRIST C-Transformer will impulse the reforestation of harvested areas and the afforestation of degraded monoculture areas. The OBRIST C-TransformerCreating fertile soil. Planting new trees. Renewing our forests. And providing a solution to not only stop climate change, but also to create a chance to turn it around. The story behindWho we are: Nickole Lewis, Chris Meusburger, Frank Obrist and a bunch of other people, all working together at OBRIST Technologies Inc. (Whittier, California) and OBRIST Engineering (Lustenau, Austria). Our companies have been focused on emission avoidance and reduction technologies for 20 years.  During the past two decades the OBRIST group emerged as the technology leader in mobile applications based on the natural refrigerant R744. With the implementation of OBRIST compressor technologies, the first eco-friendly air conditioning was implemented in the Mercedes S-Class mass production.The ideaThe idea of the OBRIST C-Transformer was born by Frank Obrist, founder of the OBRIST group together with Robert Schlögl, the director at the Fritz Haber institute of the Max Planck society. Discussing the possibility to use biomass as fuel, Frank had the flash of wit to support forests in reducing carbon and to provide a solution that can fix a problem generated over many generations - climate change.Nickole Lewis from the US, working as an international project manager at OBRIST Technologies and calling herself a tree-hugger and pro-earth, was intrigued by the possibility of creating a machine that will give something back to Mother Nature instead of exploiting her while simultaneously doing something against climate change. She instantly joined the development and sided with Chris Meusburger, a technical mathematician in his early twenties. Chris likes down-to-earth solutions and is focused on using approved technologies to implement the OBRIST C-Transformer
column2: a machine that will use already existing solutions and create a chance that nobody thought was possible. Crowdfunding and why we need itWorldwide solutions need worldwide actions. Climate change concerns us all and we believe that saving our planet should be a top priority for all nations worldwide. If everything remains as is our children's future will be bleak. We need fast and efficient action. Nevertheless, the development of the OBRIST C-Transformer requires money. It can only be put into reality if we all stick together.Our plansOur first phase will be to examine core processes of the OBRIST C-Transformer like pyrolysis, storage potentials, the scope of the processes and the size of the machine needed. We then plan to link worldwide with scientists and universities for the development phase. Our tentative goal is series production by 2025. All together we are looking at a total investment of one billion dollars. We would like to finance the first part of this amount through crowdfunding while at the same time creating global awareness for our project.Funding steps: Finances and actions$500.000,00 and above, within the first yearEvaluation of core-topics such as sizing, pyrolysis process, machine concept, total c-transforming capacity$1.000.000,00 and above, within the first yearPossibility to raise worldwide awareness and to get in contact with universities, researchers, scientists worldwide. We will be able to fine tune the core-topics.$2.000.000,00 and above, within the first yearPreparation of a scientific team setup including universities, laboratories, research institutions worldwide$5.000.000,00 and above, within the first yearDiving deeper in the process, first simulation possible, full theoretical approach, more detailed design studies: How will the OBRIST C-Transformer technology work in detail?$10.000.000,00 and above, within the next 3 yearsSelected, simplified practical pre-tests with the global researching teamFocus on most critical and most risky processes and aspects$20.000.000,00 and above, within the next 3 yearsEvaluation of research results and 2nd loop of critical, practical pre-tests
column3: Evaluation and first contacts to worldwide companies for hardware design & supply$50.000.000,00, within the next 3 yearsBeginning of the setup of first hardware prototypes of the single sub-units in decentral approach$50.000.000,00 and above, within the next 4 to 5 yearsFocus on critical aspects and energy processes
column4: Integration of worldwide activists, major companies

column6: $500.000.000,00 and above, within the next 6 to 7 yearsFirst movable prototype in reduced scale
column7: Confirmation of efficiency, storing capacity and working principle
column8: development and integration of real hardware units in reduced scale

NOTRE PROJET - IMMERSION À LA RENCONTRE DES GARDIENS DE LA FORÊT

On entend généralement parler de l'Amazonie en terme de disparition de la forêt, de sa faune et de sa flore, de la perte du couvert forestier qui disparaît à chaque jour. Ce qui amène à se sentir impuissant devant ce qui semble inéluctable. Or, des peuples en Amazonie vivent depuis toujours au contact de la forêt et ont développé des pratiques ancestrales pour la protéger. Avec ce projet, nous partirons à la rencontre des gardiens de la forêt amazonienne, pour leur donner une voix et faire connaître ces pratiques qui sont un espoir pour l'environnement.

IMPACT DU PROJET

Ce projet porte sur la protection de la forêt amazonienne mais au lieu de se concentrer sur sa disparition, il met de l'avant des initiatives de protection. Ce projet est à la fois un voyage d'immersion culturelle et dans la forêt, pour mieux sentir la connexion avec cet environnement, ou ce que d'autres nomment  : les esprits de la forêt.

Nous irons visiter des gens qui vivent étroitement avec la forêt et ses richesses, telles les communautés qui récoltent la noix du brésil ou le guarana de manière équitable. Nous irons aussi visiter des gens qui se battent contre des projets destructeur de l'environnement, comme la lutte des peuples Shuars et Saparas face aux pétrolières en Équateur. Ces visions sont une inspiration pour tous à l'époque actuelle, face aux contexte des changements climatiques. Nous voulons partager ces visions ainsi que l'idée que chacun peut poser des gestes pour l'environnement.

Ce projet nous amènera à traverser l'Amazonie durant 3 mois, d'est en ouest, du Brésil à l'Équateur, en passant par le Pérou. De cette traversée, nous réaliserons un film, des reportages et des photos ainsi qu'une série de conférences au retour, pour partager les visions des peuples de la forêt.

• Aller à la rencontre de gardiens de la forêt. Ces gens peuvent représenter des guides pour l'humanité, devant la crise écologique à laquelle nous faisons face. Nous voulons leur donner la parole puis présenter leur vision et les moyens qu'ils mettent en place pour la protection de ce bel environnement qu'ils habitent.
• Documenter des initiatives de protection de l'environnement des peuples et des gens qui habitent l'Amazonie.
• Partager l'idée que nous pouvons tous faire des changements dans nos modes de vie et s'engager pour la protection de l'environnement.
QUI NOUS SOMMES :
column2: />MARIEJO est ethnogéographe, écologiste, conférencière, auteure et journaliste. Elle est la gagnante de l'édition 2017 du prix Karavaniers pour l’aventure voyage, culture et découverte de la Bourse Osez l’aventure!, offerte en partenariat avec Frédéric Dion, Karavaniers, Mountain Hardwear et la revue Espaces. Engagée pour la protection de l'environnement et les droits humains. Mariejo a un esprit scientifique et grand désir de communiquer. Dans le passé, elle a accumulé des expériences en journalisme, comme auteure de livre de voyage et responsable des communications. Elle est aussi spécialiste des droits humains et des droits des peuples autochtones et a travaillé en coopération internationale et dans des organismes au Québec et en Amérique latine. Elle s’implique pour la protection de l'environnement et la défense des droits humains depuis plusieurs années et a cofondée des organisations (Fondation Coule pas chez nous et la Marche des peuples pour la Terre Mère). À travers ce projet qui réunit ses intérêts et met de l'avant ses forces, Mariejo souhaite aussi redonner du sens à sa militance et s'inspirer d'exemples concrets.
column7: >réalisateur/scénariste de documentaire, il s’intéresse aux luttes sociales et à leurs impacts dans la société. En 2000, il co-réalise son premier documentaire: Les illusions du libre-échange. En 2002, il est l'un des co-fondateurs du Collectif des Lucioles. En 2004 commence sa collaboration avec Parole citoyenne de l’ONF. À partir de 2009, il prend part, à titre de cinéaste/reporter, aux délégations québécoises en Palestine pour témoigner de l’occupation. En 2012, il co-réalise son premier long-métrage documentaire, Carré rouge sur fond noir, récipiendaire de deux Prix Gémeaux (meilleur documentaire enjeux de société et meilleur scénario). En 2013 il participe Olivier D.Asselin à la co-scénarisation du documentaire Pipeline, pouvoir et démocratie. En 2014, l'ONF produit son 2e long-métrage documentaire intitulé Un journaliste au front, sélectionné pour la clôture des Rencontres internationales du documentaire à Montréal (RIDM 2016). Il termine actuellement un long-métrage sur Natasha Kanapé Fontaine. Le documentaire Amazonie : à la rencontre des gardiens de la forêt sera son 4e long-
column9:
>métrage.

 

CE DONT NOUS AVONS BESOIN ET CE QUE VOUS OBTENEZ

Notre expédition durera 3 mois. Votre contribution nous aidera au niveau de la subsistance et du matériel nécessaire.

column1: • Pour les frais de l'expédition : nourritures, logement et transports (les bateaux).
• Pour les besoins de matériel manquant : une caméra, un objectif photo et un petit ordinateur portable.

Chaque don offre une contrepartie. Tous les contributeurs recevrons un billet pour notre conférence de retour ainsi que son nom au générique du film. Puis, selon les montants, vous pouvez obtenir, soit une reproduction d'un des meilleurs clichés pris par Mariejo en Amazonie, un collier fait par des femmes shuars de l'Équateur, un souper, un rendez-vous Skype avec nous, etc.

Avec votre don, vous faites un peu partie du projet! Alors, voici 4 raisons pour nous aider :
• Donner une voix aux gardiens de la forêt.
• Montrer des exemples de communautés protectrices de leur environnement.
• Soutenir une militante écologiste.
• Soutenir un cinéaste engagé du Québec.

RISQUES ET DÉFIS

Un voyage comme celui-ci comporte des risques dont nous sommes conscients. Mariejo a une bonne connaissance des régions à traverser et des cultures humaines et parle espagnol et portugais. Elle s'entraine chaque jour afin d'être en forme. De son côté, Santiago a une grande expérience de tournage dans des régions instables et connait bien son équipement. Le fait de voyager à deux permettra plus de sécurité.

D'AUTRES FAÇONS D'AIDER

N'hésitez pas à passer le mot autour de vous! Parce que seuls nous ne sommes qu'une goutte d'eau, mais ensemble nous sommes un fleuve, aidez-nous à remonter le courant!

MERCI INFINIMENT! ---------------------------------------
column5:
>PROJECT DESCRIPTION 

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY: Encountering the Guardians of the Forest Film is a feature-length documentary film in the Amazon, highlighting examples of protection in the Amazon rainforest, while linking with environmental issues in Canada.

This project will involve the team’s journey across the Amazonian region from east to west, from Brazil to Ecuador, through Peru, to meet the guardians of the forest.

PHILOSOPHY OF THE PROJECT: We usually hear about the Amazon in terms of the disappearance of the forest, its fauna and flora, the forest cover that disappears every day and the urgency to act. This can lead to feeling helpless in the face of what seems inevitable. This project focuses on the protection of the Amazon rainforest but instead of focusing on its disappearance, it puts forward initiatives to protect forests and people who live there.

THE PROJECT'S OBJECTIVES :

column1: • To meet the protectors of the forest. These people can be guides for humanity in the ecological crisis. As part of this project we will meet them, help give voice to their struggles, present their vision and explore their strategies to protect these beautiful ecosystems they inhabit.
• Documenting environmental protection initiatives - Put forward initiatives to protect people and the people who live there.
• Share the idea that we can all make changes in our lifestyles and commit to protecting the environment.
• It is therefore both a human and cultural challenge as well as a communication project that will be featured in a film, conferences, on a website and in interviews with the media.

My Passion to build Clean Solar Power Plant

Hello, I am Thureen Khan and I want to talk to you about My Passion for Solar Power as an energy source. My dream is to build a pollution free solar power plant that will generate sustainable energy supply and at the same time be environment friendly. Fossil fuels such as Coal and Natural Gas are leading pollutants contributing to climate change.
We all talk about our planet and our environment. We spend time
researching and debating climate change and global warming.  We can
sit around doing nothing or we can take a stand and begin making
changes. I am all for spreading the word and educating on this important
issue but talk alone cannot insight change. I believe to see change we each need to take a stand and the time is now.
I need your help to make my dream a reality. With your financial contribution we will be able to make definite difference!
<ul>

• My idea is to build a 50,000 Watt (50 kW) solar power plant. I have an aggressive plan to get this done in a year so we can start making a difference ASAP. Initially, I became interested in the idea when I decided to use solar energy to power my backyard fountain. The insight I gained through my experience with the project lead me to think of more ways to use solar power. By harnessing the power of the sun we have a source of renewable energy that is clean and environmentally safe.  Solar power usage will help reduce our dependence on fossil fuel which in turn will leave greener footprints that benefits our communities and our planet.

• Let me till you a bit more about myself and my background. My name is Thureen Khan and I am a Software Engineer. I have 8 years of experience as a Software Engineer having worked on projects such as the NASA's Space Shuttle, GeoEye Satellite images for Google Earth, etc. Furthermore, I have recently completed a Master Degree in System Engineer Management (SEM). My SEM degree enables me to fully utilize all my training and talent to proficiently navigate every stage of management ensuring success.

• With your contribution we can start making immediate impacts. As my graphic shows 50 kW is enough power to make us stop using 14,500 trees or 5.8 million pounds of coal!  In fact, 50 kW should enough to power 10 medium size household for an entire year. Join me in starting this project today so we can start making a difference!
<div>

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""435"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2Ffjd1FJJNKf4%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp

What We Need 

Currently, we are trying get at least $15,000 to buy land requirement for solar power plant.

In order to purchase the land, I plan to put in $15K of my own money and combine it with your contribution. The target for land price is about $30K total. Even if this project doesn't meet the funding requirement, whatever fund is raised will be put towards the land.

The total project cost is estimated at $120,000 for the 50,000 watt solar power plant. This is less than $2.40 cost per watt, which is less than the usual $4.00 per watt you see other solar developers charge. Here is the break down of costs:

Perks You Get

column1:
The Impact

Without your contribution this project will not be possible! Currently, it is not cost efficient to build a green renewable energy power plant compared to fossil fuel burning plants.

This is where you come in! With your help we can build the solar power plant and provide clean energy. Sitting back and waiting won't help. Currently only 10% of U.S. Energy usage is from renewable sources and solar power is 0.2%.

However, solar power has the greatest potential of all these sources for energy. The graphic below shows the total supply of fossil fuels on the planet vs the yearly energy potential from renewable sources.

Notice the solar power has the greatest potential of all the sources. And once you build it, you essentially get free power from the sun. Lets not forget the damage fossil fuels are causing either. The greenhouse gases are causing climate with major impacts around world.

Just on July 23, 2015 the EPA Concludes Climate Change Is Biggest Issue of Our Time in Recent Report.
You have the power to help fight climate change. By contributing to this project you can start making a difference in this world in as little time as a year! The future depends on your action so please join me in funding this project and save the planet.
<h3>Risks &amp
There are risks and challenges to this project and some of them already have been overcome. Challenges that has been dealt with:
• The electrical grid connection agreement and requirements for building a solar power planet
• Electricity utility that will buy back solar power
• Choices for most cost efficient solar panels
• Choices for most cost efficient DC to AC Inverter to supply DC solar power back to the AC Grid
There are still a few more hurdles to get across such as funding, the final design, and construction of the site.

However, with your assistance we can get past them. I have the necessary skill and know-how to surmount the obstacles and have already made initial progress needed for this project. Raising funds through the crowd funding website will help us deal with the funding challenge, and  at the same time build a community of supporters for this project. Once we have funds we can hire a professional electricaian to finalize the design and get a construction professional builder to finish the building the plant. This all depends on you, so please contribute to make a difference now!

Do you like this project, but no cash to donate? You still can Help!!!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!

column6:
>Somos una fundación sin fines de lucro que tiene como misión recuperar y conservar ecosistemas degradados de la Patagonia chilena.

La fundación nace el año 2011, tras el voraz incendio en el Parque Nacional Torres Del Paine que arrasó con alrededor de 17.600 hectáreas. Somos la campaña de reforestación nativa más grande en la historia de nuestro país, hemos plantado más de 300 mil árboles nativos en la Patagonia, y tenemos como meta plantar 1 millón de árboles nativos.

column1: En esta campaña de creación del bosque #EmbajadoresReforestemos buscamos contribuir con la plantación de nuevos árboles para nuestra Patagonia, pero sobre todo,  invitar a nuestros embajadores a seguir siendo parte activa de esta gran campaña y ser protagonistas en la recuperación y conservación de uno de los principales pulmones verdes del Planeta, - La Patagonia chilena -
<div>Los invitamos a sumar más embajadores a esta noble causa<span style=""background-color: initial
<div>
¿Qué plantamos y dónde?

Gracias a una alianza con Conaf, plantamos en parques y reservas nacionales de la Patagonia.

Especies: Coigue, Lenga, Ñirre.
Zonas: Parque Nacional Torres del Paine, Parque Nacional Laguna San Rafael, Reserva Nacional Cerro Castillo y Reserva Nacional Lago Carlota.
¿Qué necesitamos para crear este gran bosque?
Todos los aportes son importantes! cada granito de arena hará crecer este gran bosque y contribuirá con nuevos árboles nativos para nuestra Patagonia.

En agradecimiento a tu colaboración crearemos el bosque #EmbajadoresReforestemos , plantaremos árboles en tu nombre y haremos públicos nuestros agradecimientos en nuestras redes! nuestros embajadores y seguidores son el mayor activo y respaldo para nosotros, invita a tus amigos a ser protagonistas de esta gran campaña.

¿Como puedo ayudar en la campaña?
Además de realizar tu aporte, puedes ayudar enormemente a la campaña compartiéndola con tus amigos y conocidos, invitándolos a aportar y tomar un rol activo de la gran campaña Reforestemos Patagonia.

Short Summary
Tyreless Limited exists purely and simply to provide
column2: by quickshop""> businesses and local communities a service to ensure that waste tyres are reused, recycled and repurposed responsibly. That means not put into landfill, or exported abroad or other
column3: by quickshop""> markets to burn as fuel, as other companies do! Our ultimate goal and vision is to work with businesses and local governments to ensure that tyre waste is disposed of in an environmentally friendly manner
column4:
ultimately we believe that a sustainable industry is achievable in the rubber industry and as such have an ethos that where possible we will work with makers of tyres and other rubber products to ensure that ""no new rubber"" is used in production of rubber goods but instead recycled alternatives to ensure sustainable industry.

The team is made up of 3
column5: by quickshop""> members at present
column6:
myself Jason Wade, Anthony Brzozowski and Joseph Wade. Between us we have 15 years armed forces experience and 14 years experience of Engineering and Manufacturing environments. So in essence we have a disciplined, proactive approach and proven experience at producing results in challenging working environments.

What we need &
column7:
what you get

We need your help to raise money for:

 Securing a unit/ base of operations (deposit &
column8:
initial insurance/lease) @ 10k

We can appreciate this is a large sum of money
column9:
however with this money we will be able to generate a platform, from which we can launch the business. Once fully operational we can begin generating prodcuts for uses such as equestrian/menage areas, soft play areas, walkways and many more implications. 

Our end goal and 5 year strategic plan means that we will refine this crumb further for the manufacture of our patent pending rubber reform blocks that have practicle applications for soundproofing, insulation and disaster relief housing and structures. 

We are realistic and know that to reach 10k through donations would be beyond our wildest dreams. However no matter how small the contribution it all helps.

The biggest challenge for our team at the moment is establishing a base as we require understanding neighbours and a substantial yard area. So any initial funding would go towards helping us achieve this important milestone so that we can start doing what we said we would
column13:
Challenges

At the moment we perceive the largest risk to be the selling of product. We have done our homework using SWOT and PESTLE analysis and in doing so identified competitors and barriers to entry.

column1: Honestly, the barriers are relatively low. The biggest challenge is developing a supply chain and customer base
column2: apologies for being blunt at this point but no amount of research can prepare you for that. We need to be out there doing what we all feel passionately about and in doing so, influencing and encouraging those around us
column3: building relationships as we go. Yes we will have a business case that is brilliant
column4:
but the key to our success lies with our people and the skills we have developed over the years in demanding environments

Other Ways You Can Help

column1:
Yes we need cash to get us off the ground. Having said that there are lots of ways you can help us!
  • get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
• use the Indiegogo share tools and any other social media.
• Email or contact us, give us feedback, lessons learnt, questions, anything 
Thanks for taking time to read this. Hope you agree it's a great cause with some great benifits

column2: >Now that we have successful protocols for rearing worked out, we need to increase the scale of what we do to be able to test the reintroduction protocols and so ensure the programme is sustainable. For this we need a centralised hand-rearing facility - much like those used for both the California Condor and Peregrine Falcon recovery programmes.

column1: <b style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Your contribution, no matter how much, will ensure that we can successfully produce enough good-quality, strong, healthy birds to release back into the wild.

column1: need
column9: > to start the building in time for the next breeding

column1: season. Time is a critical factor with an Endangered species. See the plans
below for this state-of-the-art but super-simple facility, perfect for
ground-hornbills. Our major partner in this venture - Mpumalanga Parks and
Tourism Agency (MTPA) - has provided the land, and after an intense workshop
with stakeholders, the concept of the BAOBAB was developed.

column2: >This BAOBAB TREE will give life to the next generation of the species.

column1: HOW IT WILL WORK: Embedded in the 'walls' of this BAOBAB TREE will be custom-built brooders that will be home to the rescued chicks. The rearers will work from within the TREE to provide the food, warmth, humidity and care that they need. The mentor birds will be housed in the aviaries radiating out from the BAOBAB. This will provide the right social learning environment to ensure that the chicks develop all the correct behavioural cues that they need to go on and be strong founders of a new generation of ground-hornbills.

They will fledge into these groups and from there they will be moved to a large pre-release aviary where they will undergo full health checks while they bond with their new groups. Then they will be moved to soft release aviaries at the release sites. This will ensure they have already learnt to hunt, fly, and perch before they are released into the big wide world under the care of an experienced older mentor bird in a 'bush-school'.

column3:
/>

All funds collected will be processed through our non-profit account and will thus be audited to ensure that we are accountable for the spending. Our financial reports are always available to ensure transparent, ethical reporting. As we need to build the centre to progress with the reintroduction programme we will initiate building as funds become available, starting with the perimeter fence around our current aviaries and then continuing to build from there.

column1: <h1 style=""text-align: center

column5: >For your role in the recovery of this species, we can offer the following perks to match every level of your support. Choose what level of support you would like and receive the perk for that level.

column2: >A  hand-written postcard from the team in South Africa to thank you for your support. In all eleven official languages!
>- thank you - ngiyathokoza - ke a leboha - dankie - ke a leboga - siyabonga - inkomu - ndo livhuwa - ro livhuwa - enkosi - ngiyabonga -
>If you support us by selecting any of the next perks you will also receive this cool postcard!
>Your photograph and the slogan 'I am helping to save the ground-hornbill' shared on our Facebook page to ensure your contribution is widely recognised.
>A gorgeous t-shirt bearing a graphic of a flying ground-hornbill encompassing all of the other savanna species that will benefit from the conservation of the ground-hornbill and it's habitat.

>A beaded sculpture standing about 20 cm tall, each one hand crafted and so endowed with individuality. They are full of character and, with those long, luscious lashes will be a beautiful quirky addition to your home or office.
>This solid sterling silver pendant is hand-crafted in Zimbabwe.

>This exquisite photographic guide to the Hornbills of the World is a must-have reference book. Every species of this charismatic family is covered, with beautiful photos and text written by the world authorities on both the African and Asian hornbills - Pilai Poonswad, Alan Kemp and Morten Strange.

>Adopt a chick - once a chick has safely made it to fledging age it will be supported by you. You will get to name your chick when we send you a photo (though bear the poor things' future in mind before dishing out any silly ones).

column1: first named and adopted.

column2: >Looking for a unique gift for a loved one - this is it!

column1: + shipping from South Africa

This bronze sculpture, just one of a signed, limited edition of 100, has been created by renowned wildlife sculptor Allen Hallett. Standing proud at 18 cm tall, including the base of African leadwood, this ground-hornbill strides with purpose - in support of the salvation of the species.

We have been working to slow and then reverse the decline of this species since 1999, in collaboration and partnership with a large number of stakeholders: academic institutions, non-profit organisations, land-owners, private, provincial, and national game reserves and traditional authorities.

This will ensure that all of Delecia's expertise can be transferred to the next generation of rearers - allowing for job creation and capacity building in conservation in South Africa.

column1: Auctions Ltd/ Jonah Gula/Nthabiseng Monama/Alan Knott-Craig.
HELP US MAKE A DIFFERENCE
SOUTHERN GROUND-HORNBILL POPULATIONS ARE DECLINING TO CRITICALLY ENDANGERED
BUT THERE IS HOPE
This culturally and ecologically important species is severly at risk.
We can double the productivity of
wild nests by harvesting 'doomed' second-hatched chicks but they need to be reared
WILD & STRONG to survive in the wild. They need to 'speak'
ground-hornbill and be fearful of humans.
We are raising funds to build a specialised hand-rearing facility: much
like those used for both the California Condor and Peregrine Falcon recovery
programmes, a cradle for this next generation that will maximise their survival once reintroduced into the wild.
Mpumalanga Parks and Tourism
Agency (MTPA) has provided us with land.  We have a super simple, baobab shaped, state
of the art rearing centre designed to ensure the very best for these chicks.
WE NOW NEED YOUR HELP: to raise $100 000 so we can
build our rearing centre in time for the next breeding season.
THE ISSUES:

We, in South Africa, are faced with this species disappearing from our savannah and grasslands - only an estimated 500 breeding females are left and declines are reported in all other range states. Namibia - Endangered. Kenya - down to fewer than 300 individuals.. and so it goes.
They are accidentally poisoned by farmers trying to poison jackals and leopards.
They are electrocuted on a growing electricity infrastructure.
They are targeted for trade - both for traditional medicine and ritual and for zoos and private collections.
They are persecuted for breaking windows - a territorial response to their reflection.
Their habitat and nest trees are being lost in the face of development.

Now that we have successful protocols for rearing worked out, we need to increase the scale of what we do to be able to test the reintroduction protocols and so ensure the programme is sustainable. For this we need a centralised hand-rearing facility - much like those used for both the California Condor and Peregrine Falcon recovery programmes.
Your contribution, no matter how much, will ensure that we can successfully produce enough good-quality, strong, healthy birds to release back into the wild.
HOW YOU CAN HELP
We
need $100 000 to start the building in time for the next breeding
season. Time is a critical factor with an Endangered species. See the plans
below for this state-of-the-art but super-simple facility, perfect for
ground-hornbills. Our major partner in this venture - Mpumalanga Parks and
Tourism Agency (MTPA) - has provided the land, and after an intense workshop
with stakeholders, the concept of the BAOBAB was developed.
This BAOBAB TREE will give life to the next generation of the species.

HOW IT WILL WORK: Embedded in the 'walls' of this BAOBAB TREE will be custom-built brooders that will be home to the rescued chicks. The rearers will work from within the TREE to provide the food, warmth, humidity and care that they need. The mentor birds will be housed in the aviaries radiating out from the BAOBAB. This will provide the right social learning environment to ensure that the chicks develop all the correct behavioural cues that they need to go on and be strong founders of a new generation of ground-hornbills.

They will fledge into these groups and from there they will be moved to a large pre-release aviary where they will undergo full health checks while they bond with their new groups. Then they will be moved to soft release aviaries at the release sites. This will ensure they have already learnt to hunt, fly, and perch before they are released into the big wide world under the care of an experienced older mentor bird in a 'bush-school'.
WHAT WE NEED THE FUNDING FOR:

All funds collected will be processed through our non-profit account and will thus be audited to ensure that we are accountable for the spending. Our financial reports are always available to ensure transparent, ethical reporting. As we need to build the centre to progress with the reintroduction programme we will initiate building as funds become available, starting with the perimeter fence around our current aviaries and then continuing to build from there.
HOW WE CAN THANK YOU
For your role in the recovery of this species, we can offer the following perks to match every level of your support. Choose what level of support you would like and receive the perk for that level.
Thank you!
A  hand-written postcard from the team in South Africa to thank you for your support. In all eleven official languages!
- thank you - ngiyathokoza - ke a leboha - dankie - ke a leboga - siyabonga - inkomu - ndo livhuwa - ro livhuwa - enkosi - ngiyabonga -
If you support us by selecting any of the next perks you will also receive this cool postcard!
Your photograph and the slogan 'I am helping to save the ground-hornbill' shared on our Facebook page to ensure your contribution is widely recognised.
+ shipping from South Africa
A gorgeous t-shirt bearing a graphic of a flying ground-hornbill encompassing all of the other savanna species that will benefit from the conservation of the ground-hornbill and it's habitat.
+ shipping from South Africa

A beaded sculpture standing about 20 cm tall, each one hand crafted and so endowed with individuality. They are full of character and, with those long, luscious lashes will be a beautiful quirky addition to your home or office.
+ shipping from South Africa
This solid sterling silver pendant is hand-crafted in Zimbabwe.
Their future is in YOUR hands.
+ shipping from South Africa

This exquisite photographic guide to the Hornbills of the World is a must-have reference book. Every species of this charismatic family is covered, with beautiful photos and text written by the world authorities on both the African and Asian hornbills - Pilai Poonswad, Alan Kemp and Morten Strange.

Adopt a chick - once a chick has safely made it to fledging age it will be supported by you. You will get to name your chick when we send you a photo (though bear the poor things' future in mind before dishing out any silly ones).
First come,
first named and adopted.
Looking for a unique gift for a loved one - this is it!
+ shipping from South Africa

This bronze sculpture, just one of a signed, limited edition of 100, has been created by renowned wildlife sculptor Allen Hallett. Standing proud at 18 cm tall, including the base of African leadwood, this ground-hornbill strides with purpose - in support of the salvation of the species.
ABOUT THE MABULA GROUND HORNBILL PROJECT

We have been working to slow and then reverse the decline of this species since 1999, in collaboration and partnership with a large number of stakeholders: academic institutions, non-profit organisations, land-owners, private, provincial, and national game reserves and traditional authorities.
see more: www.ground-hornbill.org.za
We have developed and refined several conservation mitigations, including that of reintroductions.

We have a large and expanding outreach programme to ensure that both communities where remaining wild populations exist and areas targeted for reintroductions are aware of the species and the threats they face.
We work to mitigate the threats that the remaining wild populations face.
We have a growing research programme: genetics, health, hormones, artificial nest development, custodianship and more...
We are committed to capacity building for conservation.
ABOUT MPUMALANGA TOURISM AND PARKS AGENCY

MTPA has been involved with this project, led by Delecia Gunn, who has single-handedly reared the release-quality birds for the last 15 years. MTPA will now walk with us yet one more step in hosting this facility on their nature reserve at Loskop Dam.
This will ensure that all of Delecia's expertise can be transferred to the next generation of rearers - allowing for job creation and capacity building in conservation in South Africa.
see more: www.mtpa.co.za
Risks & Challenges
We have taken care to ensure that all of the facilities are semi-permanent and that, should land tenure change, we are able to move the facility elsewhere.
We have taken care to ensure that the facility may be useful for other endangered species should the Ground-Hornbill programme be deemed unsustainable in the long term.
Any funds raised over and above this campaign will contribute to the sustainability of a salary for the lead keeper and maintenance.

Other Ways You Can Help 1. If you cannot contribute at this time, we would be grateful if you could share this campaign as widely as possible - Indiegogo makes this easy with their various share tools.  SHARE US!
2. Send us sighting records (GPS co-ords, group size, date, locality and habitat description) of Ground-Hornbills in the wild - both Southern and Northerns - PLEASE!
3. If you don't want a perk but would like to support us anyway please get in touch for our wire transfer details.
We have fine partners
To give you peace of mind these are our current major supporters (more than $6000 a year) who support the Project and our ongoing work, many who have been with us for more than a decade.
For a full list of our loyal supporters see http://www.ground-hornbill.org.za/what-you-can-do/sponsors.html.
Photo credits: Christine Giononne/ Joanne Meyer/ Lucy Kemp/ Summers Place

column2:
>On August 28th 2015 a tropical storm once categorized as a hurricane level 1, struck the small island of Dominica. Erika caused several dead, missing and total destruction of main roads highways houses buildings etc. many people are without many things in this world we live in but again this is another time where help and difference making is needed. Dominica got 12 inches of rain in 10 hours, for a mountainous 3rd world West Indian island this is beyond manageable and mud slides all over the towns, cities and villages have made living extremely difficult for the time being.

This country is deeply imbedded into my roots blood line and culture growing up, now and forever. I am a Canadian born Dominican who's parents were both born and brought up in this small island. I have several family members as well as roots of ancestry in DA and I feel the need to make a campaign to help put back together this beautiful country known as the nature island. 

Weeks later my Country is in need of several materials resources and aid in which our population and financial economy cannot handle on it own. I'm am thankful for all I have but also need to take part in any which way I can to help bring back ok what once was and more!!! 

Please help me restore and rebuild my beautiful country of ancestry by helping to reach my goal. Donate any amount you can sometimes ""LESS IS MORE"" it it would mean so much to myself and the 10s of thousands of people in need of restoration in Dominica.

Thanks for just taking the time to read!

Angus Lester Serrant 

@mr.als_iedu30

aka Gus

<div>
<div>BCA Film Festival 2015: three life-changing movies sharing facts, ideas, and reflecting on broad themes of change
column2: two are from South Korea, and both directors will attend for Q&amp
column3:
A interview sessions. 

The film An Omnivorous Family's Dilemma (Korea, 2014, English subtitles) portrays an average city family who fall in love with a family of pigs. This beautifully filmed, evocative portrait of the connections and bonds we form within a family and share with other living, loving creatures makes a distinctly memorable, motivating movie.

The movie Bike , City (Korea, 2015, English subtitles) introduces people and groups who love using bicycles to get around Seoul, and prove it is possible to ride the capital city safely in everyday. The director's camera follows cyclists through traffic and across town to interviews where a wide range of people explain and describe their love for cycling, and its potential to both redesign, and help save the city.

Cowspiracy: The Sustainability Secret (USA, 2014, Korean subtitles) asks why Greenpeace and other NGOs seem to ignore the meat and dairy industries' direct contributions to abrupt climate change. Co-produced by Leonardo DiCaprio, this popular film is thoughtful, informative, and funny, and has changed menus in homes and restaurants around the world. Come share the secret: learn the truths of the Cowspiracy.

Introduction

We are the INDIAs first synergy to create village level collectives for ZEBU / BOS INDICUS / A2 Type Cows., of which the milk is considered more a health drink than any other.
Led by Madhava MS Hebbar, who qualified as Master of Design from INDIAN INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (IIT) Mumbai. Has traveled and lived in Singapore &
column2: Finland as a consultant for start-ups in the field of Web Design. Later once back in India, took interest to know the nitty-gritty of chemical free farming from the doyen of Zero Budget Natural Farming., Mr Subash Palekar. While under training Madhava understood the importance of local cows which are known to the scientists as BOS INDICUS / ZEBU or A2 Type cows - These cows are known for their high quality milk which has Beta Caesin Protein and an stable amino acid chain Proline., and their poo or dung contains friendly microbes that help soil fertility.

column1: Thus, a small team was formed to synergize marginal farmers in the rural belts of Bangalore City, where the survey asserted there were over 3 lac Zebu A2 Bos-Indicus bovines on a natural tract that stretched 165 kms.

Indigenous Bovines are the integral part of the eco-system of a bio climatic zone which we are working on. India has an unique eco-centric agricultural system where both animal husbandry and cultivation go hand in hand. India is the only country on Earth blessed with four crop cycles. Indian ancient agricultural methods made farmer self-sufficient and sustainable and was absolutely chemical free. Our campaign is to revive it by synergizing marginal farmers with Indigenous Bovines which are now considered as most evolved species on Earth - The BOS INDICUS.
Our campaign started in 2007, where we networked with villages on the natural tract. Over 40 villages were shortlisted and soon we started to supply a2 milk to the city of Bangalore which is the hub of international community who are aware of a2 milk, which is more a health drink and harbinger of good life. a2 Milk or Desi Milk as its known in local populace is much appreciated.
column2:
>We arranged vehicles, milk cans and milk testing equipment and created a module for 10 villages to start with., to supply 500 liters of milk every morning. We collected milk only once a day, as rest of the milk was needed for the calf. Farmers got a premium price of $ 0.5 and was supplied to procurer patrons at $ 1.

At present our VILLAGE LEVEL Collectives have over 10,000 Bos Indicus / Zebu / a2 Type Cows and this has multiple revenue areas for the farmers, that include Ayurveda Medicine, Chemical free vegetables and BIO GAS generation out of cow poo. 
All our research, archiving, promotion and awareness campaign, salaries to the employees in rural and urban areas, at present come from the revenue out of a2 milk. Now the requirement is to scale the project and bring in more revenue for the farmer synergy so that bovines can be improved upon.

column1:
Contributors
We are looking for the contributors who understand that environment is safe when eco-system is intact and bio-reserve rejuvenated. Economics should take care of environment..not the vice versa. For that we have to work a newer and creative cycle of blending urban and rural economics by DIRECT LINK-UP of rural producer to urban procurer.
There could be multiple revenue area which even an contributor can develop or participate in. Our forte is organising the synergy both at Producer and Procurer end., at the same time give scope for science to percolate to the grassroot farmers.
We have 2 hectares of land kept to develop Micro-dairy modules., and to scale the project we need :
<ul>
• 50x50 mtrs shed for installations.
• Chillers and Packaging equipment
• Freezers and cold storage
• BIOGAS electricity generators
• Diesel Gensets
• Skilled Human Power
• Training facilities
• Front-end promotional office at Bangalore city.
• Expansion network facility for rest of INDIA.

Contributors can have direct access and also create their own social business plans on our network., as there is enormous opportunities in research on these a2 bovines and their inputs for sustainability.

Goal or target :

Our target is elite populace in city of Bangalore which has a cosmopolitan crowd from all over INDIA and Abroad. There are quite few expats who understand the a2 milk as the brand is famous now in Australia, UK, USofA, Brazil and NZ.

Over a period of 5 years we will be able to suffice the demand upto 50,000 liters provided we scale methodically.
Unless the investment reaches the villages with indigenous a2 type cows and stabilizes the network to a socio participation model, dynamics can not be substantiated. Thence its very important to put up the proper state-of-art infrastructure to support the campaign that helps marginal farmers. As of now non of the institutions or governmental bodies are focusing on issues. We are sure FOOD INDUSTRY will be the next revolution in INDIA for which we have to gear up marginal farmers and synergize them for the sake of good health and better environment.
We are constantly upgrading and are in touch with resource people in the area and the institutions.
The Impact :
We can frame the impact as multi-pronged and pro-nature as below :
<ul>
• Synergizing marginal farmers on natural tract means, preserving the bio-reserve of the natural tract we work in.

• Whole tract of 165 Kms which is a stretch of hills and dales has several water bodies and rivers - rivulet that flows. If this is secured now, its better not just for INDIA but becomes the model for rest of the developing world that how important it is to keep the environment intact along side the economic growth.
• Multiple revenue model means, more interest in keeping the indigenous species along with rest of flora and fauna. Its not just about milk.
• Most important part of this campaign is, it builds human to human trust, helps multiple participation from both Rural and Urban side, and gives lots of scope for environment based research.
• Besides everything the campaign, if made successful can bring the worlds attention on a proper issue based democratic principles. Where collectivism and capitalism go hand in hand.
<div>
<div><b>Risks &amp

We are qualified, as we have run this campaign without any external help. Have made it a small successful module of 500 liters. 
Japanese Company Aisin visited our network of villages and that bears the testimony that we are making ourselves known in collectivism. By their visit we are certain to have prototypes from Aisin to generate power at rural end - upto 5 kva using cow poo.
Since we work on a tract which is 165 km a stretch and covers over 200 villages and hamlets with indigenous bovines., if our campaign is made success by people participation, then it can be a revenue earning model which is fueled by farmers themselves. This brings a new confidence among the rural class to organise beyond institutions and governmental bodies. 
Since the team is over 30 personals - guided by experts., and empowerment of the team members is the forte till now, the skill sets are improved upon to become better managers.
As such India is known for human management due to enormous population. All it needs is proper impetus to create synergy that can take care of both environment and economics through value &
column2: merit based empowerment.
column3:
>Risk :

As we see its only the wrath of nature, or natural calamities that can create a collateral damage.
Challenges :
Keeping the synergy on is a biggest challenge. But that can be organised and brought to books by agreements and loyality points to the rural synergy.
Solving problems or overcoming challenges is by using proper human management based on human values and usage of technology for transformation. Be it simple testing procedures or android based technology for information transfer.
","Introduction We are the INDIAs first synergy to create village level collectives for ZEBU / BOS INDICUS / A2 Type Cows., of which the milk is considered more a health drink than any other.

column1: Led by Madhava MS Hebbar, who qualified as Master of Design from INDIAN INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (IIT) Mumbai. Has traveled and lived in Singapore & Finland as a consultant for start-ups in the field of Web Design. Later once back in India, took interest to know the nitty-gritty of chemical free farming from the doyen of Zero Budget Natural Farming., Mr Subash Palekar. While under training Madhava understood the importance of local cows which are known to the scientists as BOS INDICUS / ZEBU or A2 Type cows - These cows are known for their high quality milk which has Beta Caesin Protein and an stable amino acid chain Proline., and their poo or dung contains friendly microbes that help soil fertility.

Thus, a small team was formed to synergize marginal farmers in the rural belts of Bangalore City, where the survey asserted there were over 3 lac Zebu A2 Bos-Indicus bovines on a natural tract that stretched 165 kms.
Importance of the Campaign

Indigenous Bovines are the integral part of the eco-system of a bio climatic zone which we are working on. India has an unique eco-centric agricultural system where both animal husbandry and cultivation go hand in hand. India is the only country on Earth blessed with four crop cycles. Indian ancient agricultural methods made farmer self-sufficient and sustainable and was absolutely chemical free. Our campaign is to revive it by synergizing marginal farmers with Indigenous Bovines which are now considered as most evolved species on Earth - The BOS INDICUS.Our campaign started in 2007, where we networked with villages on the natural tract. Over 40 villages were shortlisted and soon we started to supply a2 milk to the city of Bangalore which is the hub of international community who are aware of a2 milk, which is more a health drink and harbinger of good life. a2 Milk or Desi Milk as its known in local populace is much appreciated.We arranged vehicles, milk cans and milk testing equipment and created a module for 10 villages to start with., to supply 500 liters of milk every morning. We collected milk only once a day, as rest of the milk was needed for the calf. Farmers got a premium price of $ 0.5 and was supplied to procurer patrons at $ 1.At present our VILLAGE LEVEL Collectives have over 10,000 Bos Indicus / Zebu / a2 Type Cows and this has multiple revenue areas for the farmers, that include Ayurveda Medicine, Chemical free vegetables and BIO GAS generation out of cow poo. All our research, archiving, promotion and awareness campaign, salaries to the employees in rural and urban areas, at present come from the revenue out of a2 milk. Now the requirement is to scale the project and bring in more revenue for the farmer synergy so that bovines can be improved upon.

ContributorsWe are looking for the contributors who understand that environment is safe when eco-system is intact and bio-reserve rejuvenated. Economics should take care of environment..not the vice versa. For that we have to work a newer and creative cycle of blending urban and rural economics by DIRECT LINK-UP of rural producer to urban procurer.There could be multiple revenue area which even an contributor can develop or participate in. Our forte is organising the synergy both at Producer and Procurer end., at the same time give scope for science to percolate to the grassroot farmers.We have 2 hectares of land kept to develop Micro-dairy modules., and to scale the project we need :
50x50 mtrs shed for installations.
Chillers and Packaging equipment
Freezers and cold storage
BIOGAS electricity generators
Diesel Gensets
Skilled Human Power
Training facilities
Front-end promotional office at Bangalore city.
Expansion network facility for rest of INDIA.

Contributors can have direct access and also create their own social business plans on our network., as there is enormous opportunities in research on these a2 bovines and their inputs for sustainability.

column1: ","*The video has Spanish, French and German subtitles. ** Para el texto en español, haz clic aquí!The Chocó Project is a joint initiative created by:
Did you know that Ecuadorian small-producers cultivate some of the best cacao in the world?
And have you heard of the Ecuadorian Brown-headed spider monkey?
The

former suffers from unfair trade regulations and economic instability while the latter is on the brink of extinction. Here at the Chocó project we are working hard to find a solution to these problems by combining them in a unique and innovative enterprise which we invite you to be a part of.
Let us take you on a little journey to the rainforests of
the Ecuadorian Chocó, to a magical place we call Tesoro Escondido (‘Hidden
Treasure’). You will meet brown-headed spider monkeys and cacao producers,
learn about the project and discover our unique vision. By the end of the tale, we
hope that you will be inspired to join us in our venture by supporting the project and sharing our story with friends and family.
THE
CHOCOAN RAINFOREST, THE BROWN-HEADED SPIDER MONKEYS AND CACAO PRODUCERS: HOW
ARE THEY RELATED?

Although often overshadowed by the famed Amazonian rainforest, the Ecuadorian Chocó region is one of the most biodiverse places on earth and provides home to a vast array of fascinating plant and animal species. It is among the tall trees of these beautiful forests that the Ecuadorian brown-headed spider monkeys make their home.

However, this area continues to be severely threatened by uncontrolled deforestation  via logging and the expansion of agricultural monocultures such as palm oil.  It is estimated that around 98% of the original forest cover has already been lost and these beautiful primates have been left on the brink of extinction.
The Ecuadorian brown-headed spider monkey (Ateles fusciceps fusciceps) is now listed among the Top 25 Most Endangered Primates on Earth.

Nestled among the pristine primary rainforests in the NW province of Esmeraldas, the small farming community of Tesoro Escondido is host to one of the few remaining healthy populations of brown-headed spider monkeys. Unfortunately, this is a region where poverty is rife and historically these people have relied upon logging to supplement the low income they make selling unfairly traded cacao.

The Chocó Project, a joint initiative created by the University of Sussex, Proyecto Washu and Fundación Cambugán, has been working with this community in order to protect these forests and their inhabitants from further destruction. Through a combination of environmental education, community development and fair trade we are helping the inhabitants of Tesoro Escondido to seek better, more sustainable livelihoods.
WHAT DO WE BELIEVE IN AND WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO WITH YOUR HELP?
The Chocó Project:
1. Works with schools and local producers to promote conservation strategies to protect the Chocoan rainforest.
2. Facilitates scientific research in the area to generate knowledge and raise
awareness on the challenges facing the Chocoan rainforest.
3. Trains local people from forest communities (parabiologists) to assist local and international researchers .
4. Allows small cacao producers to access appropriate markets for their high quality
product by contacting buyers across the world on their behalf, helps to improve farming methods and to obtain organic certification.
5. Provides support for the creation of a cooperative whose aim will be to protect the
rainforest. Through the sale of a high quality organic cacao, the cooperative
will develop sustainable livelihoods for the community and promote forest
conservation.
And if you want to find out what we've achieved so far and what we've got in mind for the future, click here!
WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING?
In order to maintain this project for a year, we need USD 40,000. This is how we will use your generous contributions:
OUR DESIRED IMPACT

In order to protect the Ecuadorian brown-headed spider monkey, protecting it's forest home and the wide-network of species which  reside there is imperative. Not only do the monkeys and these beautiful forests have incalculable intrinsic value but they also provide vital ecosystem services which the health of the planet relies upon.
The Chocó Project is an innovative and
ambitious conservation model linking communities, Ecuadorian nongovernmental
organisations and national and international researchers, to realise the true
value of these forests and provide livelihoods that compete with
deforestation. We hope that, should we be successful, this model can be replicated in other regions of the world where environmental degradation and poverty are rife. There are many.
THIS IS WHY WE NEED YOU!

With current global climactic changes set to dramatically affect the environment, showing support for conservation initiatives is more important than ever. Let's make our stand. By sharing our message and donating to our cause, your generous contribution will help us to protect the forests of Tesoro Escondido and improve the livelihoods of the community living there. From them, and from us, thank you.
To add to this truly deserved
thanks, we would also like to provide you with a number of unique perks.
You will be able to
claim colourful postcards of the rainforests of Ecuador, delicious Tesoro
Escondido chocolate gifts, selections of T-shirts, bags and accessories made by
Zigze (http://www.zigze.com/) – the first eco-business in Ecuador whose
designs and illustrations are inspired by the rich flora and fauna of Ecuador –

and trips to the pristine forests of Tesoro Escondido and the seaside town of Puerto López (unfortunately, we do not cover travel expenses but once you’re there everything will be provided!) where you will get to enjoy the relaxing cabins
of Hostería
Itapoa, its beaches and plenty of activities - whale watching, surfing, walks along the malecón!
We hope that you've enjoyed reading about our project and we leave you with a few useful and informative links (don't forget to like our Facebook pages!):
The Chocó Project website:
The Chocó Project: Conservation & Ethical Trade
University of Sussex website (Dr. Mika Peck's lab):
The Peck Lab
Proyecto Washu:
Proyecto Washu: For life in the Chocó
Facebook
Fundación Cambugán:
Fundación Cambugán: Conserving and Restoring Forest Ecosystems
Finally, we would like to thank Temujen Gunawardena, Badj Whipple, Ingrid Rieser and Jonathan Waller for the amazing work they did on the video, thank you so much!
If you have any inquiries, questions or suggestions please don't hestitate to contact us. We will be glad to hear from you.
Many thanks,
The Chocó Project Team",25.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Esmeraldas Province, Ecuador",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-choco-project-chocolate-and-conservation/pica

Mi az az ehető kanál?
Ezt nem magyaráznánk túl. Az ehető kanál egy kanál, amit meg lehet enni, azaz nem marad szemét utána. Vagyis csak annyi, mint pl. egy pirítósból, miután megetted.
Miért jó / fontos ez?

column2: >A fesztiválokon / rendezvényeken / falunapokon ... biztonsági okok miatt nem lehet semmi balesetveszélyes eszköz (fém, porcelán, üveg ..), ezért rengeteg az egyszer használatos műanyag, ami óriási nyersanyag és energia pazarlás.

column1: <li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Ezekre keresünk mi környezetbarát megoldásokat, olyat, mint az ehető kanál,  vagy anno a RE:pohár és a komposzt étkészlet, amik bevezetésével 2010-ben, több mint 20%-kal csökkentettük a SZIN-en keletkező szemét mennyiségét. A RE:poharat és komposzt étkészletet azóta sokan sokfelé használják már Magyarországon. Reméljük ez az ehető kanállal sem lesz másképp.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 24px

Arra, hogy a Szegedi Ifjúsági Napokon csinálhassunk idén egy fasza kampányt és próbaüzemet, valamint, hogy utána elkezdhessük megalapozni a jégpohár hosszútávú Magyarországi jelenlétét. Azaz pontosan:
1) 5000 db-os készlet legyártása, csomagolás, szállítás
2) Szükséges hatósági engedélyek (ÁNTSZ, NÉBIH ..) beszerzése

3) Próbaüzem fesztiválkörnyezetben (SZIN): 
a) helyszíni kommunikáció (mi ez, miért van, stb.) 
b) gyermekbetegségek, első körös problémák és visszajelzések begyűjtése
c) Videók, fényképek és közvélemény kutatás készítése
4) Fesztivál után: tapasztalatok összegzése, környezeti hatástanulmány elkészítése.
5) Ipari termelés első lépései (3-6 hónap szervezői munka):
a) kiajánló elkészítése (SZIN-en szerzett tapasztalatok alapján): vevői elegédettség, környezeti hatástanyulmány értékei, gazdasági adatok.
b) megfelelő magyar gyártó keresése, optimális gyártási folyamat megalkotása
c) piac kiépítése (rendezvény/fesztiválszervezők, áruházláncok, speciális étel forgalmazók ..)
<div>

column1: <div><span style=""font-weight: normal
KÖSZÖNJÜK.
","Mi az az ehető kanál?
Ezt nem magyaráznánk túl. Az ehető kanál egy kanál, amit meg lehet enni, azaz nem marad szemét utána. Vagyis csak annyi, mint pl. egy pirítósból, miután megetted.
Miért jó / fontos ez?

A fesztiválokon / rendezvényeken / falunapokon ... biztonsági okok miatt nem lehet semmi balesetveszélyes eszköz (fém, porcelán, üveg ..), ezért rengeteg az egyszer használatos műanyag, ami óriási nyersanyag és energia pazarlás.

Ezekre keresünk mi környezetbarát megoldásokat, olyat, mint az ehető kanál,  vagy anno a RE:pohár és a komposzt étkészlet, amik bevezetésével 2010-ben, több mint 20%-kal csökkentettük a SZIN-en keletkező szemét mennyiségét. A RE:poharat és komposzt étkészletet azóta sokan sokfelé használják már Magyarországon. Reméljük ez az ehető kanállal sem lesz másképp.
Mire kérünk most pénzt tőled?

Arra, hogy a Szegedi Ifjúsági Napokon csinálhassunk idén egy fasza kampányt és próbaüzemet, valamint, hogy utána elkezdhessük megalapozni a jégpohár hosszútávú Magyarországi jelenlétét. Azaz pontosan:
1) 5000 db-os készlet legyártása, csomagolás, szállítás
2) Szükséges hatósági engedélyek (ÁNTSZ, NÉBIH ..) beszerzése
3) Próbaüzem fesztiválkörnyezetben (SZIN): a) helyszíni kommunikáció (mi ez, miért van, stb.) b) gyermekbetegségek, első körös problémák és visszajelzések begyűjtése
c) Videók, fényképek és közvélemény kutatás készítése
4) Fesztivál után: tapasztalatok összegzése, környezeti hatástanulmány elkészítése.
5) Ipari termelés első lépései (3-6 hónap szervezői munka):
a) kiajánló elkészítése (SZIN-en szerzett tapasztalatok alapján): vevői elegédettség, környezeti hatástanyulmány értékei, gazdasági adatok.
b) megfelelő magyar gyártó keresése, optimális gyártási folyamat megalkotása
c) piac kiépítése (rendezvény/fesztiválszervezők, áruházláncok, speciális étel forgalmazók ..)
Miért a közösségi finanszírozás?

A környezetvédelem mindig egy furcsa kísérleti ló, amit ugyan mindenki fontosnak tart, meg szupernek, de valahogy pénz az sosincs rá. Egy ideig még voltak pályázatok, amik így-úgy befoltozták ezeket a lukakat, de mára ezek is jobbára elapadtak.
Szóval elegünk lett, hogy az íróasztalnak ötleteljünk és tervezzünk, ezért úgy gondoltuk megpróbáljuk inkább a kezünkbe venni a dolgok irányítását és meghírdetjük itt a dolgot.
Nekünk már az is nagy segítség, ha dobsz egy ezrest / ötöst, de nagyon örülünk, ha többet is megengedhetsz magadnak.
Hogyan működik?
Az ajánlott adományok listájából a jobb oldalon választhatsz és bankkártyával juttathatod el hozzánk a támogatásod. Természetesen, hogyha úgy érzed, az ajánlottnál többet is adhatsz.
Az adományodért cserébe ajánlott ajándékod, a kampány lejárta után postán fogjuk eljuttatni neked, illetve ha eljössz a SZIN-re, akkor személyesen is átveheted.

Az általunk használt Indiegogo rendszerének sajátosságai miatt a kiírások amerikai dollárban vannak, ám tájékoztatásképpen a forintban értendő körülbelüli  összeget is odaírtunk. Az árfolyam ingadozásai miatt ez azonban valamennyire eltérhet.

Többször felmerült kérdésként, úgyhogy: A billing postal code az a lakcímed irányítószáma, ami a bankkal kötött szerződésedben van. a többi elvileg logikus, bár angolul van, de ha nem tudtok valamit kérdezzetek itt az indin keresztül, vagy: mangel.koppany@gmail.com.

column6: >Is The Water Crisis Beyond Solving?

column5: >It is a growing problem, but we are convinced that, if we

column1: act now, we can prevent things from getting worse, and improve our current
situation. The problem is that we do not have a lot of time.  Our underground rivers (aquifers) are being
badly depleted, which affects wells and springs that we depend on in many
places.  Our climate is changing
unpredictably and we need to act now to prevent the current crisis from
becoming a global catastrophe. Getting the word out and providing
easy to implement solutions needs to happen now.  Delay only invites unnecessary suffering to
millions more people.
Many people around the
world already do. Unfortunately, most people in America aren't fully aware of
the seriousness of the water crisis. This is the biggest reason for our
campaign. Without the necessary awareness being raised, the solutions won't be
put into use soon enough. We absolutely MUST get people to recognize the
problem and help them by providing easy, inexpensive ways to conserve water.
Camel Water's modular, ultra slim rainwater
harvesting systems are an innovative and elegant way to collect and store
rainwater. The system is expandable to allow for the storage of thousands of
gallons of rainwater. It's more visually appealing and much safer than the old
rain barrel"" that many people are familiar with and find
unattractive. The systems can even be built into walls, decks, ceilings and
floors There is no longer any need to install those large, unsightly
barrels and cisterns or pay for costly excavation and installation of
underground tanks.
Every donation helps. Even if you can't donate, we still need
your help. Tell your friends about this
campaign.  It's important to spread the
word. This isn't some Chicken
Little - ""The sky is falling!"" kind of false alarm.  This is a real, verified crisis and we need
to act... today.  Link to our campaign or website on your
Facebook page or Twitter feed.  Talk the
campaign and water awareness up with your friends.  Don't
forget to use the ""Share"" tools here on Indiegogo.  This is important!  Water is Life!  Let's all do what we can to keep from running
out of this precious resource.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
","130 TO SAVE 24 BILLION

We are Camel Water and we are asking for your help to make our campaign goal a reality.  The title of this campaign may sound a bit confusing until you know that we're talking about the number of gallons of fresh drinking water that will be saved if we can get just a small percentage of the people in the United States to support our campaign.

If only 10% of the single family detached homes in the United States and Canada harvest, store and use rainwater with our 130 US gallon rainwater harvesting system, the total savings of treated - municipal or well water will be at least 24 BILLION gallons per year.

It's simple and easy to do with a Camel Water System.  People have been harvesting rainwater for thousands of years.  In many places in the world, it's the only viable source of fresh (not salty) water.  Rainwater has many uses including:
Irrigation Exterior cleaning
Excess storm water retention (flood prevention)
Aquifer replenishment (restores underground water supplies when released slowly on the soil)
Rainwater is very easy and inexpensive to treat (filter and disinfect) making it completely safe for drinking, cooking and bathing.
Camel Water modular rainwater harvesting
systems are very compact and easy to install using common hand tools. No
heavy lifting required. A Camel Water module weighs less than 45 lbs.
Storage capacity is easily expandable, one module at a time. You can add
as many modules as required without using heavy lifting equipment or
paying for expensive site preparation.
Our campaign is Focused On Three Fronts

Raising public awareness of the current water crisis and our rainwater harvesting solution through social media and other avenues, including our active role on the research committee of ARCSA - the American Rainwater Catchment Systems Association

Expanding delivery capacity of our ""state-of-the-art"", ultra slim water storage modules that offer superior benefits with virtually none of the headaches of other Rain Water Harvesting Systems (RWHS).  As the public becomes
more aware of how critical our water situation has become and how smart, simple and
easy our solutions are to use, there will be a surge in orders.  We need
to be able to  keep pace with demand. Your contribution makes sure that we
deliver the solutions quickly and effectively.

Donating Rain Water Harvesting Systems to schools and non-profit organizations. A Camel Water RWHS can also be a great educational tool. Getting our young people and community organizations involved is critical to the success of our campaign. We want everyone to know about wasteful water practices and how to conserve this precious resource. To further this goal, Camel Water, LLC will donate one 130 US gallon rainwater harvesting system to a school or non-profit for every twenty-five we sell.  If you want to join us in donating a RWHS, simply choose that perk and we will insure that it gets done and that you receive the recognition you deserve. You can also keep your donation anonymous if you prefer.
What We Need & What You Get
Here's what we plan to do with your
support
Improve our internet presence - enlarge and update our
website, web store, Facebook page and Twitter feeds
Expand our participation
with the ARCSA Research
Committee to keep the public up to date on the latest developments in the
growing water crisis that is already impacting tens of millions of people
globally.  Spreading the word broadly requires investment in promotion and
advertising.  Because we feel that this crisis is larger than most people
are aware of, we want to get the word out to the largest possible
audience.
Produce additional molds for expanded delivery capacity in more
locations. Camel Water storage modules are molded using FDA compliant, food
grade HDPE.  HDPE is a high strength plastic and one of the best materials
for long term outdoor use. With additional molds we will create a Virtual Delivery Network
using roto-molders across the US and Canada, saving shipping costs and
shortening delivery schedules.
What do you get out of it?Depending on your participation level you can:
Gain recognition for supporting our campaign and spreading the word
Show off one of our campaign perks that tells the world you care about water conservation and support the 130 TO SAVE 24 BILLION campaign.
Start harvesting and using rainwater and using less of the expensive treated water.
Slow the flow of water from the roofs of our dwellings to the storm drains, giving it a chance to soak back into the ground to replenish the aquifers.
Increase our charitable program of donating a 130-gallon Camel Water rainwater harvesting system to a school or non-profit for every 25 systems that we sell.
Is The Water Crisis Beyond Solving?
It is a growing problem, but we are convinced that, if we
act now, we can prevent things from getting worse, and improve our current
situation. The problem is that we do not have a lot of time.  Our underground rivers (aquifers) are being
badly depleted, which affects wells and springs that we depend on in many
places.  Our climate is changing
unpredictably and we need to act now to prevent the current crisis from
becoming a global catastrophe. Getting the word out and providing
easy to implement solutions needs to happen now.  Delay only invites unnecessary suffering to
millions more people.
Why Isn't Everyone Harvesting Rainwater?
Many people around the
world already do. Unfortunately, most people in America aren't fully aware of
the seriousness of the water crisis. This is the biggest reason for our
campaign. Without the necessary awareness being raised, the solutions won't be
put into use soon enough. We absolutely MUST get people to recognize the
problem and help them by providing easy, inexpensive ways to conserve water.
Camel Water's modular, ultra slim rainwater
harvesting systems are an innovative and elegant way to collect and store
rainwater. The system is expandable to allow for the storage of thousands of
gallons of rainwater. It's more visually appealing and much safer than the old
rain barrel"" that many people are familiar with and find
unattractive. The systems can even be built into walls, decks, ceilings and
floors There is no longer any need to install those large, unsightly
barrels and cisterns or pay for costly excavation and installation of
underground tanks.
What Can I Do?
Every donation helps. Even if you can't donate, we still need
your help. Tell your friends about this
campaign.  It's important to spread the
word. This isn't some Chicken
Little - ""The sky is falling!"" kind of false alarm.  This is a real, verified crisis and we need
to act... today.  Link to our campaign or website on your
Facebook page or Twitter feed.  Talk the
campaign and water awareness up with your friends.  Don't
forget to use the ""Share"" tools here on Indiegogo.  This is important!  Water is Life!  Let's all do what we can to keep from running
out of this precious resource.
