Short Summary

We are a Mexican-Greek expat family Living actually in Bulgaria in a village Near Cherven Bryag where we got a 5 hectares farm land called ‘’La Adelita’’  we named after my mother back in Mexico which she is one of pioneers of organic food in my family and the best sauces maker in Mexico...

This farm has  85 years of history and we have in mind to turn it into a sustainable Eco- farm where we want to produce Mexican products such as hot sauces, dry hot peppers, many variety of Mexican corn, corn tortillas, mexican  beans, green tomatoes(tomatillos) and  exotic fruits like papaya fruit, passion fruit (maracuya), guava, plantain bananas and mexican tomatoes and more organic vegetables as well which does not exist here in this part of Europe

Our sauces have been tested already in Greece, the Greek islands, Bulgaria and parts in Romania and they had great acceptation between  the people, festivals and restaurants, but now we want to grown as a organic mexican sauces and more products  providers in the whole europe

I cannot wait to show the love we have for organic food and even better for those hot Bites and Mexican food with everybody to enrich the local culture and provide to all those Mexican sauces and food  lovers the authentic Mexican flavors of the final products on their tables, chemicals and preservatives free ,
<h3>What We Need &amp

Bulgaria has a very fertile soil but the weather in spring is very unpredictable and cold until summer which is very hot and dry usually with no rains until the last weeks of september but after that the weather is extremely cold and even snows, the temperature goes down below zero, for that reason we need to build an equipped  greenhouse to keep the peppers constantly warm with a plant nursery for the newborn plants and required tools, planting schedules and applicable techniques then with all this facilities is going to allow us to have an optimistic harvesting all year long with a very satisfactory results,

as long as we refuse to use any kind of pesticides, artificial fertilizers or any kind of chemicals we are facing several problems with  pest infestation, weed control and water issues which all this reduces the production down to 40% but the weather is the major issue for the mexican peppers to grow properly even so   we want to produce 100% organic hot sauces, corn products, vegetables and fruits, actually we do everything by hand, for all this we are 100% positive that a greenhouse will be much better for the hot peppers and tomatoes to keep constantly warm and protect
However, I believe that to make this business a success we have to show exactly where our main ingredient comes from and without the chilli plants and tomatoes  there would be no business.
Please consider contributing to this campaign to build a greenhouse to keep the hot peppers warm and then  we can continue growing food and develop our ideas as sustainable  Eco-farm

We’ve invested everything we have into the business which has mostly gone into the buying the farm and  paying the property titles we also bought a little cargo van to help us to move around  and we bought the copyrights of a company called  ‘’La Adelita’’ to legally export products outside Bulgaria even so we are very optimistic that the idea of Eco-farm in this part of Bulgaria will bring work opportunities for the locals and continue with the history of the farm and keep the hot peppers rolling on in the world !

·  Our goal of $20,000 would cover nearly the entire cost to build an equipped 2 hectares  greenhouse with the right equippment and paying some license  permits to the local authorities 

. As a food business, we also have some licensing and insurance costs to negotiate. Canning license, Process authority, Liability, Labeling

 

·  If we don't reach our goal, we will still receive the funds we raise and they will greatly help offset the cost of a little mechanical digger machine and some garden tools as well to prepare the land before planting and cultivating  as long as we are doing all this by hand because our horse ‘’Gaia’’ died from the cold this past winter. She was very helpful with the farm duties and  we missed her a lot.

·  If we surpass our goal, the extra will go towards restore the farm providing up to 4 eqipped bedrooms for volunteers  who wants to come to work few hours a day  and stay with us for free and experience the wonderful countryside life and outside activities learning how to make organic yogurt, cheese, hot sauces, wine,  etc. and  eat vegetables and fruits from Adelita's farm 

we also want to build a water wheel to water the plants as long as the city's water here in Bulgaria has high level of chlorine and chemicals that the plants don't really like

·  For your support we want to show you how important are you for us in this campaign  with gifts and friendship. You are amazing!! We can't tell you how much your generosity means to us,

·  $5 and up : Contributors at this level will receive our sincerest thanks, and an email update on our progress at the end of the campaign A personal thank you card with 10 individual hot peppers seeds enclosed. 

·  $20 and up:  we would like to give you a small piece of the farm in return. We're giving you a beautiful thank you card from the ‘’La Adelita’s’’ Family Farm crew with 20 random hot peppers seeds and 10 mexican tomatoes with the instructions about  how and when to plant

·  $ 50 and up : For helping us get back such a big part of the farm We're giving you a beautiful thank you card from the ‘’La Adelita’’ Family Farm crew with 40 hot peppers seeds, 2   hot sauces bottles and 500gr. of corn tortillas and the recipe how to make mexican green and red enchiladas written in english  

·  $100 and up :  As a token of our gratitude, please enjoy one jar of delicious chemical-free black beans soup from Adelita’s Family Farm, 4 hot sauces bottles one jar of preserved jalapenos peppers and 60 random hot peppers seeds and 15 random mexican tomatoes seeds

·  $500 and up : We want to give you a taste of all the corn and hot peppers sauces the farm produces. Contributors at this level will receive a single box of fresh corn tortilla and corn  chips with 6 fresh hot sauces. 2 jalapenos pickled  jars, 85 hot peppers seeds and 25 seeds  of tomatoes, 100 grams of hibiscus tea, everything from our backyard in our  farm and coupon to exchange them every month during 4 months for Mexican products supplies After the campaign we can discuss about the shipping

·  $1000 and up : So cool!  We can't wait to show you what we can grow because of your benevolence. A contribution of $1000 or more will enroll you to stay with us in the farm 1 week accommodation and food free for 2 people ( transportation included from airport to the farm) membership is also transferable if you would like to make it a special gift to someone to use anytime and not expiration date. One box with 15 different Mexican sauces and corn products, 200 grams of hibiscus and coupons to exchange them every month during 6 months for hot sauces supplies. 100 hot pepper seeds and 40 seeds  of tomatoes,  Also let us pamper you when you are here  with 2 coupons of therapeutic massage (1 hour each)given by Radoslava she is a local massage specialist , also we  want to show you around and we want you to visit other eco- farms near the area to taste the bulgarian wines, food and more. 

and the first donor of 1,000 euros his or her name will be in one our hot sauces as an attribute of his generosity
The Impact
<ul>

• We are part of a movement of people who want to come back to the food origins that means for us to eat organic and everything we produce has to be natural and handcrafted and we want to share this with the rest of the world or love and dedication we have for hot peppers and organic food and of course  respecting the environment and using the natural resources wisely

","Short Summary

We are a Mexican-Greek expat family Living actually in Bulgaria in a village Near Cherven Bryag where we got a 5 hectares farm land called ‘’La Adelita’’  we named after my mother back in Mexico which she is one of pioneers of organic food in my family and the best sauces maker in Mexico...

This farm has  85 years of history and we have in mind to turn it into a sustainable Eco- farm where we want to produce Mexican products such as hot sauces, dry hot peppers, many variety of Mexican corn, corn tortillas, mexican  beans, green tomatoes(tomatillos) and  exotic fruits like papaya fruit, passion fruit (maracuya), guava, plantain bananas and mexican tomatoes and more organic vegetables as well which does not exist here in this part of Europe

Our sauces have been tested already in Greece, the Greek islands, Bulgaria and parts in Romania and they had great acceptation between  the people, festivals and restaurants, but now we want to grown as a organic mexican sauces and more products  providers in the whole europe

I cannot wait to show the love we have for organic food and even better for those hot Bites and Mexican food with everybody to enrich the local culture and provide to all those Mexican sauces and food  lovers the authentic Mexican flavors of the final products on their tables, chemicals and preservatives free ,
What We Need & What You Get

Bulgaria has a very fertile soil but the weather in spring is very unpredictable and cold until summer which is very hot and dry usually with no rains until the last weeks of september but after that the weather is extremely cold and even snows, the temperature goes down below zero, for that reason we need to build an equipped  greenhouse to keep the peppers constantly warm with a plant nursery for the newborn plants and required tools, planting schedules and applicable techniques then with all this facilities is going to allow us to have an optimistic harvesting all year long with a very satisfactory results,

as long as we refuse to use any kind of pesticides, artificial fertilizers or any kind of chemicals we are facing several problems with  pest infestation, weed control and water issues which all this reduces the production down to 40% but the weather is the major issue for the mexican peppers to grow properly even so   we want to produce 100% organic hot sauces, corn products, vegetables and fruits, actually we do everything by hand, for all this we are 100% positive that a greenhouse will be much better for the hot peppers and tomatoes to keep constantly warm and protect
However, I believe that to make this business a success we have to show exactly where our main ingredient comes from and without the chilli plants and tomatoes  there would be no business.
Please consider contributing to this campaign to build a greenhouse to keep the hot peppers warm and then  we can continue growing food and develop our ideas as sustainable  Eco-farm

We’ve invested everything we have into the business which has mostly gone into the buying the farm and  paying the property titles we also bought a little cargo van to help us to move around  and we bought the copyrights of a company called  ‘’La Adelita’’ to legally export products outside Bulgaria even so we are very optimistic that the idea of Eco-farm in this part of Bulgaria will bring work opportunities for the locals and continue with the history of the farm and keep the hot peppers rolling on in the world !·  Our goal of $20,000 would cover nearly the entire cost to build an equipped 2 hectares  greenhouse with the right equippment and paying some license  permits to the local authorities . As a food business, we also have some licensing and insurance costs to negotiate. Canning license, Process authority, Liability, Labeling ·  If we don't reach our goal, we will still receive the funds we raise and they will greatly help offset the cost of a little mechanical digger machine and some garden tools as well to prepare the land before planting and cultivating  as long as we are doing all this by hand because our horse ‘’Gaia’’ died from the cold this past winter. She was very helpful with the farm duties and  we missed her a lot.·  If we surpass our goal, the extra will go towards restore the farm providing up to 4 eqipped bedrooms for volunteers  who wants to come to work few hours a day  and stay with us for free and experience the wonderful countryside life and outside activities learning how to make organic yogurt, cheese, hot sauces, wine,  etc. and  eat vegetables and fruits from Adelita's farm we also want to build a water wheel to water the plants as long as the city's water here in Bulgaria has high level of chlorine and chemicals that the plants don't really like·  For your support we want to show you how important are you for us in this campaign  with gifts and friendship. You are amazing!! We can't tell you how much your generosity means to us,·  $5 and up : Contributors at this level will receive our sincerest thanks, and an email update on our progress at the end of the campaign A personal thank you card with 10 individual hot peppers seeds enclosed. ·  $20 and up:  we would like to give you a small piece of the farm in return. We're giving you a beautiful thank you card from the ‘’La Adelita’s’’ Family Farm crew with 20 random hot peppers seeds and 10 mexican tomatoes with the instructions about  how and when to plant·  $ 50 and up : For helping us get back such a big part of the farm We're giving you a beautiful thank you card from the ‘’La Adelita’’ Family Farm crew with 40 hot peppers seeds, 2   hot sauces bottles and 500gr. of corn tortillas and the recipe how to make mexican green and red enchiladas written in english  ·  $100 and up :  As a token of our gratitude, please enjoy one jar of delicious chemical-free black beans soup from Adelita’s Family Farm, 4 hot sauces bottles one jar of preserved jalapenos peppers and 60 random hot peppers seeds and 15 random mexican tomatoes seeds·  $500 and up : We want to give you a taste of all the corn and hot peppers sauces the farm produces. Contributors at this level will receive a single box of fresh corn tortilla and corn  chips with 6 fresh hot sauces. 2 jalapenos pickled  jars, 85 hot peppers seeds and 25 seeds  of tomatoes, 100 grams of hibiscus tea, everything from our backyard in our  farm and coupon to exchange them every month during 4 months for Mexican products supplies After the campaign we can discuss about the shipping·  $1000 and up : So cool!  We can't wait to show you what we can grow because of your benevolence. A contribution of $1000 or more will enroll you to stay with us in the farm 1 week accommodation and food free for 2 people ( transportation included from airport to the farm) membership is also transferable if you would like to make it a special gift to someone to use anytime and not expiration date. One box with 15 different Mexican sauces and corn products, 200 grams of hibiscus and coupons to exchange them every month during 6 months for hot sauces supplies. 100 hot pepper seeds and 40 seeds  of tomatoes,  Also let us pamper you when you are here  with 2 coupons of therapeutic massage (1 hour each)given by Radoslava she is a local massage specialist , also we  want to show you around and we want you to visit other eco- farms near the area to taste the bulgarian wines, food and more. and the first donor of 1,000 euros his or her name will be in one our hot sauces as an attribute of his generosity

We are part of a movement of people who want to come back to the food origins that means for us to eat organic and everything we produce has to be natural and handcrafted and we want to share this with the rest of the world or love and dedication we have for hot peppers and organic food and of course  respecting the environment and using the natural resources wisely

there are many people out there like us who are making peace with mother earth everyday and raising their voices and making noise with examples of life and inspiration for others  and no matter if you live in the countryside, urban cities or villages, the important thing is to make a difference in thinking and living green for a better future

Buzz Bikes
<ul>

• Hi!  I'm J.J. and we here at Buzz Bikes are a little bit wacky.  About 15 years ago I found that combining a kid's scooter with an old conventional rear triangle of a discarded bicycle provided a unique riding experience.  After having great fun riding around on this contraption, I decided to put it in storage.  Recently, I decided to restore the motorcycle to its original glory.

• A lot has happened to battery technology over the past 15 years with the development of new, light, high capacity lithium ion batteries.  Unfortunately they are very expensive while their technology is superior to many other types of batteries.  The improvement of brush-less DC motors and increasing solar cell efficiency now make it feasible to operate a fully solar powered vehicle that could be built for the masses.  This is why we at Buzz Bikes hope to involve wonderful folks, like yourself, in our campaign.

• With your contribution, we can take our prototype to the next level and improve upon the current design so that Buzz Bikes can go faster and farther that they ever have before (currently only 4.7 miles a charge) and with free and plentiful sunlight as power!
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>

• The price of a proper lithium ion battery for our project is $1000.  This will give us enough power to make it up steep hills and allow for longevity of the battery as well as quicker charging capacity.  Appropriate solar panels will cost $1000 to supply enough voltage and current to charge the batteries at the right current and voltage.  A new dc motor with charge controller and transfer gears costs around $500 and new bicycle components with a more advance frame design can cost and additional $500.

• We love this bike so much, we're willing to give you full plans to build one yourself!  With a contribution of $5 or more, we can show you how to make our original Buzz Bike using techniques and equipment that are economically reasonable and provide great value!  The plans can be downloaded for free after the completion of the campaign and links to vendors and tools are provided in the plans. If we reach our funding goal, an extra secret item will appear in your inbox along with plans to build your own Buzz Bike!
• Even if we don't reach our funding goal, those supporters of the Buzz Bikes project will still receive a free download of plans to build a Buzz Bike.
The Impact
This is the difference your contribution will make:
• Your contribution will make the world more beautiful by helping people to consider options when choosing transportation that is economical and environmentally responsible, which makes you awesome!
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Please get the word out to friends and family and make some noise about Buzz Bikes!
Thank You for taking the time to read this far.

Hi!  I'm J.J. and we here at Buzz Bikes are a little bit wacky.  About 15 years ago I found that combining a kid's scooter with an old conventional rear triangle of a discarded bicycle provided a unique riding experience.  After having great fun riding around on this contraption, I decided to put it in storage.  Recently, I decided to restore the motorcycle to its original glory.

A lot has happened to battery technology over the past 15 years with the development of new, light, high capacity lithium ion batteries.  Unfortunately they are very expensive while their technology is superior to many other types of batteries.  The improvement of brush-less DC motors and increasing solar cell efficiency now make it feasible to operate a fully solar powered vehicle that could be built for the masses.  This is why we at Buzz Bikes hope to involve wonderful folks, like yourself, in our campaign.

With your contribution, we can take our prototype to the next level and improve upon the current design so that Buzz Bikes can go faster and farther that they ever have before (currently only 4.7 miles a charge) and with free and plentiful sunlight as power!
What We Need & What You Get

The price of a proper lithium ion battery for our project is $1000.  This will give us enough power to make it up steep hills and allow for longevity of the battery as well as quicker charging capacity.  Appropriate solar panels will cost $1000 to supply enough voltage and current to charge the batteries at the right current and voltage.  A new dc motor with charge controller and transfer gears costs around $500 and new bicycle components with a more advance frame design can cost and additional $500.

We love this bike so much, we're willing to give you full plans to build one yourself!  With a contribution of $5 or more, we can show you how to make our original Buzz Bike using techniques and equipment that are economically reasonable and provide great value!  The plans can be downloaded for free after the completion of the campaign and links to vendors and tools are provided in the plans. If we reach our funding goal, an extra secret item will appear in your inbox along with plans to build your own Buzz Bike!
Even if we don't reach our funding goal, those supporters of the Buzz Bikes project will still receive a free download of plans to build a Buzz Bike.
The Impact
This is the difference your contribution will make:
Your contribution will make the world more beautiful by helping people to consider options when choosing transportation that is economical and environmentally responsible, which makes you awesome!
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please get the word out to friends and family and make some noise about Buzz Bikes!
Thank You for taking the time to read this far.

<h3 style=""text-align: center

We are Dr Karsten Shein, Peter Quilliam and Neil van Niekerk, founders of Oceans Eye. We have been diving most of our lives and share a love of the marine world and conserving it for generations to come. Karsten is a marine climatologist and Peter is the Director of Operations for a marine research institute. Neil is a lifelong diver and conservationist who began his dive career in 1986. Most recently Neil was the manager at the Southern Cross Club on Little Cayman. Our work bought us together and an idea formed into a global citizen science project. Oceans Eye is a combination of having a high-tech marine laboratory and a precision dive log with you on every dive. Oceans Eye will record important environmental factors throughout your entire dive, gathering information that until now was completely out of reach for scientists around the world. We have taken the static environmental sensor, recording one or two environmental conditions, and created a dynamic sensor, recording many conditions and given it the ability to map any reef or dive site anywhere in the world. Not only that, but the Oceans Eye will also record your dive in 3D - literally mapping your dive for you. All of this information is automatically uploaded to your smart device ready for you to share with friends or to just check out your dive profile yourself. Everything is done without wires or the need to purchase any other hardware.

Conditions in the ocean are changing and affecting the places we dive. There are many reasons for these changes. Sediment from dredging, litter discarded into the water, destructive fishing methods. These are all things we can see. We can even do something about some of these things. What about the things we can't ""see"". What about all the places that go un-monitored? Of the roughly 10,000 coral reefs on this planet, we would be lucky to have recorded scientific data on 10% of them.

We can't see changes in pH levels with our eyes, we can't see or even feel the micro changes in temperature along a single reef. We have no way of connecting all of this information to form a comprehensive picture of what is happening.
Until now.

Oceans Eye is a citizen science project that will make big waves in the way that scientific data is collected around the planet. We want to transform every diver into a science diver, armed with the tools to record data exactly as if they were a marine biologist. The importance of this project is far reaching and could provide answers for the marine research community that singularly would be impossible to generate.

We don't expect you to be able to analyse the data either. We plan to share the data with scientists around the world so that, collectively, we are able to widen our field of vision and paint a much larger picture of global reef health. Not only will we be able to see a global picture unfold, but we will also have the ability to zoom into a reef's micro-climate and discover slight differences over small areas. This could lead to incredible discoveries in conservation and restoration work on damaged reefs. We compared a dive computer and one of our temperature sensors to see the difference between them. This was the result.

It shows that the dive computer was between 2 and 2.5 degrees cooler than our sensor and took around 10 min to stabilize. That makes a huge difference when looking at reef health. We are not trying to compete with the computer market, they are still very important to use. We are delivering a device that is far more accurate and will turn every diver into a proper citizen scientist.

This campaign will provide us with the funds to refine our conceptual prototype device through advanced prototype phase testing and shortly afterwards, mainstream development. And this is where you come in. We need you, the diving community to help us test Oceans Eye and become our very first ambassadors. Your investment will allow us to finish our prototypes and start production. Soon after that you will be among the first to receive an Oceans Eye. We have some great incentives for you and we cant wait for you to join us on our journey.
<h3>What We Need &amp

To make this a reality we need $200,000 to refine the device,finish our field testing and finalize our App development. This money will also be used to start our first manufacturing run of the devices available to you, our Sea Crowd of citizen scientists. From there we will begin building our community and spread around the world, taking you on the journey with us.
The Impact

By contributing to this project in any way you can, you will be part of an amazing change in the way we see our planet. We cannot survive without our oceans and we need to understand as much as we can about them if we have any chance of developing solutions or policies to protect them. By helping this project to succeed we will have that chance. We plan to get every bit of data we collect into the hands of scientists around the world, and collectively we will all make a difference.
<h3>Risks &amp

The risk we face if we don't do something now is huge. Coastal communities around the globe depend on healthy reefs for survival. Divers rely on healthy reefs in order to enjoy what they love doing. We are not asking people to sign petitions and rally their elected leaders. We are asking people to go for a dive. Just make sure you take Oceans Eye with you - we'll do the rest.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute monetarily to our project, but you are concerned about the cause, you can always share this page with your family and friends. Check out the sharing links on this site.

Turn waste into earth!  Backyard composting is a simple, effective way to reduce greenhouse gases while enriching soil and is something individuals can do to make a difference.  The Speedibin composter makes it easy and safe.
The problem

About 31 billion dollars of food is wasted each year in Canada alone and about half of that comes from households.  About a third of material going to landfills is organics where it produces methane, a strong greenhouse gas.

Instead of having that resource trucked around the countryside, just put it right back into the earth where it feeds the soil which feeds the plants which feed us!  This is something that individuals can do to make a significant difference to reduce greenhouse gases and the resulting climate change. It is cheaper and easier than curbside pickup, too!
But there has been some resistance to backyard composting as it can attract vermin and some composters are awkward to use.
The solution
We have designed a metal composter that keeps out vermin and is easy to use.
<ul>
• It is all metal so animals can’t chew through.
• A metal mesh screen on the bottom allows worms, microbes and water to transfer but prevents animals from tunneling in.
• The large lid comes right off for easy access.
• The front door slides out for easy removal of finished compost.
• A latching handle keeps out raccoons, dogs and wind.
• Proper ventilation ensures aerobic decomposition.
We have sold a few hundred locally and through our online store.
Customers love their Speedibins and many have bought a second one.  But we have been bootstrapping this business.
Now we need help to launch this product so that it is available to everyone.
How we will use the funding
<ul>
• Increase awareness of the Speedibin for backyard composting.
• Increase awareness of the powerful benefits of backyard composting instead of expensive and inefficient hauling and distribution of organics, or worse, trucking to a landfill.

• We have a second model of Speedibin that we are working on producing that has a hinged lid – an upgrade that some gardeners may appreciate.  We need financial assistance with the prototyping and production.
The back story
Speedibins were first designed by Fred and Peg Francis in 1989 when they saw the need for a better way for households to make compost safely in their backyard.

They worked diligently on the design and sold many but then stopped as the plastic composters were flooding the market and were way cheaper.  Then in 2012 City Farmer in Vancouver asked if we would make them again due to the rat problem in cities.  Fred and Peg’s daughter, Joyce McMenamon, that’s me, took up the challenge.  I am a biologist, retired fish hatchery manager, certified Organic Master Gardener and Master Composter and eager to do what I can to help our world.  We found my Dad’s old drawings and after several dozen tweaks, we feel that we have a game-changing composter.
How to help
If you get the big picture and are ready to help make backyard composting achievable, here are some things you can do.
<ul>
• Support the campaign!  Spend a dollar to say, ‘Yes, backyard composting makes a difference!’
• Get a Speedibin and get composting!  We have two options: one model is ready to ship and a second, with a hinged lid, is in prototyping.  Then you can compost your waste to make rich soil.
• Donate $7 and receive our comprehensive composting handbook.
• Donate $20 and then show off your garden gloves with the Speedibin logo.
• Donate $55 and we'll send you an attractive stainless steel kitchen compost pail and lid with the Speedibin logo.
• Share this with everyone in your channels!  Make some noise!  The more people that get into composting, the healthier our world.
With your help, the work will forge ahead, and the more funding the faster we can move.  We are on a mission and your encouragement makes a difference!
Thanks
We so appreciate your support.  You are making a statement and the Earth says ‘Thank you’.

Get a Speedibin and get composting!  We have two options: one model is ready to ship and a second, with a hinged lid, is in prototyping.  Then you can compost your waste to make rich soil.
Donate $7 and receive our comprehensive composting handbook.
Donate $20 and then show off your garden gloves with the Speedibin logo.
Donate $55 and we'll send you an attractive stainless steel kitchen compost pail and lid with the Speedibin logo.
Share this with everyone in your channels!  Make some noise!  The more people that get into composting, the healthier our world.
With your help, the work will forge ahead, and the more funding the faster we can move.  We are on a mission and your encouragement makes a difference!
Thanks
We so appreciate your support.  You are making a statement and the Earth says ‘Thank you’.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign

Our Vision:

We seek to “create a world free of waste,"" by:

1. Promoting eco-friendly resource management

2. Increasing awareness for recycling and waste management, while

3. Mitigating climate change

 

Our Mission:

EcoCare’s mission is to rid rural and urban Ghanaian communities of improper solid and organic waste handling – while providing decent job opportunities. We achieve this by:
• Educating the public on how to reuse, recycle and reduce the waste they produce
• Promoting segregation of waste at homes, offices, institutions and industries
• Recycle solid (plastic, paper, cans, glass and wood) wastes – for reuse
• Convert organic (food scraps, spoilt fruits and vegetables and crop peels) into compost for farmers
• Promote organic farming and environmental protection against agro-toxins
Summary of Challenges Identified to Solve:
• About 1.35 million tonnes of waste comprising 30-40% organics and 30-35% plastics is generated every day in Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, and destroyed at landfills without recycling
• Zoomlion (Ghana’s number one Waste Management Company) alone cannot solve the waste collection challenge for these areas
• Indiscriminate disposal of municipal and industrial waste – creates huge waste management challenge for Zoomlion, Environmental Protection Aagency (EPA) and the Town councils of Ahafo
• Increased pressure on landfills poses threats on our arable land
• Climate change – due to increase Carbon dioxide (CO­­­2) emission from burning of wastes

The Impacts of EcoCare: R3W Education

EcoCare’s Reuse, Recycle and Reduce Waste (R3W) Education is our maiden project to be initiated in 20 communities to reduce waste. The main activities in this R3W Education will be:

• Teach school children basic and effective waste management techniques, 
    - Such as making paper baskets and art sheets from newspapers
column2: fencing with PET and making backpacks from water sachets etc

column1:
• Teach individuals and corporate bodies the proper handling of solid and organic waste
    - E.g. segregation, reuse of papers and how to reduce paper waste in the office
• Collect used plastics, papers, glass and cans from individuals and groups or events which will make our clients earn income, and sever the raw material needs of recycling companies.
• Convert organic waste into manure for sale – for sales for farmers to enrich farmlands

Our History

Members of EcoCare have disciplines and experiences in Environmental Sciences and Resource Management, business management and social works.

Team EcoCare won admission into a SAG-SEED Starter social enterprise business development workshop in July 2016 that was funded by UNDP, UNEP and the European Union. During the first phase of the SAG-SEED Starter workshops, EcoCare emerged second out of fourteen teams in a pitch contest – the vision and confidence of the team members was well demonstrated to audience.

Since then, the team has been teaching people in our communities, basic strategies for plastic, paper and organic waste reuse, and resource management – all aimed at reducing the impact of waste in the environment [see video and photo gallery].

Why we need your support:

We hope to raise $6250 (GHS 25000) as capital through partnerships for the establishment of our enterprise.

This campaign is however, to raise $500 (GHS 2000.00) to cater for logistics and other costs of running the R3W Education program. These include:
a. customised segregation waste bins – for the 20 participating institutions and communities, 
b. safety boots, gloves, and nose masks – for demonstration of communal cleaning,
c. flipcharts and exhibits – for eco-friendly waste management demos in English &
column2:
local languages 
d. transportation costs, 
e. purchasing of organic and plastic wastes from individual households and groups, 
f. radio and print media subscriptions – for public education, 
g. PA systems and posters.
 

Our Long Term View:
EcoCare will become self-sustained after the R3W Education – with revenue generated from sales of recyclable materials and compost, and be able to initiate the rest of its eco-friendly and enterprising waste management projects.

The overall mid and long term expectations of EcoCare are:

a. Building a State-of-the-Art Municipal Waste Collection and Recycling Company in Ahafo
b. Providing between 500-1000 jobs to both educated and non-educated youth
c. Converting up to 60% of all our plastic (solid) waste into useful products – e.g. plastic chairs, water tanks, buckets etc
d. Converting up to 80% of all our organic waste into compost and manure
e. Converting up to 90% of all our faecal waste into biogas – reducing dependence on charcoal and firewood.

Some Perks You will Benefit as a Donor:
a. Every donation you make will be acknowledged with a thank-you mail, SMS or possibly a postcard.

b. We will give out some handmade recycled products (e.g. paper baskets, bottle chairs, etc)
c. We will also give out the “I donated to EcoCare” branded T-shirts major contributors
d. In addition, corporate bodies who donate GHS 500.00 will be acknowledged as sponsors at all R3W Education events, and have their logos on our posters.

The EcoCare project has an overall vision of “creating a world free of waste.” The R3W Education is the first programme to kick start this all important agenda to which everyone in this world is connected. Every dollar or cedi you donate today will go a long way to making us reach this goal together.

Motto: EcoCare! “Don’t Waste Your Waste”

Contact Us:

EcoCare R3W Project Team:

1. Jackson Nyarko (Project Leader) – 0249005270, nyarkojackson@gmail.com

2. Frank Yeboah (Finances) – 0276199710, frankyeb@gmail.com

3. Felix A. Yeboah (Product Design) – 0204554515, fayeb9400@gmail.com

4. Patience Coffie (Marketing) – 0245251045, patiencecoffie87@gmail.com

5. Isaac Ntim (Organising) – 0249210646, ntmisaac@gmail.com

About this Project
WHAT IS FRACKING

Hydraulic Fracturing or ""Fracking"" is where a large rotary drill ""rig"" bores vertically downwards for over a kilometer and then angles the ""rig"" to drill horizontally. The horizontal part of the well is several times larger than the vertical and can expand over great distances (several thousand meters).

Once drilled tanker trucks import approximately ninety million liters of water per day (this is the equivalent of 30 Olympic sized swimming pools). This water is mixed with 200,000 litres of chemicals and several tons of sand. The mixture includes over 600 chemicals which destroy biological organisms and change the liquids properties. The water pressure from this slurry fractures the rocks deep underground which allow ""pathways"" for the oil and gas to escape into the well. 

Once fracked the gas forces its way up to the surface in anyway it can (usually from the main well head). From the well the gas is stored and any fluid is left in pools to condense and release vapors.
WHAT ARE THE SOURCES OF AIR POLLUTION
WHERE WILL MY DONATIONS GO?

This is a funding page to raise funds to help cover Individual and Research costs covering Air Pollution from fracking and its effects on Environmental Health. Note: that as the Research will pass through the peer reviewed process, it will be completely transparent and can only be a fair and balanced appraisal of Air ""Pollution"" from Fracking. 

The research can be broken down into 3 categories:

1.) Much of my research will focus on creating sophisticated and brand new peer reviewed methods for low cost, low power air quality monitoring schemes for fracking wells. 

2.) The results of this monitoring will be displayed using complex graphs and atmospheric simulations to develop an unbiased conceptual model showing exposure routes. 

3.) The ultimate goal of the research project would be to classify and clarify the impact of air pollution on community health and well-being.

Every Dollar/Pound you spend helps fund this research the more I manage to fund raise the more research I will be able to perform. My aspirations for the project if it did really well would be to work with the global community to analyse air pollution from fracking in Australia through to the United States. Simply put, the more money I raise the more research I will be able to do.
About Me

I am Sam Grainger, An Environmental Geologist specializing in Contaminated Land and Environmental Health. I have always had a great love of the outdoors and started collecting minerals and fossils as a young child. Living in the Welsh Valleys, walking was a pursuit I could enjoy often and I began to amass fossils forming my mums rock garden at age 10. As I matured so did my passion, after studying Geology in Sixth Form I went on to read Applied Engineering Geology in the Camborne School of Mines in Cornwall. During my Undergraduate Degree, I won a Scholarship by the Scottish Mining Trust for Academic Excellence. As I went through my course, I began to be interested in contaminated land from industrial and former extractive processes like the Arsenic Calciners which blight the health of Cornish Pasture.

Following graduation, I continued my interests into the site investigation field redeveloping contaminated industrial sites and designing housing estates and large residential and commercial projects for Government and Businesses of all types and sizes. After some time in industry I went back to University to study my Masters in Applied Environmental Geology in Cardiff University. During my masters, I undertook a large project with a range of regulatory bodies evaluating the water quality of a heavily contaminated urban stream through a large Welsh town. This project was voted as a semi-finalist in the National Early Career Geologists Award with the Geological Society of London. During this project I discovered a love for research and led me to the Strathclyde University PhD program.
Previous Projects

I have worked extensively for the Site Investigation and Environmental fields for several years. Most of my work remains confidential however, I have:

● Helped design and undertake Geotechnical and Geo-Environmental Design work on over 1200 homes and businesses. I worked extensively with local councils, businesses and regulators to create an optimal result for all parties concerned.

● Undertaken over 3,000 hours geologically mapping and surveying various parts of the world throughout the UK (England, Scotland and Wales) as well as internationally including New England and Spain (Mainland and Islands).

● I am a Museum Finds Consultant for several museums where I have identified some of Sir Raymond Edward Priestley's rock collection (Shackleton and Scott Antarctic Exhibitions) as well as various stone artifacts.
Risks and challenges
TECHNOLOGY

A major part of this project is to develop new monitoring equipment and monitoring schemes to help detect airborne contamination from Fracking and Diesel Vehicles. This technology will focus upon ultra-low to low cost equipment which could be used and developed into ""Citizen Science"" Air Pollution Surveys. I also intend to see whether drone technology can be utilized in air pollution surveys to understand pollution levels in the low atmosphere. However, there are likely to be limitations of Low Cost equipment compared to more expensive technology. This needs to be borne in mind and accounted for during any pollution survey. This can be done by calibration or through arithmetical corrections or field checking with expensive equipment to ensure an un-bias and fair survey of air quality.
WORKING WITH BUSINESS AND REGULATORS

I intend to approach the main Fracking Companies both here and abroad to ask permission to perform air quality monitoring. If I am successful then I will be able to directly monitor site levels. For the sites I am unsuccessful on accessing directly I will contact the Regulators of Air Quality and see whether I would be able to access there data. I am keen to work with Regulators and Companies themselves, as onsite information would be crucial to developing a fair and balanced appraisal and rule out external forces.
WORKING WITH THE COMMUNITY

In tandem with regulators and businesses I will approach the community where the fracking operations are occurring and seek their permission to create a monitoring network on private householders land. It is my hope that by working with the community it will allow me to measure air pollution on the communities where the largest impact upon long human health would occur.
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people cannot spare any money to donate so here are a few ways you can help with the project:
  
● If you live near a Fracking Well or Fracking Operation please don't hesitate to contact me by email your input is vital to this research project. 

● If your interested in this project please share this project on Facebook together we can ensure Environmental and Community Health from airborne contamination.


REFERENCES

Be the world’s first beekeeper from your couch! Manage and watch your Greek bees work for you and enjoy your high quality, free of chemicals, bee products.
Invest in beekeeping in Greece managing your “own” beehives!
Our story

""My Greek bees"" is a family affair. Our engagement with the bee started purely as a hobby. Along the way, our amazement for this wonderful community, evolved into love and passion. So, we searched and found the best spot to install our apiary
column2: a place with a plethora of honey flowers right next to a lush pine forest, with excellent climatic conditions and plenty of running fresh water.

column1: We want to give to our children, to our friends and our clients the best, pure organic products. So we don’t use any toxic chemicals in any stage of the production. We try to face and win any challenge and problem under the principles of organic beekeeping.
We are fortunate to have the opportunity to have our own apiary and experience all the stages of the work made in a beehive
column2: from the birth of baby-bees, to adulthood, collection of honey, pollen, propolis and royal jelly.

column1: Why couldn’t everyone had this opportunity? This thought was the beginning of the birth of ""my Greek bees"" project.
Why we need your financial support
<ul>

• To enable as many people as possible in the world, wherever they are, to experience the work of a beekeeper and enjoy the products and services of ""my Greek bees"". Anyone will have the opportunity to become a beekeeper from a distance!
• In order for us to expand and have the opportunity to buy more beehives, equip our apiary lab, and get a small truck to carry the beehives wherever nature commands.
• To build a usable web site through which you will be able to enjoy many additional services and manage your hive.
• To build an e-shop so that everyone can buy and enjoy our quality organic bee products.
We have estimated that we need an initial investment of 40.000 € in order to cover the above goals and necessary managerial expenses.
You get to be a beekeeper from your couch
<ul>
• You choose one, two or as many as you like, from the available beehives in our apiary for a specific period of time.

• You will track your swarm from winter to the birth of the Queen in spring, the multiplication of the colony, the first flowering of nature which will lead to the first harvest of the year. You will see, step by step, how the bees put the honey in the hive cells, how they seal it with pure beeswax, and how we remove this wax when the honey is mature and ready for harvest in our laboratory. You will see the honey flowing out of the honey extractor and put in containers with your name, which you will receive in the next few days.

• You and your loved ones will enjoy one of the greatest miracles of Greek nature, honey, as well as pollen and propolis, free from any kind of drugs and chemicals, experiencing the whole process of production at the same time. All this from your own beehives.
• You get your name written on the hive (or hives)
• In the next few days after you have rented your hives, you will receive your first video presentation of your hive and bee population.

• Later, you will receive a new video every time we will be handling the hive and do inspections. Since there is a living organism in the hive, inspections will depend on many factors such as weather conditions for instance. So, we cannot prejudge how many inspections will be made and when. But usually during the months April through October there are usually 3 or 4 inspections per month.
• For every inspection you will receive a video with a description, so that you know everything taking place in your hive.
• You will see the Queen, workers, drones, but also babies just born! You will see your bees carrying freshly collected pollen that you will enjoy in a few days.
• You will see where your bees store your honey! Greek honey, the most important nutritional value worldwide, as well as propolis, which is a most powerful antimicrobial and bactericide product.

• You will get to know the area where the colonies are located and collect nectar, pollen, propolis and also water from the creek adjacent to our apiary. It is an area rich in flowers, with willow trees, Ivy, sunflowers, oregano, corn but also an entire pine forest 200 meters away, giving us the well-known famous Greek pine honey.

<li>In addition to pine and flower honey you can get other flavors as well such as tasty organic chestnut honey, heather honey, oak honey, each one with its own distinct flavor and properties. That's why we transfer some of our colonies at the appropriate time of year to different locations.<u> </u>
<li>

You will be the first person in the world to gain the unique experience and ability, to know where your bees live, where they collect honey from and everything that happens inside the hive. And of course you'll enjoy your pure organic products:
• Pure Organic honey
• Fresh colorful Pollen
• Propolis tincture for antimicrobial use
• Beeswax salve of your choice

column2: >In a quantity that depends on the rental period of your beehive.

column1: • Do you feel like getting a profit out of this? You have the unique opportunity to buy large quantities of the products in wholesale prices. Show people your photos and videos of your Greek bees, and sell them your Greek Organic, tasty products. Be a beekeeper for real!
Take the opportunity and choose one of our Perks now!

FAQ

  • Does the bee hive really belong to me? Will I be able to get it or to do whatever I want with it? Can I really get it somehow?
column2:
>No, the beehive that you rent, belongs to “my Greek bees”. However you will have the opportunity once the rental period finished, to get the beehive that hosted the bees that have worked for you at a cost 60 € plus shipping and to obtain a unique keepsake.

  • How will I be informed about my beehives' progress?
column3:
>We will send you videos as well as photos plus reports about the inspections of your beehives that will take place and the natural landscape of the area around the location of your bees. You'll see how life evolves inside the hive, storing honey, pollen, propolis, the birth of the queen, the process of acquiring a new queen and so much more. You will see the whole honey extraction process and packaging and storage, once we get the honeycombs. Furthermore, you will probably see us loading some beehives of our apiary, including yours,  to the truck and moving them into Chestnut tree forest, or Oak tree forest, or anywhere else nature commands.

  • Can I stop the rental program whenever I want?
column4:
>No. You can just refrain from renewing your subscription for the next period if you wish.

  • Can I paint my hive a specific color or decorate it in any way?
column5:
>We normally put your name on your beehive. But if you wish, with an extra charge of 30 €, we can  paint your beehive in the colors you want, or write something you want on it (your child's name or something that you wish).

My Greek bees"" is a family affair. Our engagement with the bee started purely as a hobby. Along the way, our amazement for this wonderful community, evolved into love and passion. So, we searched and found the best spot to install our apiary
column2: a place with a plethora of honey flowers right next to a lush pine forest, with excellent climatic conditions and plenty of running fresh water.

column1: We want to give to our children, to our friends and our clients the best, pure organic products. So we don’t use any toxic chemicals in any stage of the production. We try to face and win any challenge and problem under the principles of organic beekeeping.
We are fortunate to have the opportunity to have our own apiary and experience all the stages of the work made in a beehive
column2: from the birth of baby-bees, to adulthood, collection of honey, pollen, propolis and royal jelly.

column1: Why couldn’t everyone had this opportunity? This thought was the beginning of the birth of ""my Greek bees"" project.
Why we need your financial support

To enable as many people as possible in the world, wherever they are, to experience the work of a beekeeper and enjoy the products and services of ""my Greek bees"". Anyone will have the opportunity to become a beekeeper from a distance!
In order for us to expand and have the opportunity to buy more beehives, equip our apiary lab, and get a small truck to carry the beehives wherever nature commands.
To build a usable web site through which you will be able to enjoy many additional services and manage your hive.
To build an e-shop so that everyone can buy and enjoy our quality organic bee products.
We have estimated that we need an initial investment of 40.000 € in order to cover the above goals and necessary managerial expenses.
You get to be a beekeeper from your couch
You choose one, two or as many as you like, from the available beehives in our apiary for a specific period of time.

You will track your swarm from winter to the birth of the Queen in spring, the multiplication of the colony, the first flowering of nature which will lead to the first harvest of the year. You will see, step by step, how the bees put the honey in the hive cells, how they seal it with pure beeswax, and how we remove this wax when the honey is mature and ready for harvest in our laboratory. You will see the honey flowing out of the honey extractor and put in containers with your name, which you will receive in the next few days.

You and your loved ones will enjoy one of the greatest miracles of Greek nature, honey, as well as pollen and propolis, free from any kind of drugs and chemicals, experiencing the whole process of production at the same time. All this from your own beehives.
You get your name written on the hive (or hives)
In the next few days after you have rented your hives, you will receive your first video presentation of your hive and bee population.

Later, you will receive a new video every time we will be handling the hive and do inspections. Since there is a living organism in the hive, inspections will depend on many factors such as weather conditions for instance. So, we cannot prejudge how many inspections will be made and when. But usually during the months April through October there are usually 3 or 4 inspections per month.
For every inspection you will receive a video with a description, so that you know everything taking place in your hive.
You will see the Queen, workers, drones, but also babies just born! You will see your bees carrying freshly collected pollen that you will enjoy in a few days.
You will see where your bees store your honey! Greek honey, the most important nutritional value worldwide, as well as propolis, which is a most powerful antimicrobial and bactericide product.

You will get to know the area where the colonies are located and collect nectar, pollen, propolis and also water from the creek adjacent to our apiary. It is an area rich in flowers, with willow trees, Ivy, sunflowers, oregano, corn but also an entire pine forest 200 meters away, giving us the well-known famous Greek pine honey.

In addition to pine and flower honey you can get other flavors as well such as tasty organic chestnut honey, heather honey, oak honey, each one with its own distinct flavor and properties. That's why we transfer some of our colonies at the appropriate time of year to different locations.

You will be the first person in the world to gain the unique experience and ability, to know where your bees live, where they collect honey from and everything that happens inside the hive. And of course you'll enjoy your pure organic products:
Pure Organic honey
Fresh colorful Pollen
Propolis tincture for antimicrobial use
Beeswax salve of your choice
In a quantity that depends on the rental period of your beehive.

Do you feel like getting a profit out of this? You have the unique opportunity to buy large quantities of the products in wholesale prices. Show people your photos and videos of your Greek bees, and sell them your Greek Organic, tasty products. Be a beekeeper for real!
Take the opportunity and choose one of our Perks now!

FAQDoes the bee hive really belong to me? Will I be able to get it or to do whatever I want with it? Can I really get it somehow?No, the beehive that you rent, belongs to “my Greek bees”. However you will have the opportunity once the rental period finished, to get the beehive that hosted the bees that have worked for you at a cost 60 € plus shipping and to obtain a unique keepsake.How will I be informed about my beehives' progress?We will send you videos as well as photos plus reports about the inspections of your beehives that will take place and the natural landscape of the area around the location of your bees. You'll see how life evolves inside the hive, storing honey, pollen, propolis, the birth of the queen, the process of acquiring a new queen and so much more. You will see the whole honey extraction process and packaging and storage, once we get the honeycombs. Furthermore, you will probably see us loading some beehives of our apiary, including yours,  to the truck and moving them into Chestnut tree forest, or Oak tree forest, or anywhere else nature commands.Can I stop the rental program whenever I want?No. You can just refrain from renewing your subscription for the next period if you wish.Can I paint my hive a specific color or decorate it in any way?We normally put your name on your beehive. But if you wish, with an extra charge of 30 €, we can  paint your beehive in the colors you want, or write something you want on it (your child's name or something that you wish).",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Kavala, Greece",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/my-greek-bees--3/pica

column8: >I'm a licensed landscape contractor who cares about our environment.  I got involved when a friend showed me a video of weather systems being intentionally diverted from California.

column1: After seeing several videos on GeoEngineeringWatch.org I bought time on the digital billboard in Rohnert Park CA to wake everyone up about the chemicals being sprayed on us since the mid 1940's.   The chemicals include:  Aluminum, Strontium, Barium, stratospheric sulfate aerosols as well as others.

Then the following 30 days were paid by both myself and another supporter who donated $1,000.  The feedback has been enormous and positive, showing that the sign needs to keep running. If we all pitch in, we can spread the word faster with more impact.
